description: Dr. Harry Sherman, an ophthalmologist who specialized in pediatrics, died yesterday at New York Hospital following a long illness. He was 72 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Chamber: The Cantilena Players
description: THE Cantilena Chamber Players began their second season of concerts at the Guggenheim Museum yesterday afternoon, and the news event of the concert was the first performance of Transformations, a threesong cycle by Robert Starer for mezzosoprano, violin and piano.

title: ESSAY;The MIG's Of April
description: WASHINGTON  We're eyeball to eyeball, John Kennedy's Secretary of State was reported to have said in 1962, and the other fellow just blinked.

title: Cowboys Foil Patriots, Clinch East Title
description: IRVING, Tex., Dec. 3.  The Dallas Cowboys and the New England Patriots, teams that might well meet again in, the Super Bowl in January, played one of those twopart football games today. The first half was all Patriot, except for some faulty fieldgoal kicking; the second was all Cowboy and conclusive.

title: Quake Rocks Area Near Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Dec. 3 (Reuters) An earthquake shook the Izu Peninsula southwest of Tokyo today but there were no reports of damage or casualties. The quake was felt in the capital and in towns along Tokyo Bay. Japan National Railways said its highspeed express trains that travel on a main line just north of the peninsula were stopped automatically when sensors on the track recorded the quake.

title: Esposito, Role Diminished, Has Learned to Adjust
description: IT was a moment of reflection for Phil Esposito. He had once scored more goals in a single season than anyone else in National Hockey League history, and he was currently one of the Rangers' leading pointgetters. But he was playing less under the new coach, and his shots no longer found the net with the frequency he had enjoyed in his prime. And, though he was playing harder, digging into the corners as he never had before. there were the trade rumors.

title: U.S. AGENCIES CLASH OVER STRIP MINING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3  President Carter's insistence on an economic study of Federal environmental control proposals and their effect on inflation is placing two arms of his Administration in strenuous conflict over forthcoming rules to curb the effects of strip mining.

title: Voters in Switzerland Reject Plan to Set Up National Police Force
description: GENEVA, Dec. 3 Swiss voters rejected a plan today that would have created a national police force to fight terrorism and guarantee public order under the direction of the federal Government.

title: Day After Big Melee, the Word Goes Out for Calm
description: All his life, Irving Sussman wanted to travel to Jerusalem. Yesterday he was taken there in a coffin.

title: Pensioner Sues Fund Over City Bonds
description: A retired high school teacher is waging a determined court fight to overturn his pension fund's purchase of New York City bonds amounting to hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: Few Worshipers at Cult's Temple
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 3  Sunday morning services at the People's Temple here, once attended by more than 1.000 followers of the late Rev. Jim Jones, were sparsely attended today.

title: Family Tragedy: Hitler's Germany to Jones's Cult
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 3  Her name was Lisa Philips and she was so beautiful that friends said she looked like Hedy Lamarr. Until she was 20 years old, when she was denied admission to a university in Hamburg, Lisa Philips didn't know what it meant to be Jewish in Germany in 1935.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, DECEMBER 4, 1978

title: Warm Cheers In a Cold Chill
description: ON his way into midtown for the Jets 10th anniversary reunion Saturday night of their Super Bowl III team, Curley Johnson noticed Shea Stadium hovering along the Grand Central Parkway. I got a cold chill when I saw it, said the punter and pundit of that team. Greatest ball park in the world. Greatest fans. And yesterday. at halftime of the Jets 2416 victory over the Baltimore Colts, that team was introduced at Shea Stadium in the cold chill that pro football fans in New Yprk have thrived on  a raw gray day in December with their team a playoff contender.

title: REBEL ACCUSES U.S. OF AIDING RHODESIA
description: MAPUTO, Mozambique, Dec. 3  Robert Mugabe accused the United States today of working in complicity with the British to entrench the Smith regime in Rhodesia. Mr. Mugabe is the leader of the Mozambiquebased rebels fighting against the regime of Rhodesia's Prime Minister, Ian D. Smith.

title: Advertising
description: ON the face of it, theatergoers should make a very desirable advertising audience, with aboveaverage income and education. And, certainly, they are creative consumers. Huntington Hartford must have thought so when he started Show magazine and Hugh Hefner when he began Show Business Illustrated. Whatever became of them, anyway?

title: 6 Killed as Train Cars Plunge Into Ravine in Virginia
description: SHIPMAN, Va., Dec. 3  Six persons were killed and more than 40 injured early today when a Southern Railway passenger train left the tracks in a mountainous area, spilling most of its cars into a ravine.

title: TV SPORTS
description: TONIGHT

title: Americans Who Died in Guyana Are All Reported Embalmed
description: DOVER AIR FORCE BASE, Del., Dec. 3 (UPI)  All 911 bodies of Americans who died in the mass suicidemurders in Guyana, have been embalmed at the Dover Air Force Base mortuary, a State Department spokesman said today.

title: Coco Chapel's Clothes and Jewelry Are Auctioned in London
description: LONDON, Dec. 3  Christie's, the auctioneers, gave a party here last night and sold $117,000 worth of clothes and costume jewelry designed and in some cases worn by the late Gabrielle (Coco) Chanel, the French couturier who changed the way 20thcentury women dressed.

title: Unions Awaiting Carey's Quid Pro Quo
description: New York State's publicemployee unions are hoping to cash in on their support of Governor Carey in last month's election by gaining a more favorable posture for bargaining and more money for the hospitals and schools they serve.

title: Slew at Stud: Courting the Big Money
description: LEXINGTON, KY. FIFTY yards from Seattle Slew's stall at Spendthrift Farm the path leads to a little white building with green trim, a sloping roof and large sliding doors at each end.

title: Tornadoes Hit 3 southern States; At Least 4 Killed and 250 Injured
description: BOSSIER CITY, La., Dec. 3 (AP)  A tornado ravaged this northwest Lousiana city today and other twisters touched down in Arkansas and Mississippi. At least four persons were killed, two of them here, and more than 250 were injured.

title: The Region
description: Sears, Roebuck & Company has agreed to stop sending collection letters implying that customers whose checks are returned for insufficient funds have committed a crime, the New York State Attorney General, Louis J. Lefkowitz, said yesterday.

title: The Editorial Notebook Abortion's Morning After
description: An early and widespread reaction to last month's election was that antiabortion forces had scored an impressive string of victories. They were credited with administering the coup de grace to Senators Dick Clark in Iowa, Edward Brooke in Massachusetts and Floyd Haskell in Colorado, among others. On reflection, however, it seems that the election was in fact as inconclusive on abortion as on most other national issues.

title: G.M. Optimistic on '79 Economy
description: DETROIT, Dec.3 (UPI)  Brushing aside the popular notion of an imminent recession, Thomas A. Murphy, chairman of the General Motors Corporation, predicted today a strong United States economy and record car and truck sales in 1979.

title: U.S. Sloop Wins
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 3 (AP) The United States sloop Iorama led six boats into Rio de Janeiro's harbor today to win the final 380mile leg and the overall championship in the Two Ton yachting championship. The Swedish entry, Midnight Sun, finished a strong second in the race  less than an hour behind the United States entry and took third place in the final standing.

title: Alberta Premier Fights Ottawa's Oil Pricing Policy
description: OTTAWA, Dec. 3  A dispute between the national Government and Alberta over domestic oil prices is the latest in an almost continuous series of conflicts between Ottawa and the 10 provincial governments and among the provinces themselves.

title: Bernard Reis, Executor Of Mark Rothko Estate
description: Bernard Reis, an accountant who amassed considerable wealth and an extensive art collection only to lose much of it as the result of a long and costly dispute with the estate of Mark Rothko, the abstractexpressionist painter, died yesterday of kidney failure. The 83yearold former officer and director of the Marlborough Galleries had been bedridden for the last year at his East 86th Street home.

title: New York City Is Reported to Offer Commitments to Trash Concerns
description: In a move to end the threedayold strike by private sanitation workers, New York City has made commitments to the carting companies that would cut their operating costs and, in turn, allow the companies to offer an increase in wages and fringe benefits, according to the chief state mediator in the contract dispute.

title: Deaths
description: RACHLINHarry. Inc Board or Jewish Education of Greater New York mourns the passing of the beloved husband of our Executive Director of the Office of Family EducationUPTA. Susan Rachlin. We extend our deep sympathy to Ellen and Andrew on the tragic loss of their dear father. May the family be contorted among the mourners of Zion and Jerusalem.

title: Commodities
description: THE Agriculture secretary's job has rarely been a happy one. Last week Bob Bergland toured the nation with two basic messages. Before consumer groups, he cited another bountiful harvest of key foodstuffs corn, wheat and soybeans  promising a slower rise in supermarket prices. Before farm groups, he assured producers that China would buy enough American farm products to offset the expected decline in Soviet purchases this coining year.

title: Maine May Get Pratt Operation
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Dec. 3 (AP)  Pratt & Whitney Aircraft will expand into Maine, bringing at least 1,000 jobs by the end of 1980, if the state grants the aircraft engine giant a corporate tax break, Gov. James B. Langley said last week.

title: Rams Beat Giants
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Dec. 3  Randy Dean, who was practicing at strongside safety 10 days ago, who has often been used as a wide receiver in workouts and who was back to field punts in the first half today, finally became a National Football League quar terbacx, and, no, there are no happy endings this year for the Giants.

title: Eugene Jackson Taylor, Writer in Medical Field
description: Eugene Jackson Taylor, a writer who worked with Dr. Howard A. Rusk, a former medical columnist for The New York Times, died Saturday at Ellis Hospital in Schenectady N.Y. He was 65 years old and lived in Troy, N.Y.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Iran as Viewed From Bazaar, Campus, Slum and Prison
description: TEHERAN. Iran. Dec. 3  In an area known as Teheran Pars, on the eastern edge of this farflung city, live thousands of destitute people who have abandoned their, villages and come to the capital in pursuit of a dream they never found.

title: Moore Sculpture,  Like a Whale, Surfaces in Dallas
description: DALLAS, Dec. 3  I.M. Pei, the architect, and Henry Moore, the sculptor, strode toward the new City Hall that Mr. Pei had designed and turned around to face the threepiece 27,000pound bronze sculpture Mr. Moore had constructed.

title: Deaths
description: ANDERSONAnna H. Of Yonkers, N.Y. On December 2, 1978. Beloved wife of Ole J. Anderson. Friends may call at the Fred H. McGrath & Son Funeral Home. Bronxvllle, N.Y. between the hours of 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 PM Sunday. Service at the funeral home on Monday December 4 at 1:30 PM.

title: Algeria Council Seems To Take Over Control From Ailing President
description: ALGIERS, Dec. 3  For the first time since President Houari Boumediene lapsed into a coma two weeks ago, the eightman Council of the Revolution, which has been quietly exercising real power in the nation, tonight publicly proclaimed that it was a guarantor of revolutionary continuity and stability.

title: Boots in Deal With Hercules
description: Hercules Inc. and the Boots Company of Nottingham, England, said they had agreed in principle to form Joint venture to make and sell agricultural chemicals in North America. The new company is to be named the BootsHercules Agrochemicals Comnany.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE DUEL OF THE GIANTS. CHINA AND RUSSIA IN ASIA. By Drew Middleton. 241 pages. Scribners. $10.95.

title: West: Survivor at Federal's
description: DETROIT, Dec.3  Two years ago, Steven West, a Long Island businessman who described himself as a selfmade multimillionaire, bought control of struggling Federal's Inc., a chain of aging department stores in the Detroit area and vowed to bring it back to life. In spite of an array of gimmicks  not to mention three fires that helped liquidate the stores' inventory  things have not worked out that way..

title: Sporting Gear
description: Ready to take its place with the backyard tennis court and swimming pool is the residential iceskating rink. Because of new developments refrigeration and distribution, such a home rink is now available, providing you can afford the $9,990 price tag, which does not include installation. The system features an Icemat, made up of five, fourfootwide grids that can be rolled out for 50 feet to circulate ethylene glycol brine, the freezing component. With the refrigeration module, or chiller, all you need are a flat surface (20 feet by 50 feet), your house current (normal usage is about 100 kilowatthours a day), some flexible tubing and cold weather. The rest of the package provides the necessary insulation, edging, rink liner and brine. The system is of modular design, so that if 20 by 50 is not big enough you can buy two and try 40 by 50. (But remember that now you're getting up to around $20,000.) The rink is available at E.L. Wagner Company stores in the metropolitan area. Or order directly from the manufacturer, Devoe Sports Systems, 800 Eastern Avenue, Carlstadt, N.J. 07072, (201) 9352300.

title: Victoria de los Angeles Wins Prolonged Ovation
description: THE ovation that greeted Victoria de los Angeles before she had sung a note of her recital last night at Avery Fisher Hall was not only warm and prolonged but touched with fanaticism. The Spanish soprano's admirers always were among the most vociferous to be found anywhere and now there is almost an air of defiance to their cheers. Listen, they seemed to be saying, we want it understood that time does not pass for great artists, nor for those who live for art.

title: 5 Fisherman Rescued Off Coast
description: LITTLE COMPTON, R.I., Dec. 3 (AP)  The Coast Guard rescued five Rhode Island fishermen yesterday after their 65foot boat sank suddenly off Block Island. The five scrambled into a small boat and were rescued three hours later by the Coast Guard. The accident occurred two days after a tugboat went down off Sakonnet Point with two men aboard. The Coast Guard has located the wreck of the tug, but its two crewmen, Joseph Rua and William Pedro of New Bedford, Mass., are presumed drowned.

title: 3 Arrested in Murder in Brooklyn That Led to HasidimPolice Melee
description: A 20yearold Brooklyn man and two youths were charged yesterday in the fatal stabbing of a 65yearold plumber who was on his way home from a Jewish Sabbath service early Saturday. The murder led to violent fighting that afternoon between angered Hasidic residents, who demanded greater police protection, and officers at the Borough Park police station.

title: Washington Honors 5 in the Arts
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3  As legendary and luminous figures from the musical comedy, opera, the dance, theater, film and classical music streamed into the John F. Kennedy Center tor the Performing Arts in their blacktie finery this evening, one became convinced that footlights across the countryside must be dimmedand Broadway dark. For the entire performing arts community appeared to have gathered for one momentous sentimental evening under one roof.

title: G.T.E. Sale To Continental
description: JOHNSTOWN. N.Y., Dec. 3 (AP) Continental Telephone has acquired two subsidiaries of the General Telephone and Electronics Corporation.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: ShaggyDog Story: Making of a Budget
description: Punctuated by the cartoon comments of a little shaggy dog, advice on how to cope with the massive municipal budget is being read by 3,000 New Yorkers who need to know the message behind the numbers.

title: 110 Voices Offer Salute To Christmas
description: FOR over 50 years, Spelman a Morehouse Colleges of Atla  the latter being the al mater of the Rev. Dr Man Luther King Jr.  have combined the respective glee clubs for an ann Christmas concert This year the 1 voice choir has brought the ev north, and it took place Sunday afternoon at Avery Fisher Hall.

title: $145 Million Trim Urged By O.M.B. in Amtrak Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 The Office of Management and Budget, in a preliminary move, proposes to trim Government assistance to Amtrak next year by almost $145 million, Government officials indicated today.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: BorgWarner Corporation, Chicago, a widely diversified manufacturer, has named Jerry E. Dempsey and Elmer D. Robinson executive vice presidents.

title: Deaths
description: INSELBUCHBlanche. Fifth Avenue Synagogue records with deep sorrow the death of our esteemed member, sister of our deer members Sabina Ckin, Frieda Pauker, aunt of Charlotte Feverstein. To the entire family we express our heartfelt sympathy. Adolph A. Kreitman, Pres. Herry Hirsch, Chairman The Presidium

title: Switch Made In Farm Bonds
description: The Farm Credit System, an alliance of 37 Governmentsponsored banks that lend to agriculture, will begin this month to sell only consolidated, systemwide securities instead of bonds of the Banks for Cooperatives, the Intermediate Credit Banks and the Land Banks individually.

title: Dessoff Choir: Monteverdi and Schtz
description: THE Dessoff Choirs's concert Sunday night at Alice Tully Hall of music by Monteverdi and Schiitz was a serious and refined event. And unlike some concerts to which those adjectives could be applied, this was never a precious or bloodless affair. The musicmaking was simultaneously faithful to the composers and full of the most affecting musicality.

title: United Appears Winner
description: Barring further court action, the United Technologies Corporation appeared yesterday to have accomplished the takeover of the Carrier Corporation, the world's leading manufacturer of air conditioners.

title: Mayor Will Not Attempt to Stop A Kibbee Ouster
description: Mayor Koch said yesterday that because of Dr. Robert J. Kibbee's absolutely uncooperative spirit in the past,. he would not attempt to prevent Governor Carey from seeking to remove him as Chancellor of the City University of New York.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: A Knife in the Heart By a Youthful Mugger Ends a Fashion Career
description: About 10:45 Sunday night, Irene Maxwell, a 31yearold Scottish fashion designer, and her business partner crossed the corner of Hudson and Leonard Streets in Tribeca, south of Soho, on the way to Puffy's Tavern, a ramshackle bar they had visited a few times since coming to New York .a month ago. They were half block from their destination when two young men approached and asked for money. Rebuffed by the women, one youth plunged a knife through Miss Maxwell's coat and into her heart, killing her, the partner recalled yesterday.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Jack Nash, president of Oppenheimer & Company Inc.. was named chairman of the board of the New York investment firm yesterday. He replaces Leon Levy, who continues as a senior partner. Mr. Nash, who has been with Oppenheimer since its inception. will continue as chief executive officer.

title: How to Cheapen Baseball
description: In a laudable effort to extend the baseball season Thanksgiving and leave the club owners richer than Pete Rose, the powers, principalities and archangels of the game are considering a plan to restructure the major leagues so that almost every team can be a winner, or look like one.

title: RCA to Rush 3d Satellite; Sees Profit Early in 1979
description: In an effort to keep up with cable television's growing demand for distribution of programs by satellite, RCA is planning to orbit a third domestic satellite early next December, about a year ahead of its original schedule, the company announced yesterday.

title: Egypt Plans to Abandon. 2Tier Exchange Rate
description: CAIRO, Dec. 4  Egypt is abandoning its twotiered foreignexchange rate next month, according to Government officials, as the final step in a gradual, 12year devaluation of the Egyptian Pound.

title: A MiddleoftheRoad Negotiator
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4  Dianne Feinstsein has been so prominent in local politics here for the past decade that her election as Mayor today seemed like a normal progression in her public life.

title: Advertising
description: HIGH up on the stickywicket list of corporations is sex and violence on television. Just because certain executives don't believe a show contains excessive sex or violence doesn't mean blocks of viewers won't. An independent screening company retamed by an ad agency may declare a series inoffensive, but an advertiser can still get a barrage of mail from angry consumers.

title: New Envoy of Peking Departs for Vietnam; Better Relations Seen
description: PEKING, Dec. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)  China gave the first hint today of an improvement in relations with Vietnam by announcing the departure for Hanoi of a new Chinese ambassador.

title: Kahn's Ire On State Pay Grows
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 4 Alfred E. Kahn, expanding the Administration's criticism of pay rises that state legislators have voted for themselves, said today that if such raises exceeded President Carter's wageprice guidelines they amounted to aggression against all of us.

title: Malaysians Drop Ban On Refugee Landings
description: KUALA TRENGGANU, Malaysia, Dec. 4 (UPI)  Malaysian officials, reacting to the drownings of more than 160 refugees from Vietnam whose boats have capsized off the coast, decided today to abandon the policy of barring such refugees from coming ashore.

title: French Get Trade Pact With China
description: PARIS, Dec. 4  France and China today concluded a longterm trade agreement for a potential $13.6 billion of exchanges through 1985 that is said to put the French in a favored position visavis other European nations and the United States in the competition for newly opened Chinese markets.

title: SMALL LOAN AGENCY ASSAILED BY PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Only 30 of 3,400 concerns that have received aid in the last 10 years under the Small Business Administration's program to assist minority businessmen in developing their own companies are known to still be in operation.

title: SEX FRATERNIZATION CURBED IN THE ARMY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)  The Army has ordered a crackdown on sexual fraternization between male and female soldiers of different rank because of an increasing number of incidents of snappropriate relationships.

title: U.S. Qualifies Its Approval
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)  A State Department spokesman said today that the United States was obviously gratified by South Africa's announcement that no bower would be handed over to the winners of the current elections in SouthWest Africa. But, the spokesman, Nodding Carter 3d, stressed that Washington was still waiting for South Africa to take the critical step of accepting the United Nations Plan for an independent Namib ia.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Randy Dean Takes Over Giants' Quarterback Job
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Dec. 4  Saying beggars can't be choosers, Randy Dean took over as the Giants quarterback today.

title: NUCLEAR PLANT FOES DISPUTE QUAKE DATA
description: AVILA BEACH, Calif., Dec. 4  Opponents of a billiondollar nuclear power plant that is awaiting a Federal operating permit said today that scientific data had been distorted to prove that it would be safe if a major earthquake occurred.

title: Parole Board Adopts New Guidelines
description: The New York State Board of Parole, engaged in a fight for its survival, has adopted a controversial set of guidelines that are expected to lead to significantly longer prison terms.

title: Africans at U.N. Ask Sanctions
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Dec. 4 (Reuters)  African members of the United Nations circulated a working paper today with proposals for mandatory sanctions against South Africa in reprisal for the holding of elections this week in SouthWest Africa.

title: Neiaborhood Playhouse Turns 50, and the Stars Turn Out
description: Arthur Miller danced a wild jitterbug with Zoe Caldwell to 40's swing music on the third floor of Macy's Sunday night. He even waved fits fingers in the air the way the 40's hepcats used to do. Not far away. Eli Wallach pretended to hold a conversation with a department store dummy. And Sandy, the $450aweek mutt from the Broadway musical Annie, lay snoozing near the Cacharel collection.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: GREENSBORO, N.C., Dec 4 (Reuters)  Blue Bell Inc. said today that it planned to sign a science and technology agreement with the Soviet Union in what could lead to the manufacture of Wranglers jeans in that country.

title: Emergency Phone Listed To Get Garbage Removed
description: City officials have set up a special telephone number so that instances where garbage has piled up and created health or safety hazards can be reported.

title: Market Place
description: WHEN T. Rowe Price talks about stocks, he bases his comments on 60 years experience  stretching back 18 years before he set up the $2 billion mutual fund organization that bears his name.

title: Cult Leader's Papers Indicate Links to U.S. Embassy
description: JONESTOWN, Guyana, Dec. 4 (AP)Senior aides of the cult leader, Jim Jones, maintained much closer relationships with United States Embassy consular officials in Georgetown, Guyana, than has so far been officially acknowledged, Mr. Jones's personal papers indicate.

title: Stratton Expected to Be Chairman Of New York Congressional Group
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Representative Samuel S. Stratton, an upstate New York Democrat and a leading proponent of military spending, is expected to be chosen chairman of the state's Congressional Delegation tomorrow.

title: Defendant in Rapes Found Insane
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 4  William Stanley Milligan, a 23yearold Lancaster man whom psychiatrists here found to have 10 distinct personalities, was found not guilty today by reason of insanity on nine criminal charges.

title: Deaths
description: DICKINSONMary H., In Beverly. Mass on Dec 2, formerly of 151 E. 80 St, NYC, widow of Howard C. Dickinson, survived by two grandsons Howard C. Dickinson, Jr. of Center Conway, N.H. and W. K. Read Dickinson of Yarmouth, Maine and five greatgrandthildren. Memorial services will be held Tuesday, Dec 5 at 2PM at the Church of Heavenly Rest, 90 St and 5th Ave, NYC. Relatives and friends invited.

title: This Way to the Exit
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J.Now that the 1978 elections have passed into history and the embargo on inside information that might have been damaging to reputations and careers has been lifted, it's possible to divulge the contents of a littleknown (and, possibly, nonexistent) publication, Secrets of Losing Politics.

title: Heathrow Travelers Are Warned
description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (AP)  Travelers planning to fly out of Heathrow Airport in the next three weeks were warned today not to giftwrap their presents. Because of strict preflight security, the British Airports Authority said, presents subject to a search will have to be opened if they are wrapped in festive paper.

title: New York's Crucial Moment
description: President Carter has told the nation's mayors that he plans no major new inititatives for the financial relief of their hardpressed cities, the Federal establishment finding itself as hardpressed as they. Nowhere should this reaffirmation be greeted more soberly than in New York at this crucial moment.

title: Union Girds for Guidelines
description: DENVERAt the 6 & 85 Lounge, at the freeway intersections near the refinery, big Rollie Fahrenbruch speaks his mind about the 7 percent wage guidelines:

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 4 (AP)  Punch Imlach, general manager of the Buffalo Sabres, and Coach Marcel Pronovost were dismissed today in a move that the front office said was taken in the best interests of the team and its fans. No replacements were immediately named.

title: U.S. Criticizes Soviet As Trade Talks Open
description: MOSCOW, Dec 4 (UPI)  United States officials opened a week of intensive trade talks today with a stinging protest against alleged Soviet mistreatment of an American businessman and then cut the red tape holding up a $65 million sale of vital oilfield equipment to the Russians.

title: NEW UNITED FRONT ASSAILS PHNOM PENH
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 4  The Vietnamesesupported Cambodian United Front for National Salvation broadcast today a political program calling for a complete dismantling of the extremist Communist state created since 1975 by the regime of Prime Minister Pol Pot.

title: Bache Issues Shares
description: The Bache Group Inc., parent of Bache Halsey Stuart Shields, yesterday authorized the issuance of an additional 700,000 shares of Its common stock for use in purchasing insurance brokerage firms. Harry A. Jacobs Jr., chairman, said that the shares would be utilized in the company's diversification program that began with the purchase of the Albert M. Bender Company, a San Franciscobased insurance brokerage concern. Mr. Jacobs noted that Bache was holding discussions with nine such firms now and expected to acquire at least six of them by the end of the company's fiscal year on July 31,1979.

title: Welch to Take Charge of External Affairs at Du Pont
description: Charles E. Welch, general counsel of E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Company, has been named vice presidentexternal affairs, effective Jan. 1. Extegnal affairs at Du Pont encompass advertising, general services and the legal and public affairs departments. John F. Schmutz will succeed him as director of the legal department, but Mr. Welch will continue as general counsel. Mr. Schmitz was also named associate general counsel.

title: MOSCOW CONDUCTOR DEFECTING TO WEST
description: AMSTERDAM, Dec. 4 (AP)  One of the foremost Soviet symphony conductors went into hiding in the Netherlands today and asked for residency on the ground that his artistic freedom was being stifled at home, friends said.

title: Phone Problems Snarl Carter's Radio Project
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)  Mechanical problems ruined the debut today of taped radio spots that the White House was providing free for some 600 stations around the country. Only one caller got through in the first 18 hours of operation.

title: Many Sent Abroad By 2Year Colleges
description: BARRY KORNFELD, a 19yearold from Hayerstraw. N.Y., enrolled at Rockland Community College in September 1977. But he is only now getting acquainted with campus life here, for he spent his first college year in Israel.

title: Notes on People
description: What he called nearcatastrophe struck Lester Bowie, the celebrated trumpet player, yesterday morning, but thanks to New York's Finest, his total unhappiness was shortlived. The detective story he told was filled with admiration for quick police work on the part of two officers, John Pagano and Joseph Fusaro, of the 78th Precinct in Brooklyn. Let Mr. Bowie tell the story:

title: France Again Warns Iranian Exile Leader Against Exhortations
description: PARIS, Dec 4 (Reuters)  The French Goverment issued a warning today to Ayatollah Khomeiny, an exiled Iranian religious leader, following his call to Iranian troops yesterday to desert the Shah.

title: STRIKERS AGAIN CUT IRANIAN OIL OUTPUT
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 4  Renewed strikes and work stoppages by thousands of workers who oppose the Shah reportedly slashed production in Iran's oilfields by 30 percent today in a major blow to the military Government. Here in Teheran, guerrillas attacked a police station with machine guns and hand grenades, killing one policeman and wounding two.

title: N.B.A. Support Growing To Build a Farm System
description: A plan for National Basketball Association's rust farm system is gaining strong support, among owners and general managers.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: BEGIN SAID TO OFFER MORE NEGOTIATIONS ON OCCUPIED AREAS
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 4  Prime Minister Menachem Begin sent a message today to President Anwar elSadat of Egypt, reportedly affirming that Israel would not renegotiate the peace treaty draft it had accepted but would be willing to talk about accompanying letters dealing with Gaza and the West Bank.

title: About New York An Epic Reading, Out of an Epic Life
description: He has warmed up the snug tavern on West 72d Street with a tale of death in the Great Hall, and now the gentleman with the magnificent speaking voice leans across the wine and begins the grand words that summarize two odysseys. his own and Homer's:

title: TV: Sally Struthers in NBC Film On Husband Missing in Vietnam
description: BECAUSE Sally Struthers and Tony Musante have done at least adequate work in other ventures, let's be charitable and place the responsibility elsewhere for their poor performances in My Husband Is Missing, a madefortelevision film that will be shown from 9 to 11 o'clock tonight on NBCTV

title: Leveling May Be Ahead In Auto Insurance Rates
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4  For the first time in decades, a fundamental change in the criteria that auto insurers use in setting insurance premiums is gathering momentum.

title: Jersey Chemical Workers Strike
description: BOUND BROOK, N.J., Dec. 4 (UPI) Chemical workers at the American Cyanamid plant in this small Somerset County community struck the company last night after negotiations on a new contract broke down. The strike was called by Local 111 of the International Chemical Workers Union, which represents 1,300 employees at the plant.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: UP AND AT 'EM The December cover of Skyline, a monthly calendarmagazine listing exhibitions, lecturres and events in architecture and design, many of them free, is an earthy reminder of its value to the many New Yorkers interested in the field. It shows a realistic photograph of an elderly man seated alone on an East Side rooftop and looking pensive, one hand cupping his bearded chin; behind him looms the Queensborough Bridge. The cover identifies him as Henri Matisse, circa 1930, and cites the show of the master's works now at the Museum of Modern Art.

title: 3 JUSTICES DEPLORE CASELOAD OF COURT
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 4  Three Supreme Court Justices warned today that the Court was becoming dangerously overburdened by the growth in its caseload. Their statements, unusual in that they were appended to the Court's regular weekly orders list, appeared calculated to renew a longsimmering debate over creation of a new national appellate court to share the High Court's workload.

title: A Little Shop Goes Big in the City
description: It started as a small, sedate clothing store in New Haven, Conn., 25 years ago.. Soon there were shops in Boston and other New England towns. But it wasn't until 1973 that Ann Taylor opened its first branch in New York City.

title: The City
description: Nathan Giles was arraigned yesterday in a secondfloor prison ward at Bellevue Hospital before Acting Justice Milton Williams and was remanded without ball on the charge of attempted murder of a police officer.

title: Talking Business
description: Three weeks ago the Mellon Bank, the largest commercial bank in Pittsburgh, became the first of many banks to offer loans to small businesses at a lower interest rate than the prime rate, which the bank charges its largest, most creditworthy corporate customers. Under the new lending structure. businesses with assets of $1.5 million or less are charged a base rate that is 1 percentage points below the prime rate. The program is patterned on the twotier prime rate system developed by the Nixon Administration during the 197374 credit squeeze. Craig G. Ford, senior vice president in charge of the Mellon Bank's metropolitan division, recently talked about the factors behind its decision.

title: Pan Am Plans to Buy Land Under Its Park Ave. Tower
description: Pan American World Airways, the nation's largest international air carrier, announced plans yesterday to purchase for $25 million the land under its office building at 200 Park Avenue from the Penn Central Corporation. It also reaffirmed its intentions to keep its world headquarters in New York and to expand its work force in the city.

title: Music: Swiss Octet Plays at Museum
description: ACOMMON complaint about modem performances of Haydn, Mozart and Beethoven is that the playing is so slickly efficient that the music loses pungency and personality. No one could register such complaints abolit Saturday night's performances by II Divertimento at the Metropolitan Museum.

title: Deaths
description: Alzer, Edward

title: 86Year History of Cathedral's Construction
description: The champagne toasting of the latest construction plans for the Cathedral of St. John the Divine yesterday marked another milestone in the 86year history of attempts to solve the various architectural, religious and economic problems surrounding the project.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Meets at 3 P.M. on the question of Namibia and on the application of Dominica for United Nations membership

title: GEORGE BOWIE McCENEY
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 4 (AP)  George Bowie McCeney, a lawyer and publisher of the weekly newspaper, The News Leader, died at his home here over the weekend. He was 74 years old.

title: Miss Myerson Denies Planning Senate Race
description: Bess Myerson denied yesterday a report in The New York Times that she had decided to seek the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate in 1980 and that she had started making preparations for ??e campaign.

title: Construction of Cathedral of St. John Will Resume
description: Bishop Paul Moore Jr. of the Episcopal Diocese of New York, describing the Cathedral of St. John the Divine as a symbol and rallying place in our sorely beset city, announced yesterday that, after a 37year hiatus, construction would resume on the world's largest Gothic structure.

title: Jordan and Rahhoon Said to Back Pentagon Head  in Debate Over Budget
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  A major debate over military spending next year is under way in the White House, with key political advisers supporting Defense Secretary Harold Brown's efforts to increase the defense budget 3 percent beyond normal inflationary growth while domestic and fiscal advisers oppose the plan, Administration sources said today.

title: Resorts Stock Trades Suspended in Report's Wake
description: Resorts International stock, which rose from less than $7 a share early this year to a high of $70 in September, in anticipation of huge earnings from its Atlantic. City casino, plunged yesterday after New Jersey's Attorney General recommended that the company not be granted a permanent license.

title: Chicago Aldermen Unrepentant
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4  Chicago's aldermen postponed action today on their proposed 60 percent pay increase but not because of any embarrassment over criticism from the Carter Administration. The 50member City Council simply put off until next week consideration of the entire 1979 budget.

title: Output of Steel Rose in Week
description: Steel production rose to 2.7 million tons for the week ended Dec. 3, up eighttenths of 1 percent from the 2.678 million tons of the week before, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: TV: Psychic Phenomena Surveyed by ABC News
description: IN The Mysterious World of the Supernational: Fact, Fraud or Faith?, tonight at 10 o'clock, ABC News sees itself probing America's growing enchantment with assorted psychic phenomena: reincarnation, psychic healing and even fortune telling. The inquiry, however, turns out to be little more than a survey punctuated with appropriate warnings.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Survival Fears Perade LTVLykes Merger
description: It is, at best, a beginning. At worst, the beginning of the end.

title: F.B.I. Reportedly Has Warrants For Suspects in Murder of Ryan
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4  The Federal Bureau of Investigation has obtained sealed arrest warrants for a number of persons it believes were involved in the murder of Representative Leo J. Ryan, according to Federal law enforcement sources.

title: OBSERVER
description: Scenario 1: Wang awakens at 2 A.M. and rises. His wife stirs. What's the idea getting up at 2 A.M.?. his wife asks. The thought of Chairman Mao favors eight hours sleep.

title: Rates Increase On Mortgages
description: Interest rates on home mortgages moved upward again yesterday, the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corpo. ration reported as it disclosed the results of its weekly purchase of residential loans. The average weighted yield on the mortgages it bought rose to 10.38 percent from 10.32 percent last week.

title: Rep. William A. Steiger, Hailed As New G.O.P. Hope, Dies at 40
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Representative William A. Steiger, Republican of Wisconsin, who was widely regarded as one of the most promising political figures in his party. died at his home here this morning of a heart attack. He was 40 years old.

title: Billy Graham, on Satan and Jonestown
description: SINGAPOREThe tragedy in Guyana that has shocked the world is complicated and painful reminder of the words of the great Jewish Prophet Jeremiah, who said, The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately wicked: who can know it? (Jeremiah 17:9). And it is a reminder of the warning of Jesus: For many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ; and shall deceive many (Mark 13:6).

title: San Francisco Supervisors Pick Mrs. Feinstein as Acting Mayor
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4  Dianne Feinstein was selected today by fellow members of the Board of Supervisors to be the 38th Mayor of San Francisco. She will serve until the end of next year.

title: Deaths
description: SEIDRobert, died December 2. 1978. Beloved son of Rose and Joseph Seidelman. Graveside services Wednesday, December 6. 1978, of 3 PM. Ceder Park Cemetery, Paramus. New Jersey. For information. The Riverside, 76 St & Amsterdam Ave.

title: Senator Byrd Discusses Mideast With Syrian Figures in Damascus
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Dec. 4 (Reuters) Senator Robert C. Byrd discussed Mideast issues with Syrian leaders tonight shortly after arriving from Amman, Jordan. as Dart of a tour of the Middle East.

title: Nets Overcome Lakers With Basket at Buzzer
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Dec. 4 (AP)George Johnson's slamdunk follow shot at the buzzer gave the New Jersey Nets a 107105 National Basketball Association victory over the Los Angeles Lakers last night.

title: Ola Tunji, Band At Gate
description: OLATUNJI, the Nigerian percussionist who played an important role in the jazz of the 1980's as an instrumentalist, a teacher and an exponent of African rhythms and culture, is leading a new band at the Top of the Gate, Bleecker and Thompson Streets, through Thursday.

title: President Is to Attend Beatme Dinner Tonight
description: President Carter and Ada will be the principal attractions tonight at a $2,500acouple fundraising dinner and opera for former Mayor Abraham D. Beame at the Metropolitan Opera House.

title: Theater: Buried Child Returns
description: SAM SHEPARD's play Buried Child, which was widely praised in its recent production by the Theater for the New City, will return tonight. The production is beginning an indefinite run at the Theater de Lys.

title: New Attention on Autopsies
description: DOVER AIR FORCE BASE, Del., Dec. 4The Federal Government's reluctant decision to perform autopsies on the bodies of the Rev. Jim Jones and six of his followers has focused attention on postmortem examinations done for medicallegal reasons. Such autopsies often have produced surprising findings about causes of death. Sometimes, they have detected evidence of previously unsuspected disease that shed new light on an individual's behavior or on the events preceeding his death. Sometimes, the evidence is at variance with theories of a death based on information from people with only limited knowledge of an individual or his death.

title: Opposition Wins Venezuela Vote, Charging Oil Money Was Misspent
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Dec. 4  The candidate of Venezuela's opposition Social Christian Party won yesterday's presidential elections in a vote that appeared to reflect growing dissatisfaction among voters over the use of the country's oil wealth.

title: Dividends
description: MONDAY, DEC. 4. 1978

title: U.S. Delays EgyptianIsraeli Talks In Effort to Arrange Compromises
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  The United States has delayed an early meeting of Egyptian and Israeli negotiators and is concentrating instead on behindthescenes diplomatic efforts to arrange compromises on the two major issues holding up the EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WINDHOEK, SouthWett Africa Shortly after five Western foreign ministers worked out a compromise with South Africa on elections for an independent Namibia  still called

title: An Attorney for People's Temple Files Court Papers to Dissolve It
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 4  A petition to dissolve the 13yearold California corporation known as the People's Temple of the Disciples of Christ was filed this afternoon in Superior Court here.

title: European Bloc May Stress Gold
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 4 the new currency bloc being started by Western European nations at a highlevel meeting that opened here today threatens to halt and perhaps reverse the United states campaign to reduce the monetary importance of gold, according to oficials and bankers.

title: S.E.C. Issues Ruling on Pay
description: WASHINGTON. Dec 4As expected, the Securities and Exchange Commission issued rules today to require more tap corporate executives to disclose bow much they are paid in salaries and perquisites.

title: Museum Is Under Inquiry On Trade of Costly Object
description: State Attorney, General Louis J. Lefkowitz said last night that his office was investigating allegations that the Metropolitan Museum of Art had traded a costly, jadecoated Chinese incense burner to a relative of its original donor for a halfdozen pieces of Oriental art, which have a combined value that is a fraction of what the incense burner is worth.

title: Mortgage RateRise Plan Gains Support in Albany
description: ALBANY, Dec. 4  Governor Carey and legislative leaders moved closer to agreement today on a bill to increase the state's homemortgage interest rate as Republicans yielded to some Democratic demands for tough controls on redlining but continued to hold reservations on others.

title: Frontiers: Physics The Search For Zero
description: PERHAPS because life is ephemeral, there is a special fascination about absolutesthose mysterious values, ultimate and immutable, that frame the limits of existence and the universe. Even children are drawn to superla tives, and for scientists there is an equivalent fascination about such ideas as the absolute zero of temperature.

title: Irish Five Romps By 10561
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Dec. 4 (AP)Bruce Flowers scored 17 points tonight as Notre Dame, reeling off 19 straight points in one stretch, overwhelmed Rice, 10561, in college basketball.

title: U.S. Tries to Allay Fear of Island Research
description: PLUM ISLAND. N.Y.

title: Science Watch
description: Although nothing short of brute force may seem adequate to kill cockleaches, certain insecticides are effective, and researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology have discovered a new point of vulnerability that makes the insect susceptible to such chemicals as nicotine and a newly synthesized isothiocyanate compound.

title: Voyagers' Pottery Raises New Questions
description: THE widespread discovery on Western Pacific islands of intricately decorated pottery produced by a voyaging culture some 3,000 years ago has raised new questions concerning the origins of the Polynesians and their cousins, the Micronesians.

title: Jersey's Attorney General Objects To the Licensing of Resorts Casino
description: TRENTON, Dec. 4  The State Attorney General said today that Resorts International, which opened Atlantic City's first casino under a temporary license last May, should be denied a permanent license because of what he said were its criminal associations.

title: Blazers to Test McMillian
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 4 (AP)The Portland Trail Blazers have offered a twoday tryout to Jim McMilHan, who played out his option with the New York Knicks last season and has been a free agent.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and forwarded to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10249, or to any of the following organizations:

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Congress should repeal a controversial law the controls wages paid to workers on Federal construction contracts, according to a report by the General Accounting Office that is being considered by the Carter Administration. The law in question is the DavisBacon Act, which has been criticized for keeping construction wages higher than necessary and therefore adding to inflation. [Page D1.]

title: Israel Tears Down West Bank Houses
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 4  Israeli forces cordoned two villages in the occupied West Bank before daybreak today and bulldozed houses where two Arabs detained as terrorists had lived with their families.

title: Sonics' LaGarde Out for Season
description: SEATTLE, Dec. 4 (AP) Tom LaGarde, the Seattle SuperSonics center, is likely to be out the rest of the regular National Basketball Association season after undergoing surgery, doctors said today.

title: Columbia Names Sovern Provost
description: Michael I. Sovern, dean of Columbia University's Lair School and the youngest person ever to be given a full professorship at the school, was mined provost and vice president for academic affairs at Columbia University yesterday.

title: Three Die in Illinois Plane Crash
description: WHEELING, Ill., Dec. 4 (UPI)  A singleengine plane crashed into a wooded area near Palwaukee Airport yesterday, killing three people and critically injuring another. The Beechcraft Bonanza had been cleared for landing but crashed about a half mile south of the runway, a spokesman for the Federal Aviation Administration said.

title: Treasury Bills Show a Decline
description: Rates on threemonth and sixmonth Treasury bills declined yesterday from their levels a week ago.

title: Obituary 7 -- No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO 3543900 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. FOR WEEKDAY EDITIONS. UNTIL 2:30 P.M. ON SATURDAY FOR SUNDAY EDITION. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY; NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900: WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO, (51??) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (51??) 6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: Pioneer Begins Study of Venus
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW Calif.

title: Dutch Court Frees Millionaire in War Crimes Case
description: THE HAGUE, Dec. 4 (AP)  A 79yearold Dutch millionaire art collector, convicted of killing Jews while serving with German forces in the invasion of the Soviet Union in World War II, was freed today after a court had reversed his conviction of last December.

title: Lafayette Radio Talks
description: The Lafayette Radio Electronics Corporation said yesterday that it had terminated negotiations with the Harrison Radio Corporation over Harrisons proposed purchase of Lafayette's industrial and marine subsidiaries and Lafayette's convertible notes.

title: Reds' Former Star to Announce His Choice Today
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 4  All four teams left in the Pete Rose pursuit acknowledged today that they had lost out in the bidding for him, leaving the indication that the Philadelphia Phillie, selfadmitted losers last week, had quietly reentered the chase and were the winners.

title: Borough Park Getting Extra Police; Murder Denounced at Grand Jury
description: The fatal stabbing in Borough Park on Saturday of a 65yearold man going home from a synagogue was described in court yesterday as having shocked the conscience of the community. Meanwhile, longsought extra police were assigned to the largely Jewish area in southern Brooklyn.

title: Dierking's Return Helps Tie Jets' Rushing Mark
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Dec. 4  It was only natural that Scott Dierking should have been a little nervous for yesterday's 2416 victory over the Baltimore Colts in Shea Stadium. It was a big game and day for the Jets in terms of their playoff hopes and became the Super Bowl III team was honored at halftime.

title: Deaths
description: AIZEREdward. Beloved famer on Donald, Robert and Vivian Kolienscher. Devoted brother of Rachel Aizer. Helm, Charles, Joseph, Judah, Salim. Services today at 12:15, The Riverside, 76 St and Amsterdam Ave.

title: Alliance for American Song in Concert;
description: THE Alliance for American Song presented a most interesting event Saturday afteroon at Carnegie Recital Hall  interesting both in itself and as an almost didactic exercise in illustrating different approaches to the musical setting of song texts.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: EDUCATION
description: WHAT was once a debate over expanding access to higher education is fast becoming a controversy over maintaining standards.

title: Football Foundation Honors ScholarAthletes
description: Two years ago, when Joseph William Restic, then a sophomore at Notre Dame, was establishing himself as a fine defensive back and punter, the son of Harvard's head football coach, Joseph Restic, was asked why he had chosen to attend Notre Dame instead of Harvard. It was reported that he answered. I didn's wabt to go to a football factory.

title: Pop Concert to Benefit UNICEF
description: The United Nations General Assembly hail, which often rocks to vocal political discords, will be the scene of an unprecedented pop music concert on Jan. 9 that will be televised the next night on NBC and will also mark the start of an unusual mass donation for the benefit of UNICEF, the United Nations Children's Fund.

title: Deaths
description: GOLDBERGERHarry of Jackson Heights, New York on December 3, 1978. Beloved husband of Rose, devoted father of Arthur & Jerome, loving grandfather of Margaret. AnMiche4 and Alison. Services 11 am Tuesday, December 5 from Jetfer Funeral Home, 188th St & Hill. side Avenue. Family at home Tues, Wed end Thurs evenings, 3730 73rd St, Jackson Heights.

title: Pell, Coach at Clemson, To Lead Florida Eleven
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Dec. 4 (UPI)  Robert Q. Marston, University of Florida president, announced today that Charley Pell, coach of the Gator Bowlbound Clemson Tigers, would succeed Doug Dickey as Florida's head football coach.

title: The Region
description: A Long Island man was shot to death last night by two masked intruders in his home in Old Brookville, according to the Nassau County police. The victim, Lawrence Lever, 53 year old, was said to be a millionaire real estate man.

title: What Brazil's Voters Are Saying
description: The generals who have governed Brazil for the past 14 years boast of remarkable economic achievements. Brazil has become unquestionably the paramount economic power of Latin America. Its southern industrial belt is the home of a newly urbanized working class, a much expanded middle class and a powerful business elite. Ironically, these groups are now the main sources of opposition to the military's rule.

title: Virginia Wade Advances In Sydney Net Tourney
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 4 (AP)Virginia Wade of Britain made a rapid recovery from an arm injury suffered last Saturday in Federation Cup play and scored a 63, 63 victory today over Sylvanna Urroz of Chile in the opening round of a $75.000 tennis tournament.

title: Some Made Up For Last Year In Neediest Aid
description: There are many donors to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund who sometimes by oversight or forgetfulness miss the opportunity to contribute to the annual appeal. But, fortunately, for many such contributors it is not a case of out of sight, out of mind.

title: Music's Charms May Lengthen Life
description: MUSIC may have charms little considered even by the poets who write so much about it or the musicians who create it. Under the right circumstances, a life devoted to music may be a prescription for longevity.

title: About Education
description: ONE way of solving a troubled school's problems is to get rid of its troublesome students. That was precisely what happened recently when New York's Board of Education ordered the distribution of large numbers of students from Brooklyn's Boys and Girls High School among other, presumably more peaceful, schools. One of the schools ordered to take in a share of the transfers was George W. Wingate High School, which has lately been basking in a good deal of local and national acclaim as an institution that, within a relatively short time, was transformed from a blackboard jungle into the model of a modern urban high school. One of the schools ordered to take in a share of the transfers was George W. Wingate High School, which has lately been basking in a good deal of local and national acclaim as an institution that, within a relatively short time, was transformed from a blackboard jungle into the model of a modern urban high school.

title: Slayer Takes Drug Overdose
description: FLORENCE, Ariz., Dec. 4 (AP)James Dean Clark, a convicted mass slayer, took an overdose of drugs today on death row at the state prison and was in critical condition at Maricopa County hospital in Phoenix, the Department of Corrections said. The 21yearold man was convicted last July of slaying four persons at a dude ranch where he had been employed.

title: David V. Robison, 67; Broadway Playwright Was a Music Teacher
description: An informal gathering in memory of David V. Robison, a playwright and film writer who died last Thursday of lung cancer, was held Sunday at Mr. Robison's house in Woodstock, N.Y., where he died. He was 67 years old.

title: Commissioner Cites Yank Acquisitions of Star Players
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 4 The opening salvos wwere fired todey in the new economic war between the 26 teams in the major leagues and their 1,000 players, and the first shot was aimed by Bowie Kuhn.

title: Guyana Inquiry Is Urged By Mother of Rep. Ryan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  The 80yearold mother of Representative Leo J. Ryan criticized today President Carter's response to the killihgs and suicides in Guyana and called for creation of a joint, bipartisan committee of Congress to investigate the tragedy.

title: E.E.C. Presses Schmidt
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 4  Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany was reported under strong pressure from Britain, France and Italy tonight to ensure that Europe's planned fixedrate currency system is flexib enough to encourage faster growth in these countries relatively weak economies.

title: ManicDepressive CycleTied to'Clock'Defect
description: NEW research is linking manicdepressive illness, one of the most important forms of human mental disorder, to biological clocks that fail to keep proper time. The studies are producing new concepts in treatment and strategies for using existing drugs.

title: Stage: Jefferson Revives William Gillette Farce
description: FOR one single moment, the Joseph Jefferson Theater's revival of the 85yearold farce Too Much Johnson looks as though it might work. Virtually all of the characters who are about to get their identities scrambled over the next two hours scurry back and forth on the deck. of the steamship that Mill take them to Cuba.

title: Nutcracker, Forum for City Ballet Debuts
description: SUPERFLUOUS though it may seern at first glance, dance is the backbone of George Balanchine's magical spectacle The Nutcracker. On Saturday afternoon and Sunday evening at the New York State Theater, the New York City Ballet provided a reminder of that fact with a variety of debuts and performances new this season.

title: Supreme Court Roundup
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether a police officer needs a search warrant before asking a telephone company to install a device that records the numbers dialed from a particular telephone.

title: Salvadoran Guerrillas Say They Hold Britons
description: SAN SALVADOR, Dec. 4 (AP)  Two British bankers who were kidnapped last week are being held by guerrillas of the Armed Forces of National Resistance and have not been harmed, mimeographed messages said today.

title: Around the Nation
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4 (AP)Charges stemming from a bizarre rattlesnake attack on a lawyer were filed here today in Municipal Court against Charles Dederich, the hospitalized founder of Synanon, an alcoholic and drug rehabilation center.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: Prices in the credit markets declined yesterday, lifting interest rates modestly in unusually light trading activity.

title: Theater: Utopth, Inc. From Charles Ludlam
description: UTOPIA, INC., the, latest Ridiculous Theatrical Company epic to be written and directed by Charles Ludlam, transports us through the pseudoscientfic Bermuda Triangle into a curious subterranean kingdom that seems to be a comic combination of ShangriLa, The Tempest and that Bing CrosbyBob Hope movie The Road to Utopia.

title: Symphony: American Concerti
description: THE American Symphooy Orchestra is packaging its concats this seam under thematic labels, some of them remarkably inane. Sunday afternoons program at Carnegie Hall, conducted by Kazuyoshi Akiyama, paraded the banner Homage to Concerti, which is rather like paying tribute to the C Major scale. Nevertheless, what took place under this sowhat title was a remarkably satisfying concert.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: DECEMBER, always the big month for yearend fax planning, is unusually important this year because of the major changes that the Revenue Act of 1978 has wrought in the Federal tax laws.

title: South Africa Starts Namibia Vote
description: WINDHOEK, SouthWest Africa, Dec. 4 (AP)  In the shadow of South African rifles, blacks in this territory voted today in biracial elections that the United Nations says are worthless and guerrillas vow to disrupt.

title: Irving Engel, Jewish Leader, at 87
description: Irving Morris Engel, a New York lawyer and a leader in the Jewish community, died of a stroke yesterday at his home at 24 Central Park West. He was 87 years old.

title: Emirates Oil Output Off
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates, Dec. 4 (AP)  Average daily oil production in the United Arab Emirates for the first nine months of this year was 13 percent less than for the same period in 1977, it was announced here yesterday. The staterun Abu Dhabi radio said production averaged 1.44 million barrels a day, compared with 1.66 million barrels for the first nine months of the previous year. The radio said the reduction was the result of deliberate Government policy.

title: Lawyers Sum Up Case Challenging a Cutoff Of U.S. Abortion Aid
description: Lawyers representing indigent women, in a class action suit, urged a Federal judge in Brooklyn yesterday to halt a 16monthold cutoff of Federal funds for abortions. They contended that the restrictions threatened women's lives and their religious liberty.

title: Lemon Is Given Full Series Share
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 4Record World Series shares were announced today for the New York Yankees and Los Angeles Dodgers.

title: Beethoven by Charlotte Bergen
description: ONE of the more remarkable figures on New York's musical scene, Charlotte Bergen has been presenting orchestral concerts in Carnegie Hall for over 10 years. At an age when most women would be content to devote most of their energies to their grandchildren, Miss Bergen decided she would like to conduct an orchestra, which she pays for out of her own pocket, and invite the public to hear her free of charge.

title: News Summary
description: Israel will not renegotiate the peace treaty draft it has accepted but would be willing to discuss accompanying letters dealing with Gaza and the West Bank, according to reports of a message sent by Prime Minister Begin to President Sadat. The message, in reply to one from the Egyptian President, was expected to lead to contacts that could go on well beyond the Dec. 17 deadline set at Camp David for conclusion of a treaty. [Page A1, Column 6.]

title: World News Briefs
description: MINEHEAD, England, Dec. 4 (Reuters)  A former model, who has testified that Jeremy Thorpe, the former leader of Britain's Liberal Party, conspired to kill him, alleged in court today that a Government minister was involved in a coverup of a homosexual affair between Mr. Thorpe and himself.

title: Sen. Stevens Hurt in Air Crash
description: Senator Ted Stevens of Alaska was seriously injured and his wife and four other persons were killed yesterday afternoon when a Lear jet carrying them crashed at Anchorage International Airport.

title: Wage Law In Building Is Attacked
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Carter Administration, armed with a draft report by the General Accounting Office, is considering major changes in a controversial law that controls wages paid to workers on Federal construction projects.

title: NATO Europeans, in Departure, Publish List of New Arms for 79
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 4  Stressing the Soviet Union's growing military strength especially in northern Europe, NATO defense ministers today took the unusual step of publishing a long list of new weapons that they plan to deploy next year to increase their military preparedness.

title: Breeding of Condors in Captivity May Avert Extinction
description: THE California condor, long a symbol of wild America, is on the road to extinction: But if experiments at the Bronx Zoo and several other wildlife centers are any indication, there may yet be hope for the largest flying land bird in North America.

title: 3 Firemen Die in Toronto Blaze
description: TORONTO, Dec. 4 (Reuters) Three firemen were killed today when bales of paper collapsed on them as they were fighting a fire in a Toronto paper mill, the police reported.

title: How Ancients Navigated
description: HAVING made long, opensea voyages in Polynesian craft sailed by natives without charts or other aids to navigation, a small group of researchers believes they can now explain what were probably the most remarkable feats of migration in human history.

title: China Eases Policy of Sending Youth to Countryside
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 4  China is quietly dismantling the late Mao Tsetung's unpopular program of forcibly resettling urban young people in the countryside as part of a broad new effort to make life less harsh and arbitrary.

title: Carter Backs Sugar Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  President Carter today signed a proclamation demonstrating American support for the 55nation International Sugar Agreement, even though the Senate failed to ratify the accord in the last Congress.

title: Debate on MissileDestroyer Arms Picks Up Heat Over Soviet Moves
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  A debate over the feasibility of missiledestroying ray weapons continued today, with two wellknown scientists questioning whether it would, be possible to use highenergy atomic particles to destroy enemy rockets.

title: A Reporter's Notebook: Death's Somber Setting
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Dec. 4 The rainy season has brought lowering. Stonecolored skies to this corner of the Caribbean, and the sea is not the magic blue of the tourist islands but is stained brown like a damp, muddy doormat.

title: Chargers Rout Bears by 407
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 4 (AP)  Dan Fouts threw for two touchdowns, Rolf Benirschke kicked two field goals and Larry Burton  in his first game for the Chargers  caught two touchdown passes tonight as San Diego trounced the Chicago Bears, 407, in a National Foootball League game.

title: 2 Ominous Clouds Forced NBCTV to Purge Series
description: THE sweeping changes of programming announced by NBCTV last week were made in a state of emergency, against the background of two ominous developments.

title: Conductor on Two Best Sellers
description: Kirill Kondrashin became a public figure in the Western musical world 20 years ago when he conducted two of the most famous recordings in history with Van Cliburn as piano soloist.

title: A CULT MOTHER LED CHILDREN TO DEATH.
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Dec. 4 Moments after she finished what is believed to be the last radio conversation with Jonestown, Sharon Amos walked briskly through the living room of the People's Temple headquarters here with a knife in her hand, witnesses said today.

title: Despite PickUps By City, Garbage Keeps Piling Up
description: As a strike by hundreds of private sanitation workers entered its fourth day, municipal workers yesterday began collecting some garbage from sidewalks in front of hotels, restaurants and other commercial enterprises. But thousands of tons of trash lay accumulating and uncollected, prompting city officials to express concern over mounting health and fire hazards.

title: Talmadge Says Checks At Bank Were Forgeries
description: ROME, Ga., Dec. 4 (AP)  Senator Herman E. Talmadge said today that checks drawn on an allegedly secret Washington bank account in his name had been forged.

title: Carter Warned by Blacks of Unrest if He Slights Programs for Cities
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  A dozen black leaders told President Carter today that they rere deeply distressed by his intention to subordinate urban programs to the fight against inflation and warned that they would be unable to contain the urban unrest that they said would follow such a decision.

title: Entertainment Events
description: BURIED CHILD, by Sam Shepard. Directed by Robert Woodruff. AI the Theater de Lys. 121 Owl stcolw Skeet, at 6:15.

title: Court Bars Review Of Firm's Liability
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  The Supreme Court today refused to review a Federal appeals court decision holding a securities firm liable for the stock losses suffered by an elderly customer who bad turned his account over to an investment adviser recommended by the firm.

title: An Art Gallery Masquerades As Versailles
description: When you decide to give a party in New York for Grald Van der Kemp, curator of the palace of Versailles, finding an appropriate setting can be problem. This city doesn't exactly abound in French chateaus. But it just so happens that exactly a year ago the Didier Aaron Gallery opened on East 67th Street. Since the gallery specializes in 18thcentury French art and antiques, Alexis Gregory, who was giving the party, decided it was the ideal place. As the publisher of Mr. Van der Kemp's new book, Versailles, he approached Herve Aaron, who runs the gallery, and voila! It was done.

title: Succession Is Obscuring Algeria's Chosen Roles in World
description: ALGIERS, Dec. 4  Algeria has been the voice of third world assertiveness, a militant in the ArabIsraeli dispute and a pragmatist in balancing its military relations with the Soviet Union by strong economic ties with the United States. But what will be the political contours after Houari Boumediene?

title: Israeli Soldier Given 20 Years
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 4 (AP)  An Israeli military court sentenced a reserve soldier to 20 years in prison today for murdering an Arab in a private act of revenge for the killing of another Jewish soldier. Israel Lederman, 43 years old, had been convicted of the murder of an East Jerusalem Arab who was standing in the same spot where the Jewish soldier had been killed.

title: Books of The Times
description: IT was, of course, inevitably, Alexis de Tocqueville who said it first and said it best: Revolutions, like love affairs, change your past. In a way, the whole of Michael Kammen's A Season of Youth is a gloss on that observations.

title: Revisionism and General Loan
description: President Carter and Attorney General Bell have overruled the Immigration and Naturalization Service's decision to condUct a hearing into the status South Vietnamese Gen. Nguyen Ngoc Loan, who was photographed shooting a bound prisoner in the head 1968. The immigration people wished to deport Mr. Loan for moral turpitude. Since to send him back Vietnam would be wrong and unlawful, and few other countries would be likely to accept him, the main purpose was a symbolic change in his status, from legal immigrant to parolee.

title: U.S. to Fly Some 14,000 Troops To Europe for Winter Maneuvers
description: BONN, Dec. 4 (Reuters)  Nearly 14,000 American troops will be flown across the Atlantic to West Germany for winter maneuvers next month, the United States Army European Command said here today.

title: Orders Up For Plants
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)  Factory orders, a prime indicator of the nation's economic health, rose by a strong 4.2 percent in October, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Teheran, a Garrison Town, Still Has Gossip and Caviar
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 4 Even during the daytime, before the curfew descends and the army and the demonstrators confront each other in shadowy alleys and on broad boulevards, the signs of strife are everywhere.

title: Resorts International Stock Plunges
description: Sharp losses in the shares of Resorts International and large gains in two corporate takeover situations ranked among the stock market's major price changes yesterday.

title: Bridge:
description: Historically speaking, most of the bridge expertise in the metropolitan area has been concentrated in Manhattan. In the Grand National Team Championship, for example, it is relatively rare for a squad from Long Island to reach the semifinal stage'in district play.

title: Music: 2 Schubert Moods
description: SCHUBERT, like Mahler, was fond of using his songs as the basis of an instrumental composition, especially one in variation form. The song Trockne Blumen from Die schone Mllerin is one such example.

title: 3 Teams in Playoffs; 12 Still Hoping
description: Sunday's activity in the National Football League managed to qualify three teams for The playoffs and to eliminate another, Cleveland, but did little to clarify the status of a dozen contestants. Three of the six division titles of six were decided as Pittsburgh of the Central Division in the American Conference, Los Angeles in fhe West of the National Conference and Dallas in the East clinched positions for the second round of the playoffs on December 3031.

title: House Leaders Easily Reelected To Posts as Party Caucuses Begin
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  Top Democratic and Republican leaders in the House of Representatives were easily reelected today as the caucuses of both parties met and began to organize for the 96th Congress, which will convene on Jan. 15.

title: WORLD AROUND US
description: LATE fall frosts and icy days, mean an end to the supply of insects, seeds and grains that most birds depend on for food, forcing them to migrate southward. But a few hardier birds remain, including sparrows, blue Jays and cardinals. They are joined at this time of year by latemigrating birds from farther north that will, if encouraged, stay all winter long.

title: Midlantic Expands
description: Midlantic Banks said it had received approval from the Comptroller of the Currency to acquire the First Merchants National Bank of Neptune, N.J. First Merchants has $306 million in assets and operates 20 offices, all in Monmouth County. Midlantic Banks has assets of $2.2 billion and has 95 offices in 12 New Jersey counties.

title: Deaths
description: CASSUTORose (nee Honig). Beloved mother of Regina Berliner, Mark. Albert & Ben. Cherished grandmother, loving sister. Services today 10:30AM at The Riverside 1250 Central Ave, Far Rockaway, L.I.

title: Gift to Neediest Now a Pattern For Hundreds
description: Eric H. Newman, .a student at Tufts University in Medford, Mass., sent the 67th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund a check for $55. Mr. Newman's gift arrived at the fund last February. He said in his letter:

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY, DEC. 5, 1978

title: 21 Persons, Including Baby, Saved After a Crash Landing in Colorado
description: WALDEN, Colo., Dec. 5 (AP) Searchers on snowmobiles rescued 21 persons today, including an infant in his mother's arms, who survived the crashlanding of a twinengine commuter plane on a mountainside and spent the night in a nearblizzard. The authorities said one person died in the accident.

title: Deaths
description: RINGGOMatween. J. of Scarsdale NY, on December 5, 1978. Wife of the late Henry E. Ringgold. Mother of Peter J. Ringgold, grandmother of Timothy & Jeffries Ringgold. Funeral service will be held at Church of St James the Lese. Scarsdale, on Saturday at 10AM.

title: Fannie Mae Plans Sale: $2 Billion
description: The Federal National Mortgage Association, a Governmentsponsored company owned by private stockholders and set up to improve the market for home loans, plans to sell $2 billion of debentures today to refinance $750 million of maturing securities and to raise $1.25 billion more to finance its operations in the mortgage market.

title: Concert A Show Stealer
description: For many who attended Avery Fisher Hall Monday night, WNEW FM's sannual benefit for United Cerebral Palsy reached its high point just as they were settling in their seats. A surprise guest, Todd Rundgren, played three quick numbers and left his fans clamoring for more throughout sets by the evening's scheduled performers, Levon Helm and the RCO All Stars, featuring the Cate Brothers and MarkAlmond.

title: Best Buys
description: THIS is the week for rabbit food fans to rejoice. Thanks to slightly lower prices for lettuce and spinach, market basket prices in New York City were down slightly last week, with increased supplies of Florida lettuce and Texas spinach giving consumers a minor, but muchneeded break.

title: 2 Cited for Serving Remote Mountain Area
