description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 6  One full month after Mayor Frank L. Rizzo's attempt to amend the city charter to allow him to seek a third term was dashed at the polls, a saga of alleged official wrongdoing on and after Election Day continues to unfold.

title: World Scouts Postpone 1979 Jamboree in Iran
description: GENEVA, Dec. 6 (UPI)  The 15th World Scout Jamboree scheduled for next July in Iran has been postponed. the World Scout Bureau said today.

title: The World of Models: Chaos With Glamour
description: It is a Tuesday morning and the reception room is full. One of the interviewers has called to say that she is sick and unable to talk to prospective models. So Eileen Ford  founder of the Ford modeling agency and doyenne of the New York modeling world  says she will do some of the interviewing herself.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TODAY,Dec.7

title: 17 MEMBERS OF CULT ARRIVE AT KENNEDY
description: Seventeen members of the People's Temple arrived last night at Kennedy Airport and were taken into custody by Federal officials who are investigating the death in Guyana of Representative Leo J. Ryan, Democrat of California on Nov. 18.

title: DEMOCRATS IN HOUSE RELAX REFORM PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  The House Democratic Caucus, overriding arguments of reformminded members in a closed session, refused today to strip convicted legislators of chairmanships and watered down a proposal that might have led to further punishment of two Representatives recently reprimanded for involvement in the Korean influencebuying scandal.

title: Democrats Girding for Midterm Parley
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 6  Leaders of the Democratic Party began arriving here today prepared to skirmish over the party's future, with the costconscious Carter Administration firmly in control, traditional liberals outnumbered and grumpy and many party chiefs just staying away.

title: Cabaret: Faun at Bondini
description: THERE is at least a suggestion of camp  a somewhat deceptive suggestion  when Peggy Hewett, Norman Hollings and the allwomen orchestra of Miss Faun take to the tiny stage at Bondini's, 62 West Ninth Street, to sing and play a repertory of show tunes of the 20's and 30's that range from Friml and Herbert to Kern, Porter and Coward.

title: Australia Reported Set to Admit More Vietnamese
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 6  The Australian Government is planning to admit more Vietnamese refugees for permanent settlement, according to official sources, but is also trying to persuade Vietnam to reduce the flow of those leaving the country.

title: Sound
description: R.G. DOBBS FERRY. N.Y. THAT'S a fair, plain, practical question deserving a straightforward answer. But a roundabout one is the best I can do. What gets me on the curved track is the phrase twice as good. I am not sure what it means. Nor. I suspect, does anyone else.

title: Letter On Mr. Rubin's Chic
description: In Turning the Other Chic, an Editorial Notebook piece in the Nov. 29 issue, Fred Hechinger wrote a clever essay about conformism within avante garde movements. To make his point, he used Jerry Rubin, my husband, as a symbol of a certain type of person whose only allegiance is to what is popular at the moment. He simultaneously painted the 1960's antiwar and cultural revolutions and the 1970's health and awareness revolutions as fads. I believe that Hechinger unfairly denigrated both Jerry and all the people behind these two important developments in American history.

title: 1Year Bills Hit 4Year High
description: The Treasury sold oneyear bills yesterday at an average discount rate of 9.32 percent, the highest rate for these shortterm securities since August 1974.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MOTION PICTURES Nikon House has added live entertainment to its exhibition of photographs, Marcel Marceau: Master of Mime, by Ben Martin. The live performer is Philip Burton, who has made guest appearances with the Richard Morse Mime

title: British Paper Expands
description: LONDON, Dec. 6 (AP)  The Financial Times, Britain's daily business newspaper, says it plans to go on sale in New York each morning. Beginning Jan. 2, the international edition will be printed in Frankfurt (instead of London) and flown to New York.

title: Around the Nation
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Dec. 6  The Florida Legislature quickly enacted remedial legislation today designed to protect two large sections of the state designated as areas of environmentally critical state concern.

title: Miss Mandlikova Triumphs
description: SYDNEY, Dec. 6 (UPI)  Sixteenyearold Hana Mandlikova posted the most impressive victory of her career today in the $86,250 Women's Tennis Classic with a 76, 46, 75 secondround triumph over Renata Tomanova of Czechoslovakia, her more experienced countrywoman. Two Americans, Sharon Walsh and Renee Blount, scored straightset victories. Miss Walsh defeated Amanda Tobin of Australia, 64, 64, and Miss Blount beat Tine Zwaan of the Netherlands, 63, 63.

title: Charges Are Changed for 2 Men In Alleged Submarine Theft Plot
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 6 (AP)  Charges against two men who had been accused of conspiring to steal and sell a Navy nuclear submarine were changed today to fraud by wire.

title: New York Officers to Use Chemical Mace as a Test
description: The New York City Police Department will soon equip several hundred uniformed officers and detectives with aerosol irritants, including Chemical Mace, in the department's first test of what are called nonlethal weapons.

title: Pirates Now a Big Thorn Hurting Record Industry
description: With the proliferation of cassettes and eighttrack cartridges, piracy has become a big business. So big, in fact, that the control of piracy is the first priority of the nations recording industry and its official arm, the Recording Industry Association of America.

title: F.B.I. Raiders Act to Smash Record Piracy
description: More than 300 agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation seized $100 million worth of modem soundrecording equipment yesterday in raids that officials said wiped out 50 percent of the illicit recording industry in the United States.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Wednesday. Dec. 6, 1978

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: NEW & USEFUL
description: Shades of the 1940's! Or, in this case, draperies. Vintage drapery materials are being used for oneofakind Christmas wreaths that are stuffed, tufted, frosted with antique lace doilies and finished off with huge grosgrain bows. Some are in the traditional holiday greens and reds, but one charming version is in soft pastels with beige ribbon. Obviously, they are not intended to go on the outside of a house but in the foyer, living room, dining room or bedroom. And if you act quickly, you will be able to have a wreath made up in your own fabric to match your dcor by Christmas. Approximately 20 inches diameter, the wreaths are $55 at Serendipity 3,225 East 60th Street.

title: World News Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 6  The United States Defense Secretary, Harold Brown, joined with other defense ministers of the Atlantic alliance today in urging President Carter to stand by his commitment to increase United States defense spending by 3 percent next year.

title: Brown, Pianist
description: STEPHANIE BROWN gives every indication of being a young pianist with a burgeoning career. At the age of 23, she has already been a winner in the Young Concert Artists auditions, participated in three Music From Marlboro tours and recorded the Brahms piano quartets with Alexander Schneider, Leslie Parnas and Walter Trampler. Tuesday night, she appeared at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. as the first recipient of Young Concert Artists's Mortimer Levitt Career Development Award for Women Artists.

title: Court Says 2 Homosexuals Were Wrongly Dimissed From Military
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  Two homosexuals were unfairly discharged from the military, the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia ruled today.

title: Guyana Orders Custody Case Inquiry
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Dec. 6 The Guyana Government has ordered its Attorney General to investigate charges that a justice of the Supreme Court here yielded to pressure from the People's Temple while handling a childcustody case involving the Rev. Jim Jones, the Deputy Prime Minister said today.

title: Geometric Pleasures Of Vienna Moderne
description: MODERN design came early to Vienna and reigned there for the first two decades of this century, transforming the interiors of cafes and coffee houses, sanatoriums and salons in a city that was in intellectual ferment.

title: Market Place;Selling Assetts To Avoid Tax
description: LAST August, the Seagrove Corporation, an architecturalmetal and glassproducts company, announced an agreement to sell its operating assets in a new type of transaction designed to dispose of a business without tax effect.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: 7 Die in Runway Crash in Omaha
description: OMAHA, Neb., Dec. 6 (AP)  Seven persons were killed tonight when a Mexican Government DC6 exploded as it took off and crashed into a Missouri. River dike, officials said.

title: POPULATION FALLING IN OLDER U.S. CITIES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  New York City had a loss in population of more than 470,000 from 1970 to 1976, according to new Census Bureau estimates, and the other big, older industrial cities, especially in the Northeast and Middle West, have generally experienced similar losses.

title: Closed End Funds
description: TUESDAY, DEC. 5,1978

title: U.S. Said to Bar Kin of Military From Leaving Iran
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 6  The wife of a United States Army officer in Iran alleged today that American military families are prevented from leaving the country and placed in danger for political reasons.

title: A Day of Warfare for Truckers Moving Steel on Midwest Roads
description: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio, Dec. 6 Get the gun out, Tack, get the gun out! the call came over the citizens band radio.

title: Nuggets Top Nets, 9283; Issel Sparks Late Drive
description: DENVER, Dec. 6 (AP)  Dan Issel scored 13 points in the fourth quarter tonight as the Denver Nuggets defeated the foulprone New Jersey Nets, 9283, in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Soviet Launches 8 Satellites
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 6 (UPI)  The Soviet Union announced today that it had carried out another piggyback launching of eight communications satellites riding into orbit aboard a single rocket. The press agency Tass said the satellites, Cosmos 1,051 through Cosmos 1,058, were fired into orbit on Tuesday.

title: Chileans Stage Rally to Protest Boycott Threat
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 6 (AP)  Beneath a giant poster of a worker in a hard hat, thousands of welldressed people shouted their repudiation of an international economic boycott being threatened against Chile.

title: MYRTLE I. PASSANTINO
description: Myrtle Ilsley Passantino, a social worker, died Monday in Memorial SloanKettering Cancer Center. She was 60 years old and lived at 6355 83d Street, Middle Village, Queens.

title: Urban Arts Leaders Open Symposium
description: The first intercity symposium for American urban arts administrators begins today in New York. In announcing the threeday conference, which will be attended by representatives of 24 cities in the United States, Mayor Koch said: Urban centers share a number of pressing social and economic problems. It is the arts which have the potential for bringing people together, for restoring their pride in their city.

title: Elsa H. Naumburg, 97; A Former Social Worker
description: Elsa Herzfeld Naumburg, a former social worker and teacher, died Tuesday after a long illness. She was 97 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Earnings Listed for the Quarter
description: For periods as shown. (N) indicates stock Is listed on the New York Stock Exchange,(A) the American Stock Exchange and (O) over-thecounter.

title: Keeping CUNY Independent
description: Governor Carey's evident. desire to fire the Chancellor of New York's City University and Mayor Koch's willing acquiescence recall the time another governor, name of Ronald Reagan, fired a university president, name of Clark Kerr. The nationwide reaction was roundly and properly uncomplimentary. Politicians, whether in New York or in California, should stay out of hiring and firing university administrators.

title: Totalitarianism's Enduring Appeal
description: The continuing reverence in the. Soviet Union for Josef Stalin, reported the other day in a dispatch to The Times from Moscow, is not a unique outburst of nostalgia. In Spain, rallies are held to honor Franco, and Hitler continues to hold a place in the hearts of some of his countrymen. What drives people to long for leaders whose rule was distinguished by the cruel suppression of freedom?

title: Finley Frees McKeon
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 6  Jack McKeon was named manager of the Denver Bears of the American Association today, which was the first indication anyone had that tie wouldn't be returning as manager of the Oakland A's next season.

title: House Unit Approves Report on Its Inquiry Into Korean Scandal
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP)  The House ethics committee approved a final report today on its investigation of Korean influencebuying on Capitol Hill, but it left many of the scandal's most intriguing questions unanswered.

title: Talk Between Bell and Talmadge Stirs Speculation About Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  Attorney General Griffin B. Bell met privately at 6 A.M. yesterday in an Atlanta hotel coffee shop with Senator Herman E. Talmadge, Democrat of Georgia, a possible target of a Jamaica Department criminal investigaton.

title: Concerns of Region Topic at Trade Center
description: The Governors of six Northeastern states sent a cautiously worded message to President Carter yesterday, urging him to seriously consider the effect of any increase in the oil prices charged by the OPEC nations.

title: Talking Business
description: With talk of a possible default by Cleveland next week, the increasing likelihood of an economic downturn in 1979 and the cloud of Proposition 13 still hanging over municipalbudget makers, the pressures onthe municipal bond markets would seem to be building. Yet municipal bonds have shown little indication of turning tail and running. In fact, municipals appear to nave stood their ground Deter man most other segments of the bond markets against the interestrate surges of 1978. Price declines in municipals have been relatively small compared with corporate or government bonds.

title: Homer Smith Dismissed as Army Football Coach
description: The United States Military Academy dismissed Homer Smith as Army's head football coach yesterday, four days after the Cadets lost to Navy, 280, and ended the 1978 season with a record of four victories, six defeats and one tie.

title: Steingut Aide Named Policy Chief by Carey
description: ALBANY, Dec. 6  Michael J. DelGiudice, secretary to the outgoing AS. sembly Speaker, Stanley Steingut, will join the Carey administration as director of policy and management, aides said.

title: GARDENING
description: DIG now, plant later. If you're contemplating adding some trees or shrubs to your landscaping next year, now's the time to do your spadework. Seeing you out digging while the thermometer hovers near freezing may set your neighbors to wondering about your sanity, but it's a comfortablecime to be working outdoors. After testing a couple of shovelfuls, you'll find yourself warm but not overheated. More importantly, digging now will give the best results for your future greenery.

title: Conflict Over Custody of Child Linked to Guyana Deaths
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 6  It was because his father wanted it that John Victor Stoen, then four years old, was sent in 1976 to the agricultural commune of the People's Temple at Jonestown, Guyana.

title: Lobbies Act to Shape Key Panels in Next Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  At a reception for freshmen Congressmen, a public affairs lobbyist sighted Representative Mickey Leland, a Democrat from Texas. The lobbyist knew that Mr. Leland was interested in drug problems, and he wanted to urge him to seek a seat on the Interstate and Foreign Commerce Cornmittee, which handles many health issues.

title: Jets Become HighSpirited With Help of LowKeyed Club Chief
description: There has always been a zany underside to the Jets, a club born in the Polo Grounds with a president whose checks often bounced higher than a spiked football.

title: Advertising
description: THE decision makers at the Aetna Life and Casualty Company, the ones who decided early last year to skip television advertising for a while, had no plans of going back on until at least 1980. Then along came the DeBolts family and the thinking changed.

title: ALBRECHT SCHOENHALS
description: BADENBADEN, West Germany,Dec. 6 (AP)  Albrecht Schoenhals, one of the grand old men of German films, died today as the age of 90.

title: Drys Have It in Town Vote
description: EASTFORD, Conn., Dec. 5 Having searched their consciences and evaluated their thirsts, 466 residents of this small rural town went to the polls today to decide whether to remain dry.

title: Letters
description: TO THE HOME SECTION.

title: Entertainment Events
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA. Lincolh, Center: Donizeki's Don Pasquale. 7:30.

title: Stage: Kingfisher Stars Rex Harrison
description: THE characters in The Kingfisher, a romantic comedy about old age, have no more life or substance than the leaves, stuck to a black backdrop, that represent a tree in their garden.

title: City Considers Teacher Shifts For Integration
description: The New York City Board of Education, having abandoned a system of assigning new teachers on the basis of race after a public outcry, is seriously considering assigning them on the basis of residency to achieve the same goal  a more racially integrated school faculty.

title: 100 New Sanitationmen Will Be Hired in City Drive
description: One hundred sanitationmen will be hired immediately by New York City, and 122 present sanitation workers will be put onto refuse trucks in an effort to provide more frequent street collections and to improve other cleanup services in the five boroughs.

title: Begin Aide Denies Israel Plans New Settlements Soon
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 6  The head of Prime Minister Menachem Begin's secretariat said tonight that the Israeli Government had no plans for an immediate start on new Jewish settlements in occupied lands after the Dec. 17 expiration of a threemonth moratorium.

title: HUGHES'S INSTITUTE BREAKS ITS SILENCE
description: The Howard Hughes Medical Institute, which is the focus in the legal battle over the estate of the late industrialist, is breaking. a 23year silence by publishing a summary of its operations in 12 leading medical schools.

title: Dr. Ralph A. Sawyer Dead at 83; Directed Atom Bomb Tests in '46
description: Dr. Ralph A. Sawyer. the physicist in charge of atomic bomb tests at Bikini Atoll in the Pacific in 1946. died yesterday at Huron View Lodge. a nursing home in Ann Arbor. Mich. He was 83 years old.

title: Blacks of Namibia Vote, With a Little South African Help
description: OMAMUNDUNGO, SouthWest Africa, Dec. 6  In a South African army tent pitched beneath a broad mrula tree, Johannes Joseph today exercised a right that has been denied to blacks since the spikehelmeted soldiers of Kaiser Wilhelm I turned this arid territory into a white man's dominion almost a century ago.

title: Home Beat
description: THE only one who wasn't having a cocktail was the longhaired, longhorned Drysdale sheep. But then, he was stuffed. Otherwise, all those gathered at the press opening of W & J Sloane's newest model rooms last week appeared flushed with good cheer. Partly this was because it was warm on the fourth floor. But mostly it was due to delight that Sloane's and the Wool Bureau, Inc. had combined talents. And probably the temperature was only another clever reminder that we were there to think woolens.

title: Myriad Crafts on Sale At a Holiday Fair
description: THE seventh annual Holiday Crafts Fair, considered by professional craftsmen to be among the most competitive of craft shows in the Northeast, opens for the first of two weekends tomorrow in Ferris Booth Hall of Columbia University, 115th Street and Broadway.

title: 11 Protesters Offer Defense
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 (AP)  The defense began presenting its case today in the trial of 11 persons arrested on the White House lawn on Labor Day after they staged a brief demonstration against the neutron bomb.

title: Stage: S.N. Behrman Comedy Revived
description: PRINCETON. N.J. S.N. BEHRMAN wrote carefully crafted, sophisticated drawingroom comedies. For decades, particularly in the 30's, he delighted Broadway audiences with a shower of wit that made him something of an American Noel Coward. But, as with so many writers of humor, he wanted to take himself  and to be taken  more seriously.

title: Governor Will Enclose Pool and Tennis Court
description: ALBANY, Dec. 6 (AP)  Facing the prospect of four more cold Albany winters, Governor Carey has decided to enclose the swimming pool and tennis courts at the Executive Mansion at a cost of $160,000.

title: BREZHNEV SUPPORTS PROMPT ARMS PACT AND U.S. TRADE RISE
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 6  Leonid I. Brezhnev told delegations of American officials and business executives today that the Soviet Union wanted to complete a new treaty on the limitation of strategic arms without further procrastination and to expand trade with the United States.

title: Curb Asked On Cotton From China
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6To placate American textile producers, the Carter Administration has opened talks with China to get it to limit its soaring exports of cotton goods to this country, according to American trade officials.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Would you like to have Jimmy Stewart introduce a product for you? A new automobile, perhaps, or an imported wine? How about Burt Reynolds for a line of outdoor clothes, or Ali McGraw for a brand of cosmetics?

title: Levich Is Going to Israel
description: VIENNA, Dec. 6 (Reuters)  Veniamin G. Levich, the Soviet physicist, who arrived in Austria last Thursday after almost six years of waiting for an emigration permit, will leave tomorrow with his wife for Israel, family members said today. Dr. Levich, an international authority on physiochemical hydrophysics and a corresponding member of the Soviet Academy of Sciences, plans to . sure his scientific work in Israel.

title: Design Notebook
description: If a group deserves to be commemorated by public statues, it's New York's writers.

title: Westchester 's Successful Program On Pretrial Release May Be Ended
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 6  An apparently successful pretrial services program in Westchester, designed to help judges sort out suspects considered safe risks for release before trial, may be abandoned now that the county is being asked to pay the costs, most of which had been borne by the Federal Government.

title: Calendar: Exotic Fabrics and Old Buildings
description: China Seas Warehouse Sale, 427 East 76th Street.

title: Notes on People
description: Eleanor D'Antuono, a principal dancer with the American Ballet Theater since 1961, is about to make some ballet history by, becoming the first American invited as a special guest artist with the Kirov Ballet of Leningrad. Between Jan. 7 and 31 she will be dancing Giselle and Swan Lake with the company in Leningrad and four other Russian cities.

title: Vietnam Reported Pushing Deeper Into Cambodia
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 6  Vietnamese troops were reported to be advancing northward from the rubberplantation region northeast of Phnom Penh today toward the Mekong River town of Kratie, the headquarters of Cambodia's eastern administrative region.

title: Exxon to Quit Well In Baltimore Canyon
description: Exxon's first well in the Baltimore Canyon has turned up nothing but water, according to a statement issued late yesterday afternoon by the Exxon Company U.S.A., the domestic arm of the Exxon Corporation. The company said it would plug and abandon the well, which is about 95 miles east of Atlantic City.

title: Radio
description: 67 A.M., WKCR. Motets and Madrigals, Gesualdo and Monteverdi.

title: The Shopping Bag: Portable Status
description: THE paper shopping bag used to be a dull, utilitarian affair. Nowadays, if it isn't exactly Art, it is Design, and stores vie to do the most striking graphics. Like Shakespeare's mercy, the shopping bag blesseth both him that gives and him that takes. It provides free, walking advertising for the merchant and confers status on the shopper. Does that tiny bag from Tiffany hold a diamond ring? Is the smart one from Mark Cross being used to take the shirts to the laundry?

title: Japanese Party Fight Defers Appointment of Premier
description: TOKYO. Dec. 6  A bitter squabble erupted today among leaders of the governing LiberalDemocratic Party, forcing a postponement of the scheduled designation of a new Japanese prime minister by Parliament.

title: Blumenthal May Go to Rumania
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 6The United States is making arrangements to send Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal to Rumania this weekend as a show of support for President Nicolae Ceaucescu in his test of strength with Moscow, Administration sources said today.

title: Music: Miss Opera: Carters at Aida
description: PRESIDENT and Mrs. Carter fared well on their first visit to the Metropolitan Opera Tuesday night. There were no superstars on stage to steal the limelight from them, the other leading politi: clans gathered in the parterre boxes, and the performance of Verdi's Aida ran with a smoothness that governmental bureaucracy achieves all too rarely.

title: The City
description: The Safeco Insurance Company won the right to withdraw its property and casualty insurance operations from New York State.

title: Democracy's No Free Gift
description: In the last election, almost two out of three Americans of voting age did not exercise their franchise. The 37 percent of the people dragging themselves to the polls were sold candidates through TV commercials. During news programs and football games we were bombarded with 30second spots which turned each candidate into an actor.

title: Pearl Harbor Attack To Be Marked Today
description: PEARL HARBOR, Hawaii, Dec. 6 (UPI)  A whistle blast followed by a minute of silence tomorrow morning will mark the 37th anniversary of the moment the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor began, sending the United States into World War II.

title: Ski Reports This Season To Feature a New Look
description: Ski reports are going to have a new look this year.

title: GUY DE LA PASARDIERE
description: Guy de la Pasardiere, a French marquis who was the husband of the French singer and actress Lilo  the star of the 1953 Broadway musical CanCan  died Tuesdayin New York of a heart attack. He was 52 years old.

title: French Find Bootleg Cigarettes
description: HENDAYE, France, Dec. 6 (Reuters)  French customs officers, acting on a tip, discovered nine tons of cigarettes buried under a mound of earth in a freight car bound for Spain today. The cigarettes, worth more than $500,000 and buried under five tons of soil, were found as the train was waiting in the station of this southwestern frontier town, customs officials said.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Allied Maintenance Corporation, one of the largest service and maintenance organizations in North America, has appointed Frank J. Evangelist Jr. vice president and house counsel.

title: Guild Settles With SunTimes
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 6 (UPI)  The Chicago SunTimes amounted today that a twoyear contract had been negotiated with the Chicago Newspaper Guild. The new contract would give editorial workers an average salary increase of 7.2 percent the first year and in the second year a minimum of 6 percent and maximum of 8 percent, based on a costofliving formula, said the guild negotiating committee chairman, Larry Finley.

title: IRAN RELEASES A FOE OF MILITARY REGIME
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 6  Iran's military Government, in an apparently conciliatory gesture to the foes of Shah Mohammed Riga Pahlevi, released the political leader of the opposition tonight after having detained him for 26 days.

title: Title IX Guidelines Are Issued For Equal Sports Expenditures
description: For the first time in six years, the Department of Health, Education and Welfare attempted yesterday to clarify what constitutes compliance with the Federal law banning sex discrimination in intercollegiate athletics  the law known as Title IX.

title: Deaths
description: ALEXANDERRae. beloved wife of Me late Abe, devoted mother of Dr Irwin S. Kind motherIn4aw of Tru. dr. Services Friday 12:15 pm The Riverside 75 St and Amsterdam Ave

title: Chinese Get Credits In Britain
description: LONDON, Dec. 6  In what is officially described as the first deal of its kind with the Peking regime, seven British banking groups signed agreements here today giving China $1.2 billion in credits to develop its industry.

title: Olive Company Sells 13% Bonds
description: A California company that processes olives and rice sold $20 million of speculative bonds and common stock yesterday that were priced to give buyers a fat 13.06 percent yield.

title: PRESIDENT PLEDGES HELP FOR REFUGEES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  In a reaffirmation of his commitment to human rights, President Carter pledged today to do his utmost to assist refugees from Indochina and Lebanon and political prisoners released from Cuba and elsewhere.

title: The Photographer's Studio: Life and Art
description: FEROCIOUSLY visual. Obsessed by perfection. Ruthless in his quest for the right, the exactly right, (no, it must be taken again) sublimely telling shot. Surrounded by the world's loveliest women. Importuned by editors and clients. An image crafter, an ingenious manipulator of surface, a beauty vendor  he is the highfashion photographer.

title: Soprano: Miss Cotrubas
description: ONE of the overworked truisms of music is that a singer need not have a great voice to be a fine lieder recitalist. Because of that, the artsong repertory has sometimes come to be regarded as a retirement plan for overly mature singers. But a fine voice in its prime need not be a hindrance in lieder, to say the least, as Beam Cotrubas demonstrated last night at Carnegie Hall.

title: Disks: Bilson's Haydn
description: THIS is the third recital that Malcolm Bilson has offered on Advent cassettes, and it excites the same degree of admiration as its predecessors both for musical excellence and sheer sound.

title: White House Reported To Ease Insurance Stand
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  At the request of Senator Edward M. Kennedy, the White House has agreed to support a less restrictive national health insurance resolution at the Democratic midterm conference in Memphis this weekend.

title: Loss on Wage Plan Put Under $5 Billion
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6  The probable loss of Federal revenues from President Carter's proposed real wage insurance, if there is any loss at all, would likely be $5 billion or less, an Administration official said tonight.

title: The Clown Is Funny as a Crutch
description: Bob Donaldson is conducting his business this week in Jim Norris Stadium, Oklahoma State Fairgrounds, Oklahoma City. His business is slapping an infuriated bull in the face, twisting his tail, taking hold of a horn and taunting a brute that yearns with all his evil heart to gore Bob Donaldson, stomp him to jelly and fling his carcass into the leftfield bleachers.

title: 17 Jones Cult Survivors Are Subpoenaed by U.S.
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 7  The Justice Department intensified its investigation of the assassination of Representative Leo J. Ryan today with subpoenas for 17 People's Temple survivors, calling them to appear before a Federal grand jury that will begin hearing testimony here tomorrow.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  The sudden death of Representative William Steiger of Wisconsin at the age of 40 has been marked here by an exceptional outpouring of respect and affection for one of the most promising young men in the Congress of the United States.

title: DiplomatInvestigator in Guyana
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 7  The State Department decided last July to bestow its Superior Honor Award on Richard Alfred McCoy for exceptional and most exemplary service as a United States consular officer in Guyana. But a strange thing happened to the piece of parchment before it could be presented to Mr. McCoy, and other unpleasant things were to happen to the 44yearold Foreign Service officer shortly thereafter.

title: Soviet Artists to Aid Black Theater Group
description: Members of four Soviet opera and ballet companies will appear at Town Hall on Dec. 15 in a benefit for the Black Theater Alliance. The singers and dancers, now on a twoweek national tour, will perform excerpts from the repertories of the Bolshoi Opera and Ballet Companies and the opera and ballet ensembles of a second Moscow group, the StanislayskyNemirovichDanchenko Theater.

title: Art: What's New, Whitney Style
description: LIKE restaurants with home cooking signs, group shows with new in the titles tend not to fulfill the expectations they arouse. All too often, the newness of the art resides in the rationalization accompanying it.

title: New Program Guiding Teacher Assignments Gets Mixed Response
description: The man who led the fight against the Board of Education policy of assigning new teachers on the basis of race yesterday welcomed a proposed plan under which teachers would instead be assigned on the basis of where they live.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Argentine Peso In New Plunge
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 7 (Reuters)  Argentina's plummeting peso fell through the 1,000tathedollar level for the first time today, an amount that is onehundredth of its value four years ago.

title: Matrix Casts Jazz Models Into Own Special Mold
description: A ninepiece band that is finding its own direction through guideposts furnished by Ellington, Gil Evans, Stravinsky and Webern, whose material is inspired by such literary sources as Henry Miller, Lawrence Duiell and J.R.R. Tolkien and which has been acclaimed at the Monterey Jazz Festival in California for the last two years, is making what it considers its New York debut at the Other End, 149 Bleecker Street; tonight and tomorrow evening.

title: Events and Openings
description: Friday

title: Cities study Arts Variety
description: How to encourage diversity and distinction in arts activities in the nation's cities was one of the topics discussed yesterday at the opening session of the first intercity symposium for American urban arts administrators.

title: Record Truck Output Seen
description: DETROIT, Dec. 7 (UPI)  Yearend forecasts indicate that output of truck builders will be a record 3.6 million units in 1978, surpassing the previous yearly high of 3.4 million set in 1977, Automotive News said today.

title: Actors Plan Strike On TV Commercials
description: A Strike that would halt production of television and radio commercials has been set for 12:01 A.M. Dec. 19 by the boards of directors of two actors unions.

title: Dance: Ailey's Joplin
description: ALVIN AILEY has long been fascinated by the rise and fall of the popular entertainer. It is a motif that has recurred in his own work and has been used as well by other choreographers in the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater.

title: ALBANY COMPROMISE ON MORTGAGE RATES PASSES THE SENATE
description: ALBANY, Friday, Dec. 8  The New York State Senate today approved measure to increase the interest rate on home mortgages and to outlaw geographic discrimination in mortgage loans  redlining  after a frantic day and night in which the carefully woven compromise repeatedly threatened to unravel.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 7 (AP) David Graham of Australia birdied three of the final four holes today for a sixunderpar 66 and the firstround lead in the $210,000 Mexico Cup golf tournament.

title: No More Winking at Seg Academies
description: For years, the Internal Revenue Service has had a policy of denying taxexempt status to seg academies, the hundreds of private schools created to evade desegregation of public schools. There was little protest, since I.R.S. administered its policy with a wink. All that seg academies had to do to stay eligible for tax exemption was to say they do not discriminate. But now I.R.S. has proposed stern new enforcement regulations. Wink has become scowl and scowl has provoked a reaction  115,000 protest letters and an outcry in public hearings that conclude today. Some objections seem just, but for the most part the regulations are needed and we hope I.R.S. sticks by its guns.

title: S.E.C. Cites Hyatt on Disclosure
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The Securities and Exchange Commission today accused the Hyatt Corporation of having failed to disclose conflicts of interest between it and the Pritzker family, which controls 35 percent of the company's stock. Hyatt operates hotels, hospitals and gambling casinos.

title: Selling Advice on Leisure Time
description: Thanks to technological progress and a big increase in early retirement, leisure time has become big business. So, it probably was inevitable that people who have all this time would need someone to tell them what to do with it. Enter Patsy Edwards.

title: For Children
description: ANNUAL CHRISTMAS FAIR, sponsored by the Greenwich Village Montessori School, on Saturday from 11 A.M. to 5 P.M., with movies, creative activities supervised by Montessori teachers, Christmas gifts and decorations, toys, books, quiches and other baked foods, chill and home. made soups, at St. Joseph's Hall, 109 Washington Place, near Avenue of the Americas. Santa will visit from 1 to 3 P.M. Cali 9898611.

title: F.A.A. DEFENDS VIEW ON SAN DIEGO CRASH
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 7  The head of the Federal Aviation Administration, Langhorne M. Bond. testified today that the agency had rejected requests for bet. ter radar at San Diego because it reck. oiled that the money could be better spent elsewhere.

title: About Real Estate
description: Two wellknown hotel properties in Manhattan  the Taft and the nowclosed Sheraton Motor Inn  are in a period of transition that illustrates the diverging paths that older hotels are taking during this ebullient period in the hotel industry itself.

title: Stage: Recovery Lounge, Hospital Antics
description: IN the Recovery Lounge is not so much a play as a clone. It is a statistical composite. It is one more hospital play to thicken the epidemic of such plays that have been coming our way. It is one more lambsshelteringbrieflyfromlife'sst orm play, of the species of Hot L Baltimore or Kennedy's Children or something by William Saroyan. It is one more shipsthatpassinthenight play, in which several variegated strangers meet and share their lives in the confinement of some special situation.

title: Carter Will Ask Congress to Free Gasoline Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  The Carter Administration plans to propose to the new Congress in midJanuary that pride controls be removed from gasoline, Administration officials said tonight. If Congress does not reject the proposal, gasoline prices will go up by 2 to 4 cents a gallon at the pump.

title: Memo Discusses Smuggling Witness into Guyana
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Dec. 7  A memorandum found in the files of the Rev. Jim Jones and apparently written by an official of the People's Temple in San Francisco discussed the possibility of the cult helping its lawyer, Mark Lane, to smuggle a witness in the Martin Luther King Jr. assassination case into Guyana using a false passport.

title: Hoffman to Head Waldenbooks
description: Harry Hoffman, president and chief executive officer of the Ingram Book Company in Nashville, has been named president and chief executive officer of Waldenbooks, a division of Carter Hawlev Hale Stores Inc.

title: Lilco TimeofDay Rates Backed by Appeals. Court
description: The New York State Court of Appeals has upheld mandatory timeofday electric rates for the Long Island Lighting Company's largest customers, clearing the way for the imposition of similar varying rate structures across the state.

title: Kansas 90, Oral Roberts 77
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., Dec. 7 (AP) Tony Guy, a freshman forward, scored 19 points to power Kansas past Oral Roberts, 9077, tonight.

title: Dance: Nina Wiener
description: NINA WIENER offered the preview of a coming choreagraphic attraction Wednesday evening in the gymnasium of the Hunter College Campus School. That preview, however, proved to be an attraction in its own right.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL Nets vs. Washington Bullets, at Landover, Md. (Television  Channel 9,8 P.M.)

title: Directors of the Big Board Agree to Push Futures Trading Plans
description: Directors of the New York Stock Exchange agreed yesterday to proceed with plans to develop trading in a broad range of financial futures.

title: Fifth Avenue Becomes A Christmas Mall
description: New York unwraps its holiday gift to New Yorkers this weekend, when Fifth Avenue is turned over to music and dance. puppets and clowns, strollers, skaters and window shoppers. This Sunday and next, the Fifth Avenue Association. the city's Departments of Parks and of Cultural Affairs and the Mayor's Office of Special Events will join in presenting the annual Fifth Avenue Holiday Festival. For the occasion. the avenue will be closed to traffic between 34th and 57th Streets from 11 A.M. tp 3P.M.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: Burlington Northern Inc., the nation's largest rail system, said yesterday that its directors had approved a record $525.6 million consolidated capital spending plan for 1979, up 31 percent from the $400 million the road expects to spend this year.

title: Rangers Defeat Flyers; Islander Streak Hits 14
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 7  With banners hanging in the Spectrum calling him everything from a Traitor Horn to the Nixon of Philadelphia, Fred shero returned in triumph tonight to the scene of his early successful years. The Rangers rewarded their coach with a comeback 52 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers, whom Shero had coached to two Stanley Cups and four division titles in seven seasons. Shero left Philadelphia to take over the Rangers after last season.

title: Car Kills Teacher in Class
description: OXNARD, Calif., Dec. 7 (AP)  A car crashed through a plateglass window of a church and into a classroom yesterday, killing a preschool teacher, Lois Whitney, 47 years old, and injuring 12 young children, the police say. Police Sgt. Charles Dunham said that Helen Hancock, 76 was allempling to park in the United Methodist Church parking lot when she apparently stepped on the gas pedal in stead the brake and her car surged into the room. She was not hurt and not cited by the police.

title: IN THE NATION
description: JOHANNESBURG  An American who comes here steeped in the experience of the civil rights movement perhaps particularly a Southerner quickly learns that South Africa's race problem, only superficially similar, runs far deeper and more inextricably into the fiber of this country.

title: For Dinitz. Embassy's Hot Line Rinds for the Last Time
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  Simcha Dinitz was sitting on a couch in his office this morning, reminiscing about his five years as Israel's Ambassador to the United States, when the green hot line phone from the White House rang. He grabbed the receiver and within seconds was on the line with Jerrold L. Schecter, an aide of Zbigniew Brzezinski, the President's national security adviser.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Radio station WBAI is going commercial. Don't worry, fans  it's for two weekends only. WBAI's annual fundraiser, the Holiday Crafts Fair, opens this morning at Columbia University's Ferris Booth Hall, Broadway and 115th Street. Hours: 11 A.M. to 7 P.M., today, tomorrow and Sunday, and again next weekend. You'll find handmade items by 250 artisans  pottery, furniture, toys, jewelry, glass, leather, clothing, dolls. Also, demonstrations of scrimshaw, candlemaking and other crafts, homemade foods, entertainment and day care for children, younger than 6. Admission is a $2 contribution. WBAI will get a percentage of the profits Information: 2793400.

title: The Pop Life
description: MUSICAL humor has always been a tricky business. It's common enough for a comedian to crack jokes in a monologue, but all sorts of problems arise when those same words are set to music. Music itself, estheticians have long contended, is the most deeply emotional of the arts. The emotions it expresses hardly have to be grand or portentous ones. But humor, which trades often in the ludicrous and the exaggerated, doesn't always fit music very neatly, even when music is at its lightest or most lilting.

title: Screen: Conan Doyle Without Sherlock Holmes
description: IT'S not hard to figure out why The Adventures of Gerard, directed in 1970 by Jerzy Skolimowski, is only now having its United States premiere. Mr. Skolimowski has made some estimable films, most notably the beautiful and baffling Deep End, but he has attracted only a smallish following so far.

title: Pan Am's Halaby Writes On the Turbulent Years
description: Najeeb Halaby, a one time Navy test pilot, later headed President Kaennedy's Federal Aviation Administration, and then became president of Pan American World Airways. More recently, he became fatherinlaw of a king, and now has decided to tell allor at least quite a bit  in a book called Crosswinds, An Airman's Memoir.

title: Pants: New Life And a New Look
description: Is it still all right to wear pants? After What shall I do about hemlines?, that's the question designers hear most frequently when they meet the customers on their visits to stores, or even at dinner parties.

title: Holy Cross 72, Boston U. 65
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Dec. 7 (AP)Holy Cross, paced by Ronnie Perry with 24 points, led all the way but withstood .a scare tonight in a 7265 victory over Boston University.

title: Iranian Unrest: Whose Influence at Work?
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 7  For several days the military Government has been attempting to suggest that the strikes and street violence that have paralyzed Iran for most of the past week are the work of Communist agitators.

title: Hitting Star Would Prefer Move Elsewhere   5Year, $4 Million Contract Suggested
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 7  Rod Carew, a seventime American League batting champion, needs only to give his approval and he wilt move to the San Francisco Giants in exchange for three players. That approval, however, may not be forthcoming.

title: Democratic Conference AT A GLANCE
description: The Reason

title: Two Given Sentences In Klein Kidnapping After Plea Bargaining
description: Two of the three admitted kidnappers of Marci Klein, the 12yearold daughter of the fashion designer Calvin Klein, were sentenced to 8 to 25 years in prison yesterday.

title: Jascalevich Jury Asks That Jersey Allow Surgeon to Resume Practice
description: The New Jersey jurors who six weeks ago found Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich not guilty of murdering three patients have demanded that his medical license be restored, although it was suspended for reasons that only partly dealt with the murder charges.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: WE get in Richard Yates's thoroughly charming new novel, 'A Good School, what seems at first a familiar brew  memories of boarding school days, with the school in question, Dorset Academy, a pathetic parody of a New England prep school on its last financial legs; and the hero and author's persona, William Grove, a perfect wretch of a boy, at least as seen h the eyes of his French teacher, tJertlugullaPrade: His tweed suit hung greagy with lack of cleaning, his necktie was a twisted rag, his long fingernails were blue and he needed a haircut. He seemed in danger of stumbling over his own legs as he made his way to a chair, and he sat so awkwardly as to suggest it might be impossible for his body to find composure. What an advertisement for Dorset Academy. and author's persona, William Grove, a perfect wretch of a boy, at least as seen h the eyes of his French teacher, tJertlugullaPrade: His tweed suit hung greagy with lack of cleaning, his necktie was a twisted rag, his long fingernails were blue and he needed a haircut. He seemed in danger of stumbling over his own legs as he made his way to a chair, and he sat so awkwardly as to suggest it might be impossible for his body to find composure. What an advertisement for Dorset Academy.

title: Notes on People
description: One person who has observed some of the dislocations under way in China is Arthur Miller, the playwright, who recently returned home and is working on a book about his experiences, tentatively called Chinese Encounters and to be illustrated with photographs taken by his wife, Inge Morath. It's opened up a lot there, said Mr. Miller. They're trying to come to terms with the last 15 years, but it's very difficult. What his book will focus on is a lot of conversations I had with artists and theater people who've been behind the woodwork for a long time, and are now coming out. Were any of them familiar with his own work? Not at all, he replied.

title: The Morgan Glows With Winter Magic
description: NEW YORK on a fine clear winter's afternoon beats the Caribbean any day, in this observer's estimation. But when the wind gusts upon the corner of Madison Avenue and 36th Street it is a joy to be able to step aside into the Pierpont Morgan Library with the absolute conviction that there are few forms of enlightened curiosity that cannot be satisfied within its walls.

title: Women Briefed on Arms Talks
description: WASHINGTON  The air was thick with verbal fallout. Words such as throwweight, yield and MIRVing were being tossed around early this week, as nearly 400 women from across the nation gathered at the State Department for two days of conferences to learn how the strategic arms limitation talks affected them.

title: CARTER SAYS DELAY ON MIDEAST ACCORD WOULD BE SERIOUS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  President Carter warned today that it would be a very serious matter with farreaching and adverse consequences if Israel and Egypt failed to reach agreement on the text of a peace treaty by Dec. 17, the date specified in the accords reached at the Camp David talks in September.

title: U.S.Soviet Trade Talks End With Hope of Surge
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 7  The largest group of American business representatives ever assembled in Moscow ended a week of discussions with United States and Soviet officials here today, and both sides seem to have convinced each other that they really want to increase trade, not to use it as weapon.

title: Spasms of Artery Can Cause Coronary Attacks, Italian Doctors Find
description: BOSTON, Dec. 7 (AP)  A discovery that sudden spasms of coronary arteries can cause heart attacks may help doctors find new ways to prevent these oftenfatal seizures.

title: Dividends
description: THURSDAY, DEC. 7, 1978

title: Market Place
description: WALTER KIDDE & COMPANY, which made nine small acquisitions this year, appears to be looking at bigger things now. To make an big acquisition possible, Kidde sold a $100 million debenture issue last week at a price to yield 9.80 percent.

title: Carter to Meet Three West European Leaders in Guadeloupe on Jan. 56
description: PARIS, Dec. 7  President Carter will meet with the leaders of France, West Germany and Britain Jan. 5 and 6 on the island of Guadeloupe in the Caribbean, the French Government said today.

title: Young Charges U.N. Is Slowing Progress of Mideast Peace Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 7 The United States complained today that the membership of the United Nations seemed bent on undermining rather than encouraging negotiating efforts to achieve a peace settlement in the Middle East.

title: McEnroe Picked For Cup Opener
description: RANCHO MIRAGE, Calif., Dec. 7  John McEnroe, who has never played a Davis Cup singles match, will face John Lloyd in tomorrow's opening singles of the finalround series between the United States and Britain.

title: DISPUTE ON PREMIER RESOLVED IN JAPAN
description: TOKYO, Dec. 7  Masayoshi Ohira was confirmed as Prime Minister of Japan by Parliament today after a 24hour delay caused by a bitter dispute within the governing LiberalDemocratic Party.

title: Judge Reserves Decision On Election at Kennecott
description: Judge Lloyd F. MacMahon of the United States Court for the Southern District reserved decision yesterday whether to order that a new election of officers of the Kennecott Copper Corporation be held as early as next month.

title: Levitt, Lefkowitz Take Same LawFirm Posts
description: ALBANY, Dec. 7  State Comptroller Arthur Levitt said tonight that he would become counsel to the law firm of Phillips, Nizer, Benjamin, Krim & Balton after his term .expired next month. He said his post was identical to the one that the retiring Attorney General, Louis J. Lefkowitz, has already announced he would take with the same firm.

title: Messiah on 29th St.
description: A free performance of Handel's Messiah will be given by the Marble Collegiate Church choir, soloists and chamber orchestra Sunday at 2:30 P.M. in the church sanctuary, Fifth Avenue at 29th Street. Information: 6862770.

title: Workers Win DrugCase Ruling
description: PROVIDENCE, Dec. 7 (AP)  A suit by five former employees of the Electric Boat Division of the General Electric Company can continue because a Federal judge has denied a company motion for summary judgment, which would have ended the employees' case. The men filed suit in January 1976 after they were dismissed from the Electric Boat plant at Quonset Point in North Kingstown for allegedly using drugs at work. The company later filed the motion for summary judgment.

title: Jones Relatives Allow Autopsy in Delaware On ExLeader of Cult
description: DOVER AIR FORCE BASE, Del., Dec. 7  Permission has been received from the next of kin of the Rev. Jim Jones, founder of the Peoples's Temple, to do an autopsy on his body here, according to Robert J. Havel, a spokesman for the Justice Department.

title: Keeping Cool About Kabul
description: Afghanistan is one of those places, which statesmen have sometimes seen as grave problems but in which the attempted solutions turned out to be even worse as when 19thcentury British expeditionary forces perished and suffered there in the socalled Great Game against Imperial Russia in Central Asia. It is worth considering that point when viewing Afghanistan's new 20year friendship treaty with the Soviet Union, a pact hat calls for unspecified military cooperation.

title: Music: Rostropovich Leads Philharmonic
description: IT seemed strange to find Mstislav Rostropovich making a debut with the New York Philharmonic last night. After all, as a cello soloist the Russian musician had performed with the orchestra many times in the last 22 years. But this time he was was appearing as a conductor, a calling he turned to comparatively late in life, and so successfully that he is now music director of Washington's National Symphony.

title: Caroling in the Village
description: The West Village Chorale will meander through Greenwich Village singing carols tonight, for the third Christmas season, and once again we're all invited to go along and sing.

title: Soviet Dissident Is Sentenced
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 7 (AP)  A court in Soviet Georgia has sentenced Avtandil Imnadze, a dissident, to five years in a labor camp and four years of Siberian exile for producing and distributing antiGovernment material, the Tbilisi newspaper Zarya Vostoka reported.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Early buying pushed soybean prices ahead yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. It came when traders learned that overnight the cash basis for soybeans in the Middle West had strengthened.

title: Art: Segal Casts New Role For Color
description: IN the spring of 1979, the George Segal retrospective  organized by the Walker Art Center in Minneapolis and already seen therewill be coming to the Whitney Museum, and we shall then have an opportunity to review the sculptor's entire development and see how well his work as a whole has held up. Meanwhile, Mr. Segal has been in the news for another reason  the rejection of his sculpture called In Memory of May 4, 1970, Kent State: Abraham and Isaac by the board of Kent State University, where it was intended to function as a monument to the slain students, and its acceptance instead by the Princeton University Art Museum.

title: Malaysians Urge U.S. and West Take Boat People From Vietnam
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Dec (Reuters)  Malaysia proposed today that the United States and other Western countries take all the boat people fleeing Vietnam.

title: Key F.C.C. Member Backing Radio Decontrol
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  The Federal Communications Commission should consider dropping nearly all regulatory control over radio broadcasting, according to Tyrone Brown, a pivotal member of the commission.

title: Edmond A. Meets, 82; Long a French Teacher
description: Edmond A. Meras, instructor emeritus of French at Phillips Exeter Academy and a former supervisor in the Department of Romance Languages at Townsend Harris High School in New York City, died Tuesday in Exeter, N.H. He was 82 years old.

title: 11 Killed in Newark Blaze; Firemen Searching for 12th
description: NEWARK, Dec. 7  Eleven persons, including seven children, among them a 2yearold girl, died early this morning when a fire raced through a threestory tenement in the decaying Central Ward here.

title: Filipino Dancers Pay Tribute to a Cultural Pioneer
description: Here I am in America, but the more I try to cut my roots, the stronger they become, Reynaldo Alejandro said with a sieh overlunch the other day. A Philippine dance researcher and writer who came to New York City nine years ago to study dance, Mr. Alejandro is not unduly upset about the conflict. In an effort to return to those very roots, his Philippine Dance Company will pay tribute to Francisca Reyes Aquino, who is known as the mother of Philippine dance, in concerts tonight through Sunday at the Philippine Center Auditorium on Fifth Avenue.

title: Catch a Rising Comic At Four Showcases
description: YOU do know them. They are the guys who would do anything, anything for a laugh, in elementary school, on buses, in homerooms, at fraternity parties. They

title: Opponent Bars a Coalition Under Shah
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 7  Karim Sanjabi, the 74yearold leader of Iran's principal opposition party, said today that he would refuse to join any coalition government under what he called the illegal monarchy of Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi.

title: The Region
description: Marilyn S. Berman of Merrick, L.I., sued Resorts International in Federal District Court in Manhattan, charging that the directors of the corporation had conspired to conceal from the public damaging information about its hotel and casino gambling operations in Atlantic City.

title: 5 Inmates on Rikers I. Fail in Escape Attempt
description: Five inmates at the city's adolescent correctional facility on Rikers Island last night assaulted two guards and then tried to escape, but their attempt was thwarted by other guards who responded to an alarm. authorities said.

title: 25 Bodies in Chile Mine May Be Linked to Coup
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 7 (AP) Twentyfive bodies have been found in an abandoned limestone mine near here, and there is speculation that they are the remains of people killed during or following the overthrow of Salvador Allende Gossens in 1973.

title: Hefner Empire's Crown Princess
description: Hugh M. Hefner had a brilliant idea at the right time. But some people say his daughter, Christie, may be even smarter. She is also heiress apparent of the Playboy empire.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: The Carter Administration will ask Congress to remove price controls from gasoline. If approved, prices at the pump will rise 2 to 4 cents a gallon. Moreover, an expected 7 to 10 percent rise in OPEC crude oil later this month could add an additional 1 cents a gallon. [Page A1.]

title: Msgr. Daniel M. Dougherty Dies
description: Msgr. Daniel Matthew Dougherty, retired pastor of St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Church in Verplanck, N.Y., a teacher and retreat master, died of a heart attack yesterday in Stowe. Vt. He was 78 years old and was stricken at Clairvaux, the home he shared with his older brother, Msgr. John C. Dougherty, retired vicar of Westchester County.

title: Broadway
description: ONE problem with certified stars is that they are not available; or at least they are not supposed to be available, and so they are not asked to do plays. Who would have thought, for example, that James Mason was available? Who would have thought to send him a script? Morton Gottlieb  that's who. He sent him the script to Brian Friel's new play, The Faith Healer. Mr. Mason said be would do it; so did his wife, the Australian actress Clarissa Kaye. They will go into rehearsal the first week in February.

title: U.S. to Pay for Flights From Iran
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  The Defense Department announced today that families of American military and civilian personnel could leave Iran at United States Government expense during the political turmoil there.

title: Alternative Center Lists 2 Concerts
description: Two concerts are scheduled this weekend at the Alternative Center for International Arts, 28 East Fourth Street.

title: Harvard 87, Fordham 82
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Dec. 7  Harvard, which never trailed and which led by as many as 19 points in the second half, beat Fordham by 8782 tonight on the Crimson court.

title: Newhouse Sells 5 TV Stations
description: The Newhouse Broadcasting Company has sold its five television stations to the TimesMirror Company for $82.4 million.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The Home Section yesterday, about photographers studios, incorrectly described Henry Wolf as German in origin and 64 years old. Mr. Wolf is 53 years old and is of Austrian origin.

title: The City
description: A public hearing into Mayor Koch's plan to restructure the city's $35 millionayear antipoverty program, which was adjourned abruptly two and a half weeks ago amid a raucous demonstration, was reconvened yesterday at Town Hall before a small, orderly audience.

title: Maryland 69, Penn State 61
description: HERSHEY, Pa., Dec. 7 (AP)  Buck Williams, with 15 points, showed the way as Maryland beat Penn State, 69 61.tonight.

title: Democrat Files Court Challenge To Warner's Victory in Virginia
description: RICHMOND, Va., Dec. 7 (UPI)  Andrew P. Miller, the Democratic candidate, petitioned Richmond Circuit Court today for a recount of the Nov. 7 Senate election he lost to John W. Warner, the Republican.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: Bond prices declined fairly sharply early yesterday as the credit markets apparently were discouraged by news that producers wholesale prices continued to climb at close to a 10 percent annual rate. Late in the afternoon, the market recovered somewhat after the Federal Reserve disclosed an unexpected decline in the nation's money supply.

title: L.J. Homeowner Jailed For His For Sale Sign
description: The homeowner, Douglas J. Moran, 46 years old, the father of three children, was found guilty last Feb. 16 by Village Justice Frank Franco of having placed the sign in front of his home at 36 Lexington Avenue. Mr. Moran was given the option of paying a $250 fine or going to jail.

title: Railroad Buffs Putting Lost Lines Back on Tracks
description: KENNETT SQUARE, Pa., Dec. 1 Take a letter to E.M. Frimbo, world's greatest railroad buff, in care of his nublisher. The New Yorker magazine:

title: Text of Letter Sent By Jascalevich Jury
description: We the jury which completely vindicated Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich of all charges are outraged by the continuing refusal of the New Jersey state medical authorities to restore his medical license.

title: Restaurants
description: THE charming and solidly good La Bonne Bouffe on 34th Street, near Lexington Avenue, is just the sort of engaging bistro one comes across constantly in Paris, but rarely sees in New York. It is indeed a jewel  unpretentious, with a small but wellplanned menu and carefully prepared French food in the comfortable tradition of la cuisine bourgeoise, The long, narrow dining room is inviting, with rough. offwhite plaster walls and dark beams, copper pots and wall lamps casting a restful but adequate light. Tables are small and close together, and when the restaurant is full, the noise level is somewhat distracting, although a little less so than in many fancier dining places uptown.

title: Opera: New Don Pasquale at the Met
description: DONIZETTI's Don Pasquale, never missing for a long time from any opera house, returned to the Metropolitan Opera last night after an absence of a few years. It was a brandnew production, conceived by John Dexter, with sets and costumes by Desmond Heeley.

title: Theater: Nevis Mountain, Family Drama, at Negro Ensemble
description: IN Steve Carter's Nevis Moun. tain Dew, which opened the 12th season at the Negro Ensemble Company last night, a closeknit group of people are revealed as distinct individuals and as partners in bonds of birth, marriage and friendship. We meet these characters at the peak of stress, and by the end of the evening we know them with an intimacy and an affection seldom encountered today in the theater.

title: Wholesale Prices Go Up by 0.8%
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  The Government reported today another substantial increase, again in the doubledigit range, in wholesale prices in November compared with the previous month, suggesting a rough winter in store for the consumer.

title: OneThird of Footage In Film for Democrats Supplied by the Navy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  The Navy has provided the Democratic National Committee with about onethird of the footage of a 12minute film celebrating the Presidency of Jimmy Carter that will be shown tomorrow at the party's midterm convention im Memphis.

title: Tarkenton Is Featured as TV Presents Pro Games on 2 Channels Tomorrow
description: Fran Tarkenton, having an extraordinary season as he tries to carry the Vikings to the playoffs, can be seen on television tomorrow when Minnesota plays Detroit at Pontiac. Mich. That game, on Channel 2 starting at 4 P.M., will be the second part of a TV doubleheader, preceded by Baltimore at Pittsburgh, Channel 4, 1 o'clock. As has been their custom for years, the pros play on Saturdays, too, in December after the college season has concluded.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Campbell Taggart Inc., a Dallasbased food corporation, has named to its board of directors, George F. Bennett, who is managing partner of the State Street Research and Management Company, president and director of the State Street Investment Corporation and of the Federal Street Fund, and managing general partner of the State Street Exchange Fund.

title: Loan Bias Linked to Race More Than Area
description: After studying mortgagelending practices in New York City and four upstate areas, a leading urban research group said yesterday that discrimination in residential financing in the state was based far more on an individual's race than on the location of the property.

title: At the Movies
description: THE making of Movie, Movie, that charming and very funny spoof of a Hollywood double feature of the 1930's itself had elements of a show business melodrama, Barry Bostwick, one of the stars, was saying the other day over luncheon at Sardi's. Reports had circulated through the industry for months that Warner Bros., which becomes Warren Bros. in the film, had doubts about the finished production. Uncertain as to whether the audience would understand what it was seeing, the studio ordered an explanatory prologue by George Burns.

title: Playboy Settles Down to Work
description: Twentyfive years ago, when Hugh M. Hefner began to build his bunny empire by putting together the first issue of Playboy magazine  with its Marilyn Monroe centerfold  on his kitchen table, nobody could imagine anything but success. The country was ripe.

title: Sanitationmen's Strike Is Ended; Cleanup Expected in a Few Days
description: Private sanitationmen ended their weeklong strike yesterday and went to work collecting the thousands of tons of garbage that had piled up in the city's streets, rotting in the unseasonably warm weather and in some places almost blocking sidewalks.

title: Rescuing Alaska's Lands
description: President Carter made history last week when, in the most farreaching environmental initiative ever undertaken by executive order of an American President, he seized an opportunity handed him by Congressional default to protect nearly 100 million acres of the finest remaining natural, scenic and wildlife areas in the United States.

title: Music: Energetic Trio
description: BEFORE Beethoven wrote any string quartets, he composed five pieces for string trio. The earliest of these is the Trio in E flat (Op. 3). In six movements, including two minuets, it partly seems a cheerful, backwardlooking divertimento rather than a fullfledged concerthall work. But its character is ambiguous  the opening movement is relatively forceful, and there is nobility in the long, reflective Adagio.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP)  The Justice Department said today that a Federal judge had approved the Govern ment's entry into the Wilmington 10 case.

title: Met Stars to Come Out For Tucker Fund Benefit
description: Luciano Pavarotti, tenor, and other Metropolitan Opera singers will take part in the third Richard Tucker Memorial Gala on Jan. 7 in Carnegie Hall. Among those scheduled are Rgine Crespin, Marilyn,Bonne, Leona Mitchell and Rita Shane, sopranos; Alfredo Kraus, tenor; Robert Merrill and Sherrill Milnes, baritones, and Bonaldo Giaiotti and Paul Plislika, basses. James Levine will be the music director, and Francis Robinson will be master of ceremonies.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: T.V.A. NEAR ACCORD IN POLLUTION FIGHT
description: KNOXVILLE, Dec. 7  Officials of the Tennessee Valley Authority indicated today that the utility's sixyear battle with the Environmental Protection Agency over airpollution standards would probably end Dec. 21.

title: EARNINGS
description: Net income of the International Harvester Company slipped 3.2 percent in the fourth fiscal quarter ended Oct. 31, largely because of foreign exchange losses, and was down 8 percent in the fiscal year, the Chicagobased company reported yesterday. Sales rose 22 percent in the quarter and 11.7 percent in the year.

title: Answers to Queries on Mortgage Legislation
description: ALBANY, Dec. 7  Here are three questions and answers about the mortgage legislation being considered here important to people who are obtaining home mortages:

title: Eller Models at Library
description: Eight scale models of the work of Eldon Elder, former costume and scenic designer for the New York Shakespeare Festival, will he exhibited through February in the New York Public Library at Lincoln Center, Ill Amsterdam Avenue. Among them will bea halfinch model of the Delacorte Theater, which Mr. Elder designed in 1962. During his career, Mr. Elder has designed sets, lights and costumes for more than 250 productions in and outside New York. Hours: 10 A.M. to 8 P.M today, noon to 6 P.M. tomorrow mid Sunday. Information: 799.2200

title: Liberals Press Floor Fights Before Democratic Parley
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 7  Liberals rallied tonight to press floor fights at the Democratic Party's midterm conference after the party's national chairman. John C. White, promised them a chance to vote on their stands on inflation, national health insurance, family farms and energy monopolies.

title: Economic Scene
description: DAVID Rockefeller, chairman of the Chase Manhattan Bank, excited a brief rally in the stock market this week with his statement Lorfdon that interest rates are nowclose to the top. He warned the Federal Reserve not to push rates still higher, because the economy is already starting slow down.

description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: GUYANA AIDE TELLS OF REBUFFING CULT
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Dec. 7The Minister of Home Affairs said today that he had refused several impassioned appeals by members of the People's Temple to halt legal action against Jim Jones in the John Victor Stoat child custody case.

title: Deaths
description: KLIERSMariene. beloved wife of Murray. devoted mother of Daniel and David. cherished daughter of Dorothy Rosenbaurn. dear sister of Sue Wien. Services at BoulevardPark West 1450 Broadway. Hewlitt, L.I. today at 12:45 PM.

title: U.S. Expanding Use Of '70 Crime Statute
description: An obscure 1970 Federal statute, originally designed to combat organized crime and rarely used until 1975, has become a leading tool for prosecutions against businessmen, doctors, labor union leaders, government officials and others charged with whitecollar crimes.

title: Military, After Appellate Ruling, Starts Review on Homosexuality
description: Navy and Air Force began major reviews of policies concerning homosexuals today after a ruling by a United States Court of Appeals that placed limits on the practice of automatically dismissing homosexuals from the military.

title: Watts Cancels Concert
description: Andr Watts has canceled the seventh of his eight Schubert concerts in Alice Tully Hall. It had been scheduled for tomorrow night; refunds are available at the box office or by mail to the hall. Mr. Watts's eighth concert in the series will be given as announced next Thursday.

title: Subway RepairWork Delays Attacked in Bellamy Report
description: It takes too long to build and fix New York City's subways because of a series of bottlenecks  including one in the Mayor's office  according to a study by the New York City Council's president, Carol Bellamy.

title: Navy 88, Lebanon Valley 60
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Dec. 7 (AP) Kevin Sinnett pumped in 22 points tonight as Navy rolled to an 8860 victory over Lebanon Valley.

title: Connors Takes Final, 61, 61
description: LUCERNE, Switzerland, Dec. 7 (AP)  Topseeded Jimmy Connors overwhelmed Tom Okker of the Netherlands by 61, 61, tonight in the final of the $75,000 Lucerne invitation tennis tournament. Okker upset Me Nastase of Rumania, 61, 61, last night.

title: VOTE CHEERS SPAIN, BUT APATHY IS PERIL
description: MADRID, Dec. 7  Many Spaniards expressed subdued selfcongratulatory feelings today over the vote yesterday affirmingthe nation's new democratic constitution. But in political quarters, many saw the results full of disquieting portents for the minority Government of Prime Minister Adolfo Surez.

title: M1 Shows 3d Weekly Decline
description: The nation's money supply declined for the third consecutive week in the period ended Nov. 29, the Federal Reserve reported yesterday. The latest decline, which was largely unexpected, reduced the likelihood that the Federal Reserve would encourage higher interest rates in the near future, moneymarket analysts concluded.

description: Below 42d Street

title: Guitar Concert on L.I.
description: The Classical Guitar Society of Long Island will give a free concert of classical and popular compositions Sunday at 3 P.M. in the Heckscher Museum, Prime Avenue (off Route 25A) in Huntington, L.I. Information: (516) 2714440.

title: Public Money and Private Ambition Clash Over Future of Steel in Ohio's Mahoning Valley
description: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio, Dec. 6  Politics, pride and ideologies as contrasting as the white steam and black smoke belching from the Mahoning Valley's steel mills are complicating efforts to keep the men and women of the valley on the job.

title: Anne Gilchrist Wed To Eric J. Gleacher
description: Anne Lawrence Gilchrist, who is senior development officer at Columbia Pictures Industries, was married at the Madison Avenue Presbytarian Church yesterday to Eric Jay Gleacher, a managing director of the investment banking house of Lehman Brothers Kuhn Loeb. The Rev. Dr. David H.C. Read performed the ceremony, which was followed by a small reception at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Timothy Wetherill Knipe, stepfather and mother of the bride.

title: New Jersey's Gambling Fix
description: Since Resorts International opened its Atlantic City casino last May under a temporary license, its gross profits have averaged almost $600,000 a day and it has paid $18,000 a day in state taxes. All that gravy notwithstanding, New Jerseys Attorney cieneral, John Degnan, is now urging the, state to reject the company's request for a permanent license.

title: Edwin M. Moseley, 62; A Professor at Skidmore;
description: Dr. Edwin M. Moseley, author and professor of English at Skidmore College, died Tuesday at Albany Medical Center after a long illness. He was 62 years old.

description: Jessie Hendrick Hardie Bartlett, a lawyer who worked in the United States Copyright Office, died Nov. 29 at the Georgetown University Hospital in Washington after a long illness. She was 71 years old.

description: FRESNO, Calif., Dec. 7 (UPI)  The l978 California raisin crop appears to be the worst in the industry's history, with 75 percent of the crop lost because of disastrous rains last September.
