description: Cleveland's feuding officials stopped long enough last week to agree that voters should decide two critical quesions. Each by itself could mean the difference between bankruptcy and financial recovery.

title: Headliners
description: One never knows what is going to be nationally important. Certainly Francisco Franco, the former Spanish dictator, was nationally important, but how about 31 jeweled medals awarded to him? Last week. Carmen Franco, General Franco's only daughter, was fined the equivalent of $97,000 for trying to smuggle jewels of national importance out of the country. Mrs. Franco,who is the Marquesa de Villaverde but uses her maiden name, said when the medals were confiscated by mstoms agents in Madrid last April that she had intended to take them to Switzerland to have them set in a clock for her mother. The nationally important medals were reportedly valued at $25,000, and have been confiscated.

title: Ann Schiffman Is Engaged To Barnet Henry Fraenkel
description: Ann Rachel Schifiman and Barnet Henry Fraenkel, both of Allentown, Pa., plan to be married there Apri129 in Temple Kenesetli Israel.

title: The Tut Show Gives a Midas Touch To Almost Everyone but the Viewer
description: Forget about King Midas; it's Tut that has the touch. an exuberant mu seum official said the other day. He was referring to the goldfilled Egyptian extravaganza. Treasures of Tutankhamun. which on its museum tour of this country to date has laid down a heavy cash trail that may exceed $200 million in gross revenues to museums and local businesses, and has also racked up $13.7 million so far in gross sales of officially authorized Tut reproductions and catalogues.

title: Esthetics and the Eternal
description: IWENT to church last Sunday for the first time in many years. Neither a believer nor a nonbeliever, I went out of curiosity. I wanted to see why other people went.

title: Connecticut/This Week
description: AVON  Art Ritchie, woodcarving demonstration today, I P.M., Farmington Valley Arts Center. Last day of Christmas gift sale, noon to 5 P.M. Information 6781867.

title: ART
description: NEWARK IT IS rare when an artist becomes inextricably identified with one piece otsubject matter, but that is exactly what happened to Joseph Stella.

title: Christmas Mail
description: At this time of the year, perhaps only Santa Claus gets more mail than Roger Staubach does. It piles up in the Dallas Cowboys office. But not for long. Twice a week, the quarterback's secretary, Roz Cole, collects it in two big bags and totes it home to answer it. Many of the letters merely request autographed photos. Others require a written response. And twice a week Mrs. Cole delivers the photos and return letters to the Staubach home for the quarterback's signature. She estimates that each season he sends out about 6,000 autographed photos and about 2,000 letters. Because of the volume, the Cowboys supply the photos and the postage. Roger Staubach provides the thoughtfulness.

title: ANTIQUES
description: So wrote Sir Walter Scott in 1808, evoking agesold Christmas celebrations in the British Isles. On this Side of the Atlantic, Washington Irving, also writing in the early 19th century, noted that many Old World customs brought here in the 1600's were still followed. One such was the ancient English custom of preparing a Yuletide wassail bowl that Irving said called for using ale instead of wine, with nutmeg, sugar, toast, ginger and roasted crabs [crab apples]; in this way the nutbrown beverage is still prepared in some old families and around the hearths of some substantial tarmers at Christmas.

title: Collision of Two Trains in China Is Said to Kill 100 and Injure 200
description: TOKYO, Dec. 23 (AP)  Two trains collided in China, killing about 100 passengers and injuring 200 others, the Kyodo news service of Japan reported from Peking today.

title: Sheran Pollak Wed To William James
description: The Episcopal Church of the Ascension in Manhattan was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Sheran Claire Pollak, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ernst Pollak of London, to William Stephen James, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert James of Meadville, Pa. The ceremomy was performed by the Rev. Donald Goodness.

title: Teresa Stratas Is What She Is And Will Always Be So
description: Iyam what I yam and that's all I yam, Popeye the sailor used to proclaim in the old comic strip when Olive Oyl or Wimpy would try to persuade him to change his obstreperous ways. He was echoing an ancient sentiment that traces at least as far back as I Corinthians 15:810, and exactly expressing what Teresa Stratas, for one, would like you and the rest of the world to understand about her. Miss Stratas is an artist of international standing and a leading soprano of the Metropolitan Opera, but she refuses to talk or act like anyone's stereotype of an opera star  unless your stereotype of an opera soprano is someone who meets the press barefooted, in a black leotard and tights. Look, she says, it sometimes is hard for me to justify what I'm doing. Opera is very funny when it's not good  in fact, ludicrous. Of course, when it's good. ...

title: Ottinger Foe Is Staying in the Public Eye
description: WHITE PLAINS EVEN with no constituents, Michael Edelman plans to keep his political career alive for the next two years by performing constituent service. Mr. Edelman does not have any constituents because he lost last month in the race for the seat in the 24th Congressional District.

title: New Jersey/This Week
description: ATIANTIC CITY (Resorts International HotelCasino)  Steve Martin, comedian. Opens Friday, 7:30 and 10:30 P.M. (through December). $1921, includingdinner at 6:30 and 9P.M.., respectively. Show alone: $1517. Reservations suggested. (609) 3406169.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LONDON, Dec. 23 (AP)  Alan Sunderland scored three goals today as Arsenal swamped its North London rival, Tottenham, by 50 in an English First Division soccer match. The victory extended Arsenal's unbeaten streak to 10.

title: Economic Indicators
description: Statistics for commercial agricultural loans, carloedings, steel, oil, electric power and business failures are for the preceding week and latest available

title: ABOUT NEW JERSEY
description: THE knotty problem this Christmas season, at least for me, was deciding what presents not to buy.

title: The Pitfalls of Travel, According to Law
description: It is a truth universally acknowledged that a person in possession of an urge to travel must be in want of advice. Advice can come, of course, from travel books, travel articles or the experience of friends, but over the years I have collected the distilled wisdom of experienced tourists, in the form of The Laws of Travel, which may prove useful.

title: Devera Brown Sets Nuptials for Jan. 27
description: Devera Brown, a brand manager for Seagram Distillers Company in New York, will be married on Jan. 27 in the Roman Catholic Church of Our Saviour to David P. Grigsby, executive vice president and a director of Drum Communications Inc.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: Wednesday  Coach House Stables, Kenilworth Road, Rye, N.Y. Regular, limit and children's working hunters; equitation; 8:30 A.M.

title: This Week in Sports
description: The New York Knicks play at Madison Square Garden against the Philadelphia 76ers at 4 P.M. tomorrow, the Washington Bullets at 7:30 P.M. Thursday and the Kansas City Kings at 1:30 P.M. next Saturday.

title: Evolution of the Term
description: WASHINGTON  The term recession appeared in the economic literature in the 1920's, if not earlier. But it entered general usage only after World War II.

title: An L.I. Group Helps Free Three Political Prisoners
description: Bettyann Pernice has no way of knowing if the letterwriting campaign amducted by her chapter of Amnesty International was responsible, but the novelist Ngugi wa Thiong'o was released from Kenyan Prison this month, and that was reason for celebrating.

title: Egyptians Cooling on Israel as Peace Efforts Falter
description: CAIRO, Dec. 23  An Egyptian teacher assigned a composition recently on the peace talks last September at Camp David and noted that an 11yearold girl in the class had illustrated her composition with sketches of President Carter and President Anwar elSadat.

title: As Crime Rate in Houston Rises, So Do Grocery Chain's Rewards
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 18  The manager of the UToteM store, a woman in her middle 60's, had returned at night to the small quickstop grocery in a Houston suburb. She heard a noise, investigated and saw two burglats trying to break in. She armed herself and waited.

title: Letters. Who'll Help With Crying Babies?
description: Harold van Geldern's letter (Travel Section, Dec. 3) concerning crying babies aloft was quite touching. However, isolating tots in the rear of the plane, where the noise from the engines is loudest, and therefore more irritating to babies tender ears, would be selfdefeating.

title: Financier to Wed Diane M. Levine
description: Diane M. Levine and Thomas Jan Berger, both of New York, plan to be married Feb. 3 in the Unitarian Church of All Souls.

title: Dr. Charles Fish, 79; Biologist Established Oceanography School
description: Dr. Charles J. Fish, founder of the Graduate School of Oceanography at the University of Rhode Island and an American pioneer in marine biology, died Friday at the South County Hospital in Wakefield, R. I.,atter a long illness. He was 79 years old and lived in West Kingston. R.I.

title: Victors Ruthless and Unhappy, Pro Sports Psychologist Finds
description: Dick Nolan, the coach of the New Orleans Saints, was depressed. Twice last month, his team lost to the Atlanta Falcons on the last play of the game, ending its hopes of making the playoffs for the first time.

title: Lawyers Exempted on Damages Over Unethical Malpractice Suits
description: Even if a lawyer acts maliciously and unethically in starting a baseless medical malpractice lawsuit, the lawyer cannot be held liable for damage to the doctor's reputation, New York State's Court of Appeals has ruled.

title: NEW YORK ACQUIRES A CATSKILLS BUFFER
description: New York State has announced the acquisition a 4,363acre mountain tract that Peter A. A. Berle, who resigned last week as Environmental Conservation Commissioner, said would be probably the last land needed to protect the northern massif of the Catskills for recreation and conservation.

title: Around the Nation
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Dec. 23 (UPI) The United States Naval Academy has found a female midshipman's allegation that she was raped by an upperclassman to be without basis, but she and two men were punished for misconduct, an academy spokesman said today.

title: Architectural Extravaganza
description: The reader of this book will probably find it significant that the author is a European (a Dutchman, as it happens) and that he was first a screenwriter and only after that an architect. Historically, cultivated Europeans have tended to regard New York City either as Armageddon or as Paradise, but unquestionably as epitome or culmination (the living end?). In that last, Rem Koolhaas is no exception, and, of course, he is right. The city is, even in its decline of the last 15 years or so, still the scale on which all other cities must be measured, precisely because of the destruction it has wreaked on itself, precisely because of the insane, unbalanced behavior of those who run it, tear it down and build it and decide what shall happen to it. Enough of it survives  anxious, short of breath, by turns arrogant and cringing  so that the world (gladly or grudgingly) must say of New York that it is the para

title: Late TV Listings
description: 11 A.M. (Channel 2) Newsmakers: Mayor Kenneth Gibson of Newark.

title: New Game in Town
description: Sports history, the advertisement promised in big black type, will be made Friday, Dec. 22, 8 P.M.

title: Carey Grants Clemency To Four Drug Offenders
description: Governor Carey, continuing a Christmas tradition, has used his executive clemency power to commute the minimum sentences of four inmates of state prisons  all four of them women and all four serving time for narcoticsrelated oftenses. They will be eligible to be considered for early release by the Board of Parole in January.

title: Rockets Conquer Knicks
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 23  Troubled by poor rebounding and poor scoring from the backcourt, the Knicks lost, 129107, to Houston, as the Rockets had seven players scoring in double figures tonight.

title: Hollywood in The Era of the SuperGrosser
description: When movies like this happen, says Ned Tanen of Universal, speaking of his studio's recent Animal House, they start to take on a life of their own  whether it's this picture or The Sittig or The Godfather Jaws or Star Wars.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: Powerful winds from overseas  from the Middle East to China  continued to dominate the course of the American economy.

title: Presidents as Strawmen
description: NICHOLAS VON HOFFMAN, newspaper columnist and radio commentator, uses words the way a cartoonist uses pictures. He seeks deflate the pompous, caricature the familiar and reduce our comfortable assumptions to absurdities. It no accident, as they say, that Mr. von Hoffman and Garry Trudeau have been collaborators, and that Mr. Trudeau contributes a dustjacket blurb for MakeBelieve Presidents, a verbal cartoon history.

title: Philosopher Home Free
description: WILLIAM BARRETT'S The Illusion of Technique is that rare and delightful thing, a selfexemplifying book. Studies of art are often artless and banal, books on freedom are all too stifling and predictable. This exploration of freedom, like freedom itself, Is original and enjoyable, replete with surprise.

title: PowerMad Queen Bee
description: IT'S been open season on movie Moms ever since a generation of daughters raised in the shadow of stardom came of confessional age. Poor Mother gets it coming and going: she's damned for being a selfish career woman and neglecting her daughter or for not being a selfish career woman and trying too hard to be a mother (as in Brooke Hayward's Haywire).

title: If the Halls Are Decked, It Must Be Hanukkah
description: THE ground is blanketed with a crisp frozen snow. The creche has returned to its annual spot on the Town Hall lawn. The Muzak the shopping centers has turned Christmasy; so has the music in the school programs. Hanukkah must be nearly upon us.

title: An Island of Controversy in Westport
description: WESTPORT CONTROVERSY and uncertainty are swirling around land that  for more than a generation  has meant home and stability for people of modest incomes in this affluent community.

title: Music to Watch Chaplin By
description: HUNTINGTON TWO original songs and two new arrangements will have their first public performances tonight, the premieres representing an area of music that is, to say the least, much neglected: songs to accompany silent movies.

title: Sports Today
description: Falcons vs. Philadelphia Eagles, National Conference, firstround playoff game, at Atlanta.(TelevisionChannel 2, 12:30 P.M. Dolphins vs Houston Oilers, American Conference, firstround playoff game, at Miami. (TelevisionChannel 4, 4 P.M.).

title: DANCE VIEW
description: There was a radical ism in the 1960's, an attitude of revolution which encouraged innovations, writes Anne Livet of the Fort Worth Art Museum and editor of a new book, Contemporary Dance. But, she adds, an interesting point is that no new generation of choreographers hds emerged to question the concepts developed by the choreographers of the 1960's as Merce Cunningham's had been challenged a decade earlier.

title: TV VIEW
description: Athoroughly absorbing miniseries entitled Marie Curie is currently being shown on public television. In fact, all five episodes have been broadcast on some UHF stations in the NewYork metropolitan area and, for whatever byzantine reasons of scheduling, Channel 13 is just getting around to them now, on Sundays at 7 P.M. Based on a biography by Robert Reid, the television script was written by Elaine Morgan. The subject, of course, is modern science's most famous woman, the discoverer of radium and winner of two Nobel Prizes. She was idealized posthumously years ago by Greer Gerson in the Hollywood film Madame Curie. This British Broadcasting Corporation product, produced by Peter Goodchild, is considerably more detailed and less pointlessly cosmetic.

title: PAUL BUCK, AUTHOR ON RECONSTRUCTION
description: Paul H. Buck, a Pulitzer Prizewinning historian and a former provost and dean of faculty at Harvard University, died yesterday in Cambridge, Mass. Mr. Buck, who had retired 10 years ago, was 79 years old.

title: Michael Trager, Accountant, Weds Cara Selinger, Reporter
description: Cara Selinger, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Selinger of Yonkers, was married last night to Michael I. Trager, son of Mr. and Mrs. Seymour Trager of Little Neck, Queens. Rabbi Morton Gordon performed the ceremony in Temple Torah in Little Neck.

title: A Passing Kindness
description: I expect to pass through life but once, wrote William Penn. If therefore, there be any kindness I can show, or any good thing I can do to any fellow being, let me do it now, and not defer or neglect it, as I shall not pass this way again.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: WORCESTER, Mass.  When Ronald W. Haselton introduced NOW accounts six years ago here at the tiny,savings bank he heads, he set the thrift industry on a course of momentous change.

title: Lee Shpritz Will Marry Ruth Carol Berkowitz
description: Ruth Carol Berkowitz, a speech and language pathologist in the Carroll County, Md., schools, plans to be married next summer to Lee Shpritz, manager of a furniture store in Baltimore.

title: After 2,000 Years and More, Egyptology Remains a Growth Industry
description: The tomb of the ancient conqueror Alexander the Great, thought to be at Alexandria, Egypt, has not yet been found. The graves of the priestkings of old Egypt's 21st Dynasty still lie hidden. Much about ancient urban life at Karnak in Upper Egypt remains unknown.

title: Nancy Muller, Psychologist Are Married
description: Nancy Jeanne Muller, a financial analyst in the treasurer's division of W. R. Grace & Company in New York, was married at the Ebenezer Lutheran Church in Columbia, S.C., yesterday to Dr. James Dean Sterling, a clinical psychologist in New York. The Rev. Dr. Robert F. Sims performed the ceremony.

title: Big Scramble for Small Homes
description: With more than $150,000 to spend, Byron Savon, who is 26 years old and single, thought he would not have too much trouble finding a small twobedroom adult house in the WestportWeston area of Connecticut where he wanted to live.

title: LETTER TO THE WESTCHESTER EDITOR
description: When Mamaroneck High School awarded an honorary diploma to its most famous dropout, Norman Rockwell chose to reciprocate by giving the school a valuable work of art. In the story Recollections of Norman Rockwell: An Artists's Legacy [Nov. 19], Dr. Otty Norwood, superintendent of schools, indicated that because of a lack of security, he now wished to sell the Rockwell painting. He was quoted as saying, Funds raised from the sale will go toward a suitable memorial. What memorial could be more fitting than this legacy Rockwell gave his alma mater?

title: LONG ISLAND JOURNAL
description: WHEN Joseph M. Margiotta, the Nassau County Republican chairman, hears comments these days that his power as a political leader may have been diminished as the result of the loss of his candidate, Perry B. Du ryea, to Governor Carey last month, he issues a strong disclaimer.

title: Obituary 7 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Center Is Organizing On Cape Cod to Study Whales and Porpoises
description: PROVINCETOWN, Mass., Dec. 23  A new research center is being organized in this former whaling village to gather basic information about porpoises and whales, the huge creatures to which the town once owed its livelihood.

title: A Correction
description: A story in The Week in Review of Nov. 26 said that Northwestern University had scaled down its phenomenology program. Professor Samuel Todes, chairman of Northwestem's philosophy department, says that this is not the case and that four of 12 senior faculty members work mainly in phenomenology.

title: Head of Synanon Is Called To III To Be Moved to a Jail in Arizona
description: LAKE HAVASU CITY, Ariz., Dec. 23 (AP)  Charles Dederick, the founder of Synanon, will spend Christmas under arrest at his home because he is too ill to be jailed on charges of instigating a rattlecnake attack two doctors Say.

title: U.S. and Moscow Ready to Sign; Now for SALT III
description: Heads of state, be they capitalist or Communist, like to reserve triumphal diplomatic announcements for themselves. That left Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance saying that he and Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko were close to the end of the road after talks in Geneva last week on a new Strategic Arms Limitation Treaty to replace the 1972 accord between the Soviet Union and the United States.

title: Gunmen in Iran Ambush and Kill Two Oil Officials, One From U.S.
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 23  Gunmen armed with automatic weapons ambushed and killed an American oil executive and an Iranian oil official in separate attacks today near Ahwaz, the petroleum industry's operational center in southwest Iran.

title: At Home: Remembrance Of Things Eternal
description: I WENT to church last Sunday for the first time in many years. Neither a believer nor a nonbeliever, I went out of curiosity. I wanted to see why other people went.In a gathering that is a Christmastime tradition in New Canaan, all ages join in caroling on the Town Green, with the Congregational Church as a backdrop.

title: Turner: Folk Hero Who's One of the Folk
description: Whether Ted Turner really likes people is open for debate. But he certainly wants people around him, and he wants people to like him, and sometimes he works hard at it.

title: A.C. Scovil to Wed Katharine P. Oliva, Student, on June 9
description: Mr. and Mrs. George Oliva Jr. of Gates Mills, Ohio, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Katharine Perkins Oliva to Alexander C. Scovil, son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel K. Scovil, also of Gates Mills.

title: Paperbacks: New and Noteworthy
description: FINAL PAYMENTS, by Mary Gordon. (Ballantine, $2.50.) At 30, Isabel Moore has problems: her father, long dependent on her, has died; she is disillusioned with the Catholicism in which she was raised; she finds old friends and new loves wanting. Our reviewer, Maureen Howard, hailed this fine first novelist who invites comparisons with Mary McCarthy.

title: CHILDREN'S BOOKS
description: Think of all the rabbits of lore and yore: of Rabbits Brer, Jack, Velveteen, Punch and Redux; of Alice's Mad Hatter, Adams's Hazel, Potter's Flopsy, Mopsy, Cottontail and Peter (whatever you do, don't go in Mr. McGregor's garden); of bunnies couched in cute titles or cartoons Thumper, Bugs, Benjamin, Snuggle, Pat and Easter  to say nothing of creations by Burgess or Aesop. Which of this year's colony shows promise of joining their select company?

title: State's Population: The North's Loss Is the South's Gain.
description: WASHINGTON IMAGINE all the inhabitants of a city somewhat larger than Jersey City disappearing from the northern part of New Jersey in the short span of seven years.

title: Woman to Get $10,000 In a SexBias Settlement
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (UPI)  The Government has agreed to pay a former White House employee $10,000 in an outofcourt settlement of a sex discrimination suit, a Justice Department lawyer said yesterday.

title: College Names President
description: LONGMEADOW, Mass., Dec. 23 (AP)  Jeannette T. Wright has been selected as the new president of Bay Path Junior College. She will succeed Randle Elliott when he retires next June 30. She is currently dean and vice president for academic affairs of the women's school in this Springfield suburb.

title: ...and It's a Nice Place to Visit and Live
description: ELLEN POBER RITTBERG has asked for a Suffolk pen pal to tell her how to get to know the Island's eastern county better. Perhaps I can oblige.

title: Television This Week
description: Today

title: Byrne: No Comparison With Scrooge
description: SINCE this is the season to count one's blessings, it might be time to see how Governor Byrne has been tending to the temporal needs of members of the Democratic Party. If Mr. Byrne's concern for the wellbeing of just one group, former Democratic legislators, is any indication, he certainly has avoided any comparison with Ebenezer Scrooge during his tenure as Governor.

title: What They Are Saying
description: John McVay, speaking of his overall record after dismissal as coach of the Giants: I'm 38 and 30. The 38 have been terrific, the 30 were awful. There were things I might have done differently, but it makes no sense in looking back.

title: How Not to Fight Pornography
description: All over this country, a new campaign of terrorism and vilification is being waged against us. Fascist propaganda celebrating sexual violence against women is sweeping this land. Fascist propaganda celebrating the sexual degradation of women is inundating cities, college campuses, small towns. Pornography is the orovaganda of sexual terrorism.

title: J.D. Schatzberg Weds Gail Miller
description: Gail Helen Miller and John David Schatzberg were married yesterday at the home of the bride's mother, Miriam Turteltaub Miller, in South Orange, N.J. The bride is a daughter also of Dr. Wade Norman Miller of West Orange, N.J. Mr. Schatzberg is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Al Schatzberg, also of West Orange. Rabbi Eli M. Pilchik performed the ceremony. The bride's mother, a lawyer, is assistant dean of the Rutgers School of Law in Newark.

title: New Trade Agreements Are Building Bridges to China
description: The diplomats of big business have been proving themselves at least as effective as the politicians in building bridges to China. Deals signed in the months before Peking and Washington announced normalization of relations assure a record trading volume exceeding $1 billion 1978, and the latest contracts remove most doubts that China is emerging as American industry's most promising new frontier.

title: Mark Jordan Plans to Marry Catherine Ludwig in August
description: Mr. and Mrs. Gerald W. Ludwig of Scotia, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Catherine Louise Ludwig, to Mark Jordan, son of Thomas J. Jordan of Ballston Lake, N.Y, and the late Gloria Jordan. An August wedding is planned.

title: Leslie Simmons Sets June Bridal
description: Mrs. Leslie L. Simmons of Greenwich, Conn., has announced the engagement of her daughter. Leslie Frances Simmons to Charles Tomerlin Lee, son of Sarah T. Lee of New York and the late Thomas B. Lee. A wedding in June is planned.

title: Anne L. Nicholas Bride of John Chu
description: Anne Loomis Nicholas, daughter of Mr. and. Mrs. Albert G. Loomis of Somers, N.Y., was married there yesterday afternoon to John C. K. Chu, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jutang Chu of Hong Kong. The Rev. Robert Hybel performed the ceremony in St. Luke's Episcopal Church.

title: POLITICS
description: GREENWICH RUTH L. SIMS surprised some people last December when, after eight weeks of recounts and legal battles and a runoff election, she became the first woman to be First Selectman of Greenwich and the town's first Democratic chief executive in 73 years.

title: Animal Inn: Lodging for One's Best Friend
description: Attendants at Walt Disney World kennels have had many unusual and unexpected guests in their littlepublicized facility, which the Orlando theme park maintains for the convenience of visitors who travel with their pets. Dogs and cats of all breeds have been cared for; a ferret, armadillo, skunk, fox, leopard, black bear and donkeyhave also visited.

title: Firestone Knew of Tire Defects 5 Years Before Recall, Papers Show
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23  Although the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company told the public that its 500 steelbelted radial tires were safe, company officials knew as early as September 1973 that the tires were experiencing a high failure rate, documents released by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration show.

title: The Best High Comedy
description: BARBARA PYM, that most English of novelists has flowered twice, like the best sort of rose Her halfdozen novels were widely read in the 1950's and then lapsed into relative obscurity; in the last couple of years not only has her early work been revived, but she has written more. The revival was partly due to the fact that Lord David Cecil and Philip Larkin both picked her as the most underrated modern writer  in a feature run by the Times Liter ary Supplement in 1977. Excellent Women' and Glass of Blessings,  wrote David Cecil, are for in the finest examples of high comedy to have appeared in England during the past 75 years. This is terrify ingly high praise: Excellent Women, first published in 1952, is now reissued, and must justify itself.

title: Carter Backs Carey Plan to Allow International Banking Zone in City
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23  The Carter Administration, throwing its support behind an economic development priority of Governor Carey's, has quietly endorsed a controversial proposal to establish a free tradezone for international banking activity in New York City.

title: 5 Held in Drug Robbery
description: CAMP LEJEUNE, N.C., Dec. 23 (AP)  Four marines and a sailor were arrested yesterday and another suspect was sought by Camp Lejeune police for the armed robbery of the Naval Regional Medical Center on Thursday night. Maj. John Woggon, Camp Lejeune public information officer, identified the five held as Mark Baxa, 21 years old, of Columbus, Neb., a hospital technician; Lance Cpl. Jeffrey Verra of Schenectady, N.Y.; Pfc. Clyde N. Harcrow Jr. of Colorado Springs; Staff Sgt. Charles A. Kunz, 24, of San Francisco, and Pvt. James Hartell of Antioch, Ill. Major Woggon said two men fled from the center with stolen drugs.

title: Defector Says Jones Used 2 Methods to Control Cult
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 23  An unpublished book by a California woman whose family lived for six years inside the People's Temple says that the Rev. Jim Jones dispensed both physical punishment and his own brand of psychological cruelty to establish control over his followers, ultimately leading hundreds of them to take their own lives and those of their children at his command.

title: HOW SCOTTO
description: Soprano Renata Scotto is the Met's reigning diva. It took talent, a lerribile temper and a personal transformation for her to get there.

title: Sunday Observer
description: Hidden in a secret attic nook 250 miles from Manhattan lies a stash of the last authentic icides left on the continent. All mine. Just thinking of them makes me cackle with delight. Henry Ford must feel this way when he thinks of the Ford Motor Company. John Warner when he thinks of Elizabeth Taylor. William Paley when he thinks of CBS.

title: NEW JERSEY JOURNAL
description: THE state's DepartMent of Health is putting forth a plan to monitor the use of laetrile in New Jersey in an effort to determine if it has any benefit .fit in the treatment of canal.

title: Two Minds About Gasoline
description: Those big black numbers atop the pumps  some already read 93.9  tell more than the price of a gallon of gas. They are a scorecard for the Carter Administration's contest with inflation. The cost of gasoline affects the cost of living directly; it also has a psychological effect. The faster gas prices rise, the more inflation seems to be winning. And now the new OPEC oil prices alone will add perhaps another four cents a gallon to those big black numbers. Small wonder that some Administration officials twitch at any idea of pushing gasoline prices even higher.

title: G.M. Cheever, Mary Duplain Will Be Wed
description: Mrs. Charles Joseph Duplain of Boston has announced the engagement of her daughter, Mary Margaret Duplain, to George Martin Cheever of Pittsburgh, son of Dr. and Mrs. Francis Sargent Cheever of Wellesley, Mass. A May wedding is planned.

title: The Farber Case
description: Theodore H. White's article, Why the Jailing of Farber Terrifies. Me' (Nov. 26), gets to the core of the issue. It is not simply a battle between the judiciary and the press. The public's rights are also in jeopardy.

title: Topics Social Compacts
description: If your New Year's Eve is not complete without a glass of Dorn Perignon champagne, you may be out of luck. Even at $37 a fifth, repOrts The Wall Street Journal, stocks are already nearly exhausted. The makers, Maison Moet & Chandon of Epernay, France; have cut back their allotment to this country by 25 percent. There isn't an important name celebrity who doesn't order it, reports a liquor merchant in Beverly Hills. But why should that be, considering that experts have rated lowerpriced bubblies. like TatUnger Blanc de Blancs and Laurent Perrier Grand Sicle as superior in taste? It's an old story, which Thorstein Veblen told about 80 years ago, in The Theory of the Leisure Class. He wrote: In the nature of things, luxuries andthe comforts of life belong to the leisure class ... more particularly, certain beverages are strictly reserved for the use of the superior class. Or, to quote an executivelit Atlantic City's Resorts International as regards Dom Perignon: It's for people who want to show off.

title: SchoolBudget Votes Are Under Fire
description: BELLMORE WHO is eligible to vote on school budgets? It all depends on how old you are and where you live. Or does it? A current challenge to the schoolbudget vote in the BellmoreMerrick Central High School District may lead to a new look at the widely varying rules and regulations governing eligibility for voting on school budgets, which account for the biggest part of the Long Island homeowner's tax bill.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: How Their Innards Work
description: Most handheld games comprise basically the same electronic components  a microprocessor that includes memory capacity, a display of some kind, an oscillator that feeds timing pulses into the system, a keyboard for the player to enter his moves and a battery  usually not included.

title: Diana Dyer Fiance Of Andrew Watson
description: Mr. and Mrs. Daniel L. Dyer of Bronxville, N. Y., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Diana Woodruff Dyer, to Andrew Orr Watson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gordon Orr Watson of Essex, Conn. A March wedding is planned.

title: BOOK ENDS
description: AWHILE back, James A. Michener, whose books do not wait for reviewers approval to jump on the bestseller lists, was thumbing through a Library of Congress publication and reading once again how difficult it is for poets to get a book of verse published. Mr. Michener decided to do something about it, and on hearing the poet and editor Daniel Halpern claim that he could publish five books of poetry a year with $11,500, offered to underwrite the venture. Soon others got wind of Mr. Michener's resolve and they too chipped in.

title: Tut Show's Creator Leaving Met for New Wonders
description: ONE of the challenges that Stuart Silver solved in designing the immensely popular King Tutankhamun exhibition that opened last week at the Metropolitan Museum of Art was to move people through it graciously but decisively. In a few weeks, Mr. Silver will be leaving the Met in much the same manner.

title: Birth Notice 1 -- No Title
description: Births

title: Some Federal Officials Think the City Is Dragging Its Feet
description: The South Bronx has slid a long way during the last two decades, and if the current bickering among city and Federal officials is any indication, revival of that devastated area may be a long way off.

title: Renata von Tscharner to be Married Feb. 3
description: Renate von Tscharner, assistant planner of Bern, and Ronald Lee Fleming of Cambridge, Mass., who received a Master of City Planning degree from Harvard University, plan to be married Feb. 3.

title: THEATER
description: DARIEN THE Darien Dinner Theater has me eternally in its debt for staging the 1951 Lerner and Loewe musical Paint Your Wagon. It is the first time I have ever seen an unfamiliar musical at a dinner theater. As I pointed out previously, dinner theaters tend to stage only smash hits of the recent past. Paint Your Wagon, while far from a flop, was never a smash hit. It ran for 289 performances during the 195152 season, despite a score that ranks close in quality to My Fair Lady and Gigi  the betterknown works of Lerner and Loewe. Naming only two of its fine songs, I Talk to the Trees and They Call the Wind Maria makes the point that this is a score worth hearing.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Editor:

title: Marriage Announcement 1 -- No Title
description: Engagements

title: How Westchester's Congressmen Voted
description: WASHINGTON REPRESENTATIVE Richard L. Ottinger, Democrat of Westchester, was surpassed by only one other member of the House of Representatives in the 95th Congress in voting against measures supported by the traditional coalition of conservative Republicans and southern Democrats, according to an analysis of voting patterns.

title: Limited Ceiling
description: WASHINGTON  To the average bystander, it must have seemed peculiar that on the same day last week that Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance flew to Geneva to wrap up talks on a new strategic arms accord with the Soviet Union, another key Carter Administration aide, Zbigniew Brxezinski, told reporters that the United States would soon have to embark on a multibillion dollar program for deploying mobile intercontinental missiles. But to officials long experienced in negotiating with Moscow, the apparent paradox provided evidence that the Administration was finally corning to terms with the frustrating reality of arms control negotiations: Diplomatic efforts to slow the arms race often seem to have the effect of speeding it up.

title: ANTIQUES Yuletide Setting in Sussex County
description: LAFAYETTE AS ONE heads north out of this vintage Sussex County town, there's a beautiful old house just off Route 15. And if it snows tonight, there won't be anything around that looks more like a Christmas card.

title: The Nation
description: In Summary

title: Body Count Reaches 5 in Suspected Sex Murders in Chicago Suburb
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 23 (UPI)  Investigators using sledge hammers, power saws and pickaxes found three more bodies today as they took apart the home of a man suspected of multiple sex murders.

title: Article 15 -- No Title
description: Every year at about this time, a star usually appears over Tarrytown. A big star that people look for, since it has become something of a tradition at Christmastime. And people like traditions.

title: HOW'S HE DOING?
description: For years now, Edward I. Koch has had his trademark phrase: How am I doing? Lately, he has been trying out a favorite word: Terrific!

title: LEISURE
description: LEISURE

title: Susan Smith, Kevin Joyce Are Married
description: In the Roman Catholic Church of St.Gregory the Great in Harrison, N.Y., yesterday. Susan Helen Smith, daughter of Mrs. Joseph A. McManus of Rye, N.Y., and the late Walter J. Smith, was married to Kevin Patrick Joyce, son of Mr. and Mrs. John M. Joyce 3d of New Rochelle, N.Y.

title: BEHIND THE BEST SELLERS
description: Theodore H. White places himself in the tradition of those journalists who follow what the French call les choses vues observed reality.

title: World News Briefs
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Dec. 23 (Reuters)  The Government says that despite its rejection of new peace proposals presented by a threenation mediation team, it is prepared to continue negotiations with the Nicaraguan opposition.

title: Josef Marx, 65, Oboist Led Baroque Ensemble
description: Josef Marx, an oboist and musicologist, died Thursday night at Beekman Downtown Hospital following a heart attack. He was 65 years old and lived at 201 West 86th Street.

title: PAPERBACK TALK
description: The cult. It's scarcely five weeks since that ghoulish drama unfolded in the Guyanan jungle, but it's not too soon to appraise the performance of publishers who rushed instant books about it into the paperback racks, for it's a publishing truism that a book written, edited, printed and distributed with the speed of a newsmagazine has a life only slightly longer.

title: THE INDIRA FACTOR
description: Everything seemed so much less complicated back in New York, when I was first assigned to India early in 1975, several long months before Indira Gandhi's authoritarian new order abruptly descended upon this ancient land. What had made me so eager then to be posted here was that it was the world's most populous democracy. But by the time I arrived  four days after Prime Minister Gandhi had declared a state of emergency and suspended civil liberties  it suddenly wasn't a democracy anymore. And except for her, the Indians I had most looked forward to meeting, including Morarji Desai, were in jail.

title: Correction
description: The photograph of Chaim Potok which appeared on page 34 of The New York Times Book Review of Dec. 17, was taken by Jill Krementz.

title: English Town Keeps Up War On the French
description: WINCHELSEA, England, Dec. 21Another year has passed without hostilities in Winchelsea, the 10th since Frederick Curd laid down the burdens of war.

title: A Cranbury Father's Obsession Links SoninLaw to Murder
description: CRANBURY YOU could say that I was obsessed, remarked Alfred Kassab as he leaned back in an upholstered wingback chair. But what is an obsession? I want justice.

title: INTERVIEW; Trenton's Housing Advocate
description: HOUSING is at the center of the problems faced by New Jersey's cities, according to Mayor Arthur J. Holland of Trenton. He believes that the state must plan for a fair allocation of housing in order to adjust the socialeconomic imbalance in the central cities.

title: Hopes for Transit in Dallas Ride on Pink Bunny Buses
description: DALLAS, Dec. 23  After extensive market research, the Dallas Transit System has concluded that it can improve downtown bus service by painting its buses pink, adorning their fronts with a nose and two buck teeth and and sticking threefoot aluminum rabbit ears on top.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: FOR most of my life, the great war of Christmas guilt vs. Christmas gelt has been waged every December. In fact, to remain neutral in this conflict, it has beCome safer to call this time of year the holiday season rather than Christmas.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: The ninth edition of Paper Money of the United States ...The, Standard Reference Work on Paper Money, by Robert Friedberg, with some new material and revisions by Arthur and Ira Friedberg, is now ready.

title: GARDENING
description: THE magnificent red poinsettia has become as much a symbol of the Christmas season as the tree. Little did Joel R. Poinsett realize What would happen when he introduced the plant to this country more than 100 years ago.

title: Arrest at Water Agency Sought
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 23 (AP) Members of a tenants rights organization delivered a mock citizen's arrest warrant to the city Water Department yesterday. The Tenant Action Group says the department failed to meet a state requirement that tenants be given 30 days notice when water is to be shut off due to nonpayment by a landlord.

title: Holland of Cornell On AllEast Eleven
description: Joe Holland played only a year of high school football before going to Michigan, where Coach Bo Schembechier had cornered the market on outstanding running backs in 1974. But Holland, second son of Jerome (Brud) Holland, wanted to play regularly so he switched to his father's alma mater, Cornell, and sat out the 1975 season as required of transfer students.

title: GARDENING
description: THE magnificent red poinsettia has become as much a symbol of the Christmas season as the tree. Little did Joel R. Poinsett realize what would happen when he introduced the plant to this country more than 100 years ago.

title: Surprise Oil Price Increase Threatens AntiInflation Programs
description: The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries stunned the world last week by setting higherthanexpected oil prices. The increase appears certain to further slow the recovery of the global economy and widen the risk of a recession in the United States.

title: Catherine C. Silver Sets June Nuptials
description: Mr. and Mrs. R. Bruce Silver of Akron, Ohio, and Point O'Woods, Fire Island, N.Y., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Catherine Calvert Silver, to Robert Keith McNamara, son of Mr. and Mrs. Keith McNamara of Columbus, Ohio, and Point O'Woods. A June 30 wedding in Point O'Woods is planned.

title: Where to Take the Children if Boredom Sets In
description: WITH schoolchildren home for the holidays and perhaps at occasional loose ends, here is a sampling of companies that offer offbeat and interesting family or group tours:

title: HOME CLINIC
description: PULLING a nail out of wood is never a problem.when you can get a good grip on the nail head with a claw hammer. However, in those cases where the nail head is so small, or set so deep, that you cannot get the claws of the hammer under it there can be a problem. For those situations, here is a simple trick that always works.

title: U.N.'S '78 ASSEMBLY CALLED UNINSPIRING
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 23 Although the 33d General Assembly passed a record 231 resolutions before it recessed on Thursday, it was in the opinion of many diplomats here a disappointing session that Illustrated the need for reforms.

title: U.S. EMPLOYEE ROLL EXCLUDES MILLIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 23 (UPI)  AIthough official statistics place the Federal Government's civilian work force at Almost 2.9 million people, the number paid with Federal funds is probably at least 7 million.

title: Suzanne W. Reed, Designer, Engaged
description: Announcement has been made by Earl F. Reed Jr. of Princeton, N.J., and Mrs. Clarence H. Gellman of New York and Wainscott, LI., of the engagement of their daughter, Suzanne Willison Reed, to Douglas Edward Gilbert, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry E. Gilbert Jr. of O'Hara Township. Pa.

title: Washington Also Worries About ArabIsraeli Peace, and Riyadh About the Other Arabs
description: WASHINGTON  Ask most any Saudi Arabian about SaudiAmerican relations and the response will repeatedly dwell on Franklin Delano Roosevelt. Not F.D.R. in general, but his meeting in February, 1945 with King Ibn Saud aboard a United States Navy vessel in Great Bitter Lake in the Suez Canal. There the two leaders pledged a friendship that has lasted for 30 years, cemented through millions of dollars of aid, the involvement of four American oil companies in the Saudi oil fields, and most of all, through the abhorrence of Communism.

title: What's in a Name? Ask the Research Department
description: LOS ANGELES On March 16, 1979, Columbia will present The China Syndrome, a film starring Jane Fonda, Jack Lemmon and Michael Douglas. A great many people will probably think it has something to do with the latest chapter in U.S.China relations.

title: Huskies Take Race On the Nile
description: LUXOR, Egypt, Dec. 23  The first round of the eighth annual Nile international rowing festival took place today amid Luxor's ancient splendor. The University of Washington, representing the United States for the second successive year, scored a clear victory over the five other crews, representing Canada, Britain, Egypt, Ireland and Belgium.

title: CAMERA
description: When two or more pictures, or parts of pictures, are combined to form a new image, the result is a montage. Although montages have many practical uses tor the photographer, it is in creative photography, where no holds barred, that montage techniques really come into their own. There are three major variations of this technique currently in use: multiple exposure, sandwich montage, and collage.

title: A Merry Budget to All
description: WAS it the spirit of Christmas or the spirit of Proposition 13 that prevailed the other night when the Republicandominated Board of Legislators unanimously approved, with minor revisions, the 1979 budget submitted by Alfred B. DelBello, the Democratic County Executive?

title: SPORTS
description: WESTFIELD THERE was never any doubt about Harold (Butch) Woolfolk. Everything he touched, from football to a relay baton, seemed 14karat.

title: Argentina and Chile Accept Papal Effort in Dispute
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 23  The acceptance by the military regimes of Argentina and Chile of a papal peace envoyin their dispute over possession of islands near the Beagle Channel dispelled fears today of an armed conflict.

title: Wine Rundown on Rum
description: The highway from Le Raizet, Guadeloupe's airport, to St. Francois, parallels the blue Caribbean on the right. On the left are vast fields of sugar cane, the most extensive in the French West Indies.

title: Crime Rising in South and West
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 23  Violent crime and major theft, following a shift of people and money from the North and East, now appear to be creating an increasingly grim counterpoint to the vigorous growth and giltedged prosperity of the South and West.

title: IN BRIEF
description: The Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development predicted more inflation and slower growth for the United States next year, in spite of President Carter's policies. In its latest forecast of world economic trends, the O.E.C.D. predicted that growth in real gross national product in the United States would slow to 2 percent in 1979 from 3.75 percent this year. Moreover, the organization maintains that inflation in the United States will continue at 7.4 percent  a higher level than most other industrial countries which could spur a fresh round of speculation against the dollar. ... After two and a half years of intensive negotiations, Greece announced that it had accepted terms under which it will become a member of the European Economic Community. The move is expected to open the door for other poorer nations such as Spain and Portugal to join the richer economies of northern Europe in the Common Market. Greece is expected to become a full member in 1981 and will then gradually establish complete free trade in industrial and agricultural products with the nine other E.E.C. members.

title: A Victim of Youth Crime, 81, Finances Boys Club Camp Expansion
description: DETROIT, Dec. 16  The winds blow cold over the St. Clair Flats region, 45 miles north of here, signaling another long, cold Michigan winter. The windows have been boarded up at the Boys Club camp on Harsens Island, one of a hundred islands and peninsulas in the area. The children have returned to the city, although vestiges of their presence remain  rowboats neatly stacked, the blacks ened grass of a bonfire pit, an empty basketball court.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: PULLING a nail out of wood is never a problem when you can get a good grip on the nail head with a claw hammer. However. in those cases where the nail head is so small, or set so deep, that you cannot get the claws of the hammer under it, there can be a problem. For those situations, here is a simple trick that always works.

title: After the Fire, Tenants Return To Mop Up
description: It was a few minutes after midnight last Halloween morning when Anatoliusz Inowolski, a commercial attache at the Polish Embassy, smelled smoke seeping from the apartment next door on the 23d floor of 30 Waterside Plaza.

title: Music Notes: Adjustments in the Life Of a Competition Winner
description: Does winning the famous Tchaikovsky International Competition, in Moscow help a performer's career? Ask Elmar Oliveira, who won the coveted gold medal last July, and he will say yes. As tangible evidence is the violinist's replacement of Nathan Milstein in a recital that the latter was announced to give this Thursday at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. Mr. Milstein, Who will be 74 on New Year's Eve, had to bow out, and the concert was offered to Mr. Oliveira, who is almost a half century his junior.

title: Silent Cal Helps Fill Aqueduct Stockings
description: With the temperature at 42 degrees and not a snowflake in sight, 19,532 hopeful horseplayers spent the afternoon at Aqueduct yesterday looking for Santa Claus.

title: Kentucky Holds Off Orangemen by 9487
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Dec. 23 (AP)Chuck Aleksinas scored 20 points tonight as Kentucky lost most of a 24point lead before holding off Syracuse, 9487, in the consolation game of the University of Kentucky invitational tournament.

title: The Psychologist of Secrets
description: THIS book is a very readable account of Carl G. Jung's life (18751961) and work. The author is steeped in his subject, admires Jung as a psychologist, though not slavishly, and is greatly taken by him as a remarkable man.

title: Susan Goodman Engaged
description: Susan Goodman, an employment counselor at Plymouth Personnel in New York, and Glenn S. Goldstein, an internal auditor at R.H. Macy Inc. in New York, plan to be married July 15. Their engagement has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. William Goodman of Danbury, Conn., parents of the bridetobe, whose fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Goldstein of Brooklyn.

title: MUSIC
description: THE week between Christmas and New Year's is traditionally slow in the music world. So let me use part of my space today to tell you about two celebrations I attended some months back, but could not report on because of the newspaper strike.

title: The Wallach Family ReCreates the World Of Anne Frank
description: The theater seems to be very wasteful of its treasures. Ballet and opera repertories are constantly repeated. Even old films are regularly reshown. But the view of theater people seems to be, Oh, that play has been done, so why do it again? People have asked us that about this play, which was done 23 years ago. But what it has to say is something that never becomes dated. It's a play about the fortitude of the human spirit, and that transcends any period.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: Jan. 3  Triumph Sports Car Club of New Jersey meeting, at The Elm Room. Main Street, Little Falls, N.J., at 8:30 P.M. All interested persons welcome. Information: Bob (201) 3357069.

title: Bruins Top Sabres; No. 15 for Cheevers
description: BOSTON, Dec. 23 (UPI)  Wayne CaSliman scored two goals and assisted cm a third today to pace the Adams Divisionleading Boston Bruins to their sixth straight victory, a 64 triumph over the Buffalo Sabres. Al Sims scored the decisive goal for the Bruins.

title: Dear Pen Pal: I'm From Suffolk. . .
description: IN Suffering From Suffolk Phobia [Opinion Page, Dec. 10], it seemed that Ellen Pober Rittberg was afflicted by an anxiety attack every time she crossed the county line from her home in Nassau, and that she envisioned Suffolk as a wilderness populated by a handful of Suffolkites who rubbed sticks together to keep warm at night. She said she had placed an ad for a Suffolk pen pal so she could learn more about this vast, uncharted region.

title: Julia Child Is Stirring Up More Treats
description: For Christmas, we're invited out for both luncheon and dinner, thank God, Julia Child said last week. And I'm very glad, because right after the holidays, we start taping the next 13 programs for the series and we're working on another book to go with them.

title: POLITICS
description: AS a Suffolk County Legislator, William Carney of Hauppauge was lowkey and lowprofile, even though  as the only Conservative Party member in the Legislature, a minority within a minority  he had a madetoorder soap box.

title: Deborah M. Dillwoith Is Betrothed to Emil Kratzman 3d
description: Mr. and Mrs. John. T. Dillworth of St. Davids, Pa., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Deborah Margaret.Dillworth, to Emil Arthur Kratzman 3d of Washington and Bayport, L. I., son of Dr. E. Arthur Kratzman of Bayport and the late Mrs. Kratzman.

title: Africa's Many Troubles Defy Strategists of East and West
description: PARIS  France and Guinea kissed and made up last week, another move in the gradual evolution of Western relations with black Africa. It was one more example decolonized countries finding that Communist military support, however crucial at the moment of liberation, cannot take the place of Western economic development.

title: THE MARKETS
description: On Tuesday morning of last week, shortly after the stock market opening, James D. Hardesty was seated at his desk on the 17th floor of 36 South Charles Street in Baltimore. A man from the trading desk rushed into his office and shouted: I.B.M.'s raising its dividend and splitting fourforone!

title: State Police Step Up Drive to Get Minority Recruits Into the Ranks
description: ALBANY, Dec. 21  In an effort to increase the number of blacks, Hispanic people and women in its ranks, the Stace Police Department announced that it had opened three recruiting offices in Albany, Rochester and Buffalo this week and that it planned to open six more, including three in New York City.

title: The Shah Discovers New/Old Faces
description: After a quarter of a century of absolute rule, Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi finally seemed willing last week to share his power through a coalition civilian government. It was, it appeared, the least he could do and the most he would do  in the face of demands for his ouster. The Shah's difficulty was finding anyone who was willing to join him on his terms.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: Contrary to T.E. White's comments in And Now, From High Atop Bamberger's.. . (Opinion Page, Dec. 10), there already is an allNew Jersey television newscast on the air.

title: I.B.M.'s Big Split
description: It was, some said, a move designed to recapture the magical aura that had surrounded the company over the years. Others saw it as a clear play for the small investor  offering shares at a price the average investor can contemplate. One fact was clear: International Business Machines was enjoying a very profitable year and saw the earmarks of a similarly successful period in 1979.

title: They're Just Wild About National
description: MIAMI  When L.B. Maytag, the chairman of National Airlines, was asked last year about recurrent reports that his 317,000 shares of the company were for sale he replied: Absolutely not. Anyway. who would want to buy?

title: Vietnam Halts Trains to China
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 23 (Reuters) Vietnam announced today the suspension of railroad service to China, according to the Vietnam News Agency. The agency, monitored here, said. the suspension followed an announcement of similar action taken by the Chinese earlier this week.

title: Gail Anne Turner, a Teacher, To Be Married to Peter Spier
description: Gail Anne Turner, an art teacher in the Harwich, Mass., high schools, and Peter Spier, owner of a custom jewelry business in Orleans, Mass., plan to be married.

title: Food
description: For six days last summer, 17 members of a cooking course in rural Oregon kept six minikitchens busy from morning until midafternoon. Some had come from Portland and Astoria to stay in the lumber town of Seaside; others had traveled from Washington, California, Illinois and Kentucky.

title: The Truth About Marijuana
description: AT A time when strong, determined forces at top levels of government are pressing for the decriminalization of marijuana and hashish in New Jersey and elsewhere, it seems essential that citizens should look seriously into the issue and discover the truth about marijuana.

title: Rene Fox Fiance Of Philip Brietfeld
description: Mr. and Mrs. William Fox of West Brighton, Staten Island, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Rene Ellen Fox, to Philip Paul Brietfeld of Waterloo, N.Y. The couple are senior medical students at the University of Rochester School of Medicine and Dentistry.

title: Life or Death Questions for Bhutto and Pakistan
description: NEW DELHI  Former Prime Minister Zulfikar All Bhutto, who now sits on an iron cot in a small, bleak prison cell in Rawalpindi waiting to hear whether or not he will be hanged on a murder charge, still dominates Pakistan's political scene almost as much as he did during his tumultuous years in power. Everything is in abeyance till the verdict, said a businessman who deals with the Government.

title: Bordentown: Is It the Potential Site of a Time Bomb?
description: ALARGE national chemical company has launched an extensive advertising campaign on television in which it offers dramatic demonstrations  they usually involve the saving of a human life  to make its point that, without chemicals, life itself would be impossible.

title: PEOPLE
description: The banking community got a jolt last week when Klaus Jacobs, president of the European American Bank, resigned over what was described as internal policy differences.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Medieval Mime

title: Terrorists Kill Briton On Cambodian Visit; 2 Americans Unhurt
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 23 (AP)  Two American journalists escaped unhurt from terrorist attack in Cambodia in which British scholar was killed, The St. Louis PostDispatch reported today.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: It would seem to be Michael Bennett's very special gift Ilet us see exactly what dancing is by filtering it through the dancers imperfections. In A Chorus Line the imperfections came about naturally enough. Far too many gypsies were applying for the eight jobs available; all were trained craftsmen, some had to be more able than others. And so Mr. Bennett put them through their paces, two by two and four by four, carefully letting us see a tardy spin here, a beat too many there, as the rehearsal piano rattled on. The show contained nothing more revealing. The dancers mishaps were subtle, and yet just sufficiently accented to throw a pattern askew. And as the pattern went askew, we realized what it ought to have been. We came to its airborn glories backwards, in a way, enjoying an ultimate perfegtion all the more because we'd first seen violated. A tricky and magical business, that.

title: CONNECTICUT HOUSING
description: ONE of several publications about the ownership of property is Street Talk, out of New Haven and available free to residents of the state. Developed last year by the Regional Rehabilitation Institute under a grant from the Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development, Street Talk is a lively quarterly magazine aimed at increasing the quality and possibilities of urban homeownership.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: A year ago the world's oil consuming countries gratefully acknowledged the decision of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries' ministerial conference to freeze the world price of crude oil for the year 1978. Last Sunday, OPEC had no such Christmas sift for its customers.

title: Electronic Games Get Retail Play
description: And what did the toy industry want for Christmas? Maybe something new, a product that would steadily sell throughout the yearto adults as well as youngsters  and in the process not erode the market for conventional toys?

title: CHINA'S PARTY SETS EXPANDED ECONOMY AS KEY ISSUE FOR '79
description: CANTON, Dec. 23  The Chinese Communist Party has pledged to devote itself largely to economic development beginning next year and has expanded its riling Politburo with the addition of four members associated with the moderate wing, it was announced today.

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: I was delighted to read David L. Shirey's complimentary review [Nov. 19] of the environmental sculpture of Mary Miss at the Nassau County Museum of Fine Arts. However, credit for the distinguished and innovative sculpture program should be properly given.

title: A Journey In Search of The Meaning Of Christmas
description: EVERY so often my imagination gets the best of me as I attempt to pray in the morning. It usually happens when I have not slept well or long enough the night before. What follows here are the vagaries that slipped through my mind several days ago.

title: The Making of a City Neighborhood
description: Hemmed in by warehouses, factories and garages, the streets are still cobbled. Not much has changed, in many ways, since the turn of the century. The buildings are the same, wellworn, now, but not deteriorating. From the river nearby comes an occasional whiff of salt air. At the wholesale meat markets to the north, workers in white smocks still sort carcasses of beef.

title: THOMAS M. RETTEW 3d
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Dec. 23 (AP) Thomas M. Rettew 3d, editor of the Sunday edition of The Wilmington News Journal, died Thursday night. He was 51 years old.

title: Stronger Growth
description: Thanks to substantial gains in employment and personal income, there's a Christmas gift in store for the nation: a stronger than expected economic growth rate that may reach 5 percent for the fourth quarter.

title: CHESS
description: Kenneth Rogoff of Somerville, Mass., was awarded the grandmaster title at the general assembly of the International Chess Federation in Buenos Aires during the recent World Chess Olympiad. There had been no question about the caliber of Rogoff's play over the last five years, only whether he would compete in events for which grandmaster qualifying norms were established. When tournament invitations are passed out, they go first to established grandmasters.

title: Marc Hirschorn Fianc Of Elyse Gail Wallach
description: Dr. and Mrs. Marvin Wallach of HollIS Hills, Queens, have announced the engagement of their daughter. Elyse Gail Wallach, to Marc Drew Hirschorn, son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Hirschorn of Hillcrest, Queens.

title: Scientists Forecasting Beam Through Earth To Transmit Messages
description: Scientists from Western Washington University say they have carried out the first successful demonstration that neutrinos  mysterious nuclear particles that have neither electric charge nor mass  can be used to carry human messages directly through the earth.

title: Splendors and Surprises Of a Christmas Abroad
description: The thin, reedy drone or bagpipes, which begins around midDecember, is one of the first indications that the Advent season has arrived on Rome. Over at Piazza Navona, kiosks begin to sprout around the majestic Fountain of the Four Rivers, until the square is a forest of brightly colored plastic. More slowly, nativity scenes go up in churches and in a few spots outdoors. Then the corridorlike streets off the Piazza di Spagna, housing some of Rome's most elegant shops, do their holiday best, with red carpeting and branches of greenery.

title: DINING OUT
description: PHILIP'S LA NORMANDIE has all the hallmarks of elegant dining at its best. The dining rooms are attractive, one with an inviting, almost reallooking gas fire in the fireplace, the other with a mirrored end wall that enlarges and glamorizes the room. There are splendid personalized flourishes  a covered silver butter dish and coffee served in silver pot on a silver traythat make the dining experience intimate and pleasant. The darkened rooms invite romantic dining. And the youthful staff is agreeable and eager to serve.

title: Marriage Announcement 2 -- No Title
description: Marriages

title: Paperback Best Sellers
description: Massmarket paperbacks are softcover books sold at newsstands, variety stores and supermarkets, as well as in bookstores. This listing is based on computerprocessed reports from bookstores and representative wholesalers with more than 40,000 outlets across the United States.

title: U.S. AND SOVIET REACH ACCORD ON MOST WEAPONS QUESTIONS RUT FAIL TO CONCLUDE TREATY
description: GENEVA, Dec. 23  The United States and the Soviet Union said today that they had reached agreement on most issues holding up a treaty on the limitation of strategic arms, but had failed to conclude the accord in three days of talks between Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance and Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko.

title: Westchester/This Week
description: ELMSFORD  The Music Man, tonight and Tuesday to next Sunday (through Feb. 18). Opens 6:15 P.M., buffet at 7, show at 8:30. Sundays an hour earlier. $18.15 to $20.35. New Year's Eve package includes buffet, cocktails, show and dancing: $95 a couple. Reservations. An Evening Dinner Theater, 11 Clearbrook Rd. 5922222.

title: Passion for Words
description: The publisher's blurb on the dust jacket calls this book a Pandora's box of quotes for any ??ose Edward F. Murphy should sue. Cornucopia, maybe, or Comstock lode, or garden of earthly delights, but not Pandora's box.

title: Carol A. Yelverton Becomes the Bride Of Robert Brown
description: Carol Ann Yelverton and Robert William Brown were married yesterday by the Rev. M. Joseph Farley in St. Luke's Episcopal Church in Forest Hills Gardens, Queens.

title: State Officials in Ohio Reluctant To Intervene in Cleveland Default
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 22  When New York City was on the brink of fiscal collapse several years ago, lawmakers and officials from the city and state were traveling in such numbers and with such frequency between Manhattan and Albany, the state capital, that it was often hard to tell who was where. The congregation of state officials around New York City's sickbed left no doubt that the state was on the case.

title: Radio
description: 7:308 A.M., WABC: Message of Israel. Interfaith in Action.

title: Hope Potter Plans March Bridal
description: Lars S. Potter Jr. and Mrs. Andr O. Koehn of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Hope Timpson Potter, to George Stedman Woodward 4th, son of Mrs. Woodward 3d of Cincinnati and the late Mr. Woodward.

title: NEW JERSEY GUIDE
description: The BestLoved Carols of the Season, an annual event, will be presented at Sacred Heart Cathedral in Newark at 11 P.M. The program is preceded by a traditional church service conducted by the Rev. Joseph F. Flusk, rector.

title: The Making of the Writer
description: HARRY CREWS has written eight novels, the most recent being A Feast of Snakes. The first, The Gospel Singer, was published in 1969. when Mr. Crews was 34. On the surface, his novels are howling mad asylums full of freaks, like those found in Diane Arbus's photographs. In The Gospel Singer, there is Foot, a man the Lord has equipped with a gigantic right appendage. The Fat Man, protagonist of Naked in Garden Hills, weighs nearly 500 pounds and gets through each day by downing gallons of Metrecal. In Car there is Herman Mack, who eats and passes.the parts of an automobile each day in the lobby of a Jacksonville, Fla., hotel. In The Gypsy's Curse, Marvin Molar is a legless gymnast who can handstand on his middle finger and rotate. Because of Mr. Crews's fascination with freaks, his fiction has been called obsessed, grotesque and gratuitously bizarre. Jean Stafford once called him the proprietor of a Hieronymus Bosch landscape in Dixie.

title: IN THE NATION
description: During the mid1950's, the young chaplain of Pretoria University in South Africa was going through a period of soulsearching. Born an Afrikaner, an ordained minister of the Dutch Reformed Church, since 1940 a member of the secret Broederbond through which Afrikaners wield enormous influence in the Government, the Rev. Beyers Naude was beginning to lose faith in much of what he'd been taught to believe  particularly in the system of apartheid by which the Afrikaner government had imposed absolute white control over South Africa's black majority.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Obituary 6 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: BRIDGE
description: It is not easy to come up with an entirely original approach to the solution of a problem at the bridgetable. In more than half a century, one might think that everything has been tried. However, West found a unique action on the diagramed deal. It was described by F. M. Hargreave in an entertaining article entitled The Frenzied Four in a recent issue of the British Popular Bridge Monthly.

title: Yacht Body Assails Soviet Construction
description: Preparation for the 1980 Olympic yachting events has not been smooth sailing for the Soviet Union. The International Yacht Racing Union has voted not to let the Russians supply all of the boats for one of the Olympic onedesign classes.

title: News Summary
description: SUNDAY, DECEMBER 24, 1978

title: Realty News
description: J. F. Jelenko & Company of New Rochelle, N. Y., has purchased a 7.25acre site in the Westchester Business Park in Armonk, N. Y., on which it plans to erect a 75,000 square foot building for its executive, sales and administrative headquarters.

title: The Definition Is Disputed and So Are the Economic Predictions for 1979
description: WASHINGTON  Slump, slowdown, downturn, recession  does the word matter? To the worker laid off or the youth who can't find a first job, not a bit. But to a President thinking about running for reelection, a Presidential adviser deciding what economic medicine to prescribe or a securities analyst counseling customers about managing their money, the nuances matter a great deal.

title: A Surviving Human Rights Panel Seeks New Power
description: WITHIN the next few weeks, the Yonkers City Council is expected to act on a resolution asking the State Legislature to amend the human rights laws to give cities with populations of more than 190,000 the powers to subpoena witnesses and evidence and to impose penalties, powers now reserved to New York City's. Human Rights Commission alone.

title: Dr. Jane Hannaway Bride of Joseph Stiglitz
description: St. Paul's Chapel of Columbia University was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Dr. Jane Hannaway, daughter of Madelyn Broderick Hannawav of Manchester. N. H., and the late Dr. Edward Hannaway, to Joseph E. Stiglitz, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nat Stiglitz of Griffith, Ind. Rabbi Albert Sturmer and the Rev. Louis Gioia, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated.

title: ART
description: RICHARD SMITH, whose work is on view at the Hudson River Museum, is one of the most inventive painters of the contemporary art scene. Ever since the British artist became known in this country in the 1960's, we have been strongly aware of his resourcerul experimentation and perceptive innovation with different visual formats: His workmay not have always pleased, but it challenged our thinking processes about art and opened up new esthetic perspectives.

title: Best Sellers
description: FICTION

title: Christian Marauders Hamper UN's Lebanon Force
description: TIBNIN, Lebanon  United Nations peacekeepers in southern Lebanon are becoming exasperated.

title: Missouri Conquers L.S.U. Eleven, 2015
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 23 (AP)  James Wilder scored one touchdown and rushed for 121 yards today in leading Missouri's Tigers to a 2015 victory over Louisiana State in the 20th annual Liberty Bowl.

title: Lisa Kamil Fiance Of Whitney Talcott
description: The engagement of Lisa Susan Kamil to Whitney Agnew Talcott has been announced by Dr. and Mrs. Richard S. Kamil of Birmingham, Mich., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mrs. Agnew Allen Talcott of Old Lyme, Conn., and the late Mr. Talcott.

title: Traditional Plants Of Christmastide Have Ancient Roots
description: They presented unto him gifts; gold, frankincense and myrrh. (Matt. 2:11). One of the gifts brought to the Christ child by the three Kings was an incense, which has its roots in the term freelighting. At one time, it was regarded as precious as gold. It is an aromatic resin from a tree related to the turpentine or terebinth tree and its rather pretty flowers are shaped like a star. The foliage somewhat resembles our native mountain ash and the wood is very hard and valued. The incense is made from a resin which dries into a semitransparent yellow color. It has a bitter taste and gives off a strong balsam odor when burned. The material was used by the ancients for embalming and for fumigating. And it is said that the Babylonians burned costly pounds of frankincense each year in dedication to their god, Bel.

title: Deaths
description: BROLINBarnett, on Dec 22, 1978. Beloved husband of the late Beckle. Devoted father of Abraham and father-in-law of Frances. Loving grandfather of Stephen Brolin. Dear greatgrandfather of Todd and Jonathan Brolin. Services wilt be held at the Hellman Memorial ChaPels, Inc.,1532 Grand Concourse, Bronx, NY at 10 AM today.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: PULLING a nail out of wood is never a problem when you can get a good grip on the nail head with a claw hammer. However, in those cases where the nail head is so small, or set so deep, that you cannot get the claws of the hammer under ??, there can be a problem. For those situation here is a simple trick that always works.

title: Census of 1980 Will Cost More, But Auditors Doubt More Data
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 23 (AP)  Even though the 1980 census will cost roughly (our times more than the census of 1970, Government auditors say that taxpayers will probably not get much more information for the expense, nearly $1 billion.

title: Farmers in the Plains States Join In a Quiet Movement for Parity
description: PRATT, Kan., Dec. 23 (AP)  A howling wind, chilly harbinger of the approaching winter on the central plains, swept across U.S. 54 as a few farmers huddled in the warmth of the farm strike office to discuss plans for a tractor caravan to the state capital.

title: Ann Cox Fiancee Of Thomas Halkett
description: Mr. and Mrs. Maxwell E. Cox of Brooklyn Heights and Ashville. Me., have amounced the engagement of their daughter, Ann Barnes Cox, to Thomas Richmond Halkett, son of Mr. and Mrs. James E. Halkett of Bangor, Me.

title: Plan Unveiled Last Week Addressed Administration's Chaotic Nonpolicy
description: WASHINGTON  In the early months of the Carter Administration, the millions of illegal aliens in this country suddenly became undocumented aliens  a change intended to portray them as economic refugees rather than criminals. It was also intended as a steptoward a new and perhaps more humane policy. But developing a new policy has proved more difficult than coining a new term, and the Administration is still struggling with inherited difficulties over what to do about the estimated 8 million to 12 million aliens.

title: Marriage Announcement 3 -- No Title
description: Engagements

title: Holiday's Rush Is Full of Cheer And Anxieties
description: It was well past noon yesterday when Paulette Smith of Brooklyn realized that Christmas was only a day away and that there was still shopping to be done. So she bundled up and went out.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: PULLING a nail out of wood is never a problem when you can get a good grip on the nail head with a claw hammer. However, in those cases where the nail head is so small, or set so deep, that you cannot get the claws of the hammer under it, there can be a problem. For those situations, here is a simple trick that always works.

title: ANTIQUES
description: THE new home of Valdemar F.
