description: RUNAWAY BAY, Jamaica, Dec. 28 (UPI)  Seven heads of government from around the globe met in a mountaintop villa today to begin two days of informal talks on the problems of the poorer nations of the world.

title: Minister Succeeds in Starting a Church
description: Starting a church in New York City, as the Rev. Wayne Jamison can attest, poses problems at least as tough in their own way as those faced by anyone trying to start a successful delicatessen or flower shop.

title: Increase in Teenaged Drinking Cited in Holiday Warning
description: At the age of 18, Elena Pellegrini began the slow, hard climb from alcoholism, six years after her first casual flirtation with wine at a schoolyard in Uniondale, L.I.

title: Pravda Says U.S. Team Seeks to Preserve Shah
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 28 (Reuters)  The Communist Party newspaper Pravda said today that a special group had been sent to the United States Embassy in Teheran to help find ways of keeping the Shah in Dower.

title: Thomas Byrd on Trucker Board
description: The trucking industry, under attack by reformers who charge that regulation has contributed to exorbitant rates and excessive profits, has vowed to fight deregulation in Congress and in the courts.

title: Questions and Answers on Mideast Peace Barriers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  With negotiations toward an EgyptianIsraeli peace treaty in a deadlock, and the intended signing of a treaty already 11 days beyond the target date of Dec. 17, this is a look at the present situation, in question and answer form.

title: Micronesia Accuses Its U.S. Trustee of Decades of Neglect
description: MAJURO, Marshall Islands  When the ropf of the corrugatedmetal administration building here began to, rust through, the Americans in charge had covered with a tarpaulin to protect themselves against the torrential rains.

title: The Region
description: WHITE PLAINS  Alfred B. DelBello, the Westchester County Executive, yesterday signed a $419.1 million budget for 1979 that will reduce the county tax 90 cents from the current average of $23.27 for each $1,000 of assessed valuation.

title: Sun Ra Casts Special Light on Jazz
description: Sun Ra, the jazz bandleader and visionary, took his Arkestra, as he calls it, to Egypt a few years ago. I went to the great Pyramid, he said, not long after their return, and that pyramid is the pyramid of Ra. The number of Ra is nine. So when I got to the King's Chamber, I stopped and said the name Ra nine times. And when I finished. all the lights in the pyramid went out.

title: Art: A 50Year Camera'sEye View of Mexico
description: AFEW weeks short of his 77th birthday, Manuel Alvarez Bravo is being honored by a retrospective of his photographs at the Center for InterAmerican Relations, 680 Park Avenue, at 68th Street. The show, which runs through Feb. 4, numbers 185 prints, covering more than 50 years. It was organized by Washington's Corcoran Gallery of Art and will travel to Tucson, Ariz., and Toledo, Ohio. It comes with an illustrated catalogue that also contains es says by Jane Livingston, the Corcoran's associate directo, and Alex Castro, who presides over the Hollow Press publishing house and is himself an artist.

title: Hudson's Bay Wins In Bid for Simpsons
description: TORONTO, Dec. 28 (Reuters)  A bitter, sixweekold takeover battle between two of Canada's oldest and largest department store chains has ended in victory for the Hudson's Bay Company.

title: Art: Grid Is Theme of Group
description: GROUP exhibitions of contemporary art that are organized around a single theme or idea tend to live a double life. One is governed by the individual works of art that are there for us to see  works created by artists of diverse background and belief in highly diverse artistic circumstances. The other consists of the idea, solemnly set down for us in the accompanying catalogue, that these works of art are said to share.

title: Industrialist Offers His Rebuttal To Alleged Plot to Murder Judge
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 28  T. Cullen Davis, testifying in his defense for the second day, repeatedly denied today that he had paid Charles David McCrory to have the judge presiding at Mr. Davis's divorce trial murdered.

title: White House Confident of Its Taiwan Case
description: WASHINGTON; Dec. 28  Contemplating Senator Barry Goldwater's suit to prevent President Carter from acting alone to terminate the United States defense treaty with Taiwan, a State Department specialist said this week: His case

title: Planners Urge Spending More on Fixing Subways
description: Almost three times as much money than is spent now should be used to rehabilitate New York City's masstransit system, and the emphasis should be on the rider's comfort, a report to Mayor Koch recommended yesterday.

title: Carter Is Given Proposals on Policy For Safeguards of Personal Privacy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  President Carter has been advised by top members of his staff that private institutions such as hospitals, insurance companies and credit card companies should be prohibited from disclosing information they have about individuals except in certain specific circumstances.

title: Triumph and Tragedy in 1978: A Pictorial Review of News Events
Fidelcor Expects Losses; Real Estate Woes Cited
description: Fidelcor Inc., the parent company of the Fidelity Bank of Philadelphia, announced that it would report operating losses of $8.8 million for the fourth quarter and $13.3. million for the full year of 1978.

title: Algerians Mourn at Boumediene's Bier
description: ALGIERS, Dec. 28  Wailing Algerians and somber foreigndiplomats and dignitaries filed Past the coffin of President Houari Boumediene today.

title: Papal Envoy Flies to Chile in Rift With Argentina Over Three Isles
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 28 (Reuters) A papal envoy mediating. a dispute between Argentina and Chile over three small islands at the southern tip of the continent flew to Santiago, the Chilean capital, today.

title: Bodies Found at Illinois Suspect's House Total 21
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 28  Officers of the Cook County Sheriff's Department found six more bodies today under the suburban ranchstyle home of John Wayne Gacy, who, investigators fear, may have killed as many as 32 young men over the last four years after having sexual relations with them.

title: Broadway
description: BUNDLED in a fluffy, white coyote jacket, Michael Bennett scampered up the steps at Sardi's and nestled into his favorite upstairs spot, the table next to the big picture wiidow facing West 44th Street. He ordered a martini and stared down at the two theater marquees lit up with the names of his musicals. At the Shubert there is A Chorus Line, which opened to ecstatic. reviews in 1975 and won the Pulitzer Prize. Down the street at the Majestic is Ballroom, the new show, which opened this month to more subdued notices.

title: Jeffries, a Black, Picked To Coach Wichita Eleven
description: WICHITA, Kan., Dec. 28 (AP) Willie Jeffries was named head football coach today at Wichita State University, becoming the first black football coach at the predominantly white school. Jeffries was given a fouryear contract at a salary estimated at $41,500 a year.

title: 2,000 in San Francisco In Protest Against Shah
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 28 (AP) More than 2,000 Iranian students and their supporters blocked traffic outside the Iranian consulate and the Federal building today in protests against Shah Mohammed Rita Pahlevi.

title: Cuba Mission to U.N. And Avery Fisher Hall Rocked by Explosions
description: The Cuban Mission to the United Nations and Avery Fisher Hall at Lincoln Center were rocked by explosions minutes apart  early this morning.

title: Stage: Alice Downtown, With Meryl Streep
description: The tale of Elizabeth Swados's musical verison of Alice in Wonderland grows curiouser and curiouser. Originally scheduled to begin public previews this week, the production was suddenly postponed by its producer, Joseph Papp. Then it was decided to offer three concert performances of the musical portion of the projected evening. Wonderland in Concert opened Wednesday and closes tonight at the Public Theater.

title: Cheyney State, Kansas Reach Women's Final
description: For three of the bright stars in women's college basketball last night was a time to sparkle. For another it was a nightmare. All this took place during the semifinals of the third annual Queens College women's basketball holiday tournament.

title: Saudi Company And Owens in Pact
description: Abdul Majeed Y. Alreshaid of Alkhobar, Saudi Arabia, and OwensCorning Cayman Ltd., a subsidiary of the OwensCorning Fiberglas Corporation, said they had agreed to forrp an affiliate company, the Arabian Insulation Company, to make and market light and heavy density insulation products in Saudi Arabia and surrounding areas.

title: Osborn Elliott Selected as the Dean Of Columbia School of Journalism
description: Osborn Elliott, former Deputy Mayor for Economic Development and former editor in chief of Newsweek, will become dean of the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism, pending approval by the Columbia trustees.

title: 6.3% '79 Growth Rate Is Predicted by Japan
description: TOKYO, Dec. 28  Japan will continue its steady forward economic march and record a real growth rate of 6.3 percent in the fiscal year starting April 1, 1979, the Government forecast today.

title: Trade Gap Surpasses 1977 Record
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  The United States recorded a $1.95 billion excess of imports over exports last month, pushing the trade deficit for the first 11 months of 1978 up to $26.7 billion, surpassing the previous record of $26.5 billion for all of 1977.

title: The City
description: New York City sold $250 million in shortterm notes to four municipal pension systems and the 11 clearinghouse banks to avert a cash shortage next week.

title: Paperhandlers Reach an Accord With PostDispatch in St. Louis
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 28 (UPI)  Striking paperhandlers at the St. Louis PostDispatch reached a tentative agreement with the company tonight atter an 8 hour bargaining session.

title: New DNA Research Unit Named
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP)  Joseph A. Califano Jr., the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, more than doubled the size of an advisory committee on recombinant DNA research today by appointing 14 new members, includihg a Nobel Prizewinning biologist and a retiring Congressman.

title: Daniel Bearding Lions Again for Holiday Season
description: From the moment the 20thcentury restoration of The Play of Daniel was shown for the first time at the Cloisters in 1958, it was obvious that this modern reincarnation of a 12thcentury drama was going to be around, for a long time. And. indeed, within a few years it had established itself as a traditional holiday presentation in New York City. The vibrant, colorful work produced by Lincoln Kirstein was performed annually by the New York Pro Musica in churches uptown and down, and for many people it became fixed almost as firmly in their holiday rituals as performances of Messiah and The Nutcracker.

title: Key Index Down 0.6% Last Month
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  A Government index designed to anticipate future trends in the economy pointed sharply downward last month, but there were mixed opinions about what the indicator was really saying.

title: Olinkraft Approves JohnsManville Tie
description: Shareholders of Olinkraft Inc. at a peeling in Denver approved the merger of the company into a whollyowned subsidiary of the JohnsManville Corporation. The merger will become effective as soon as the filings with the Federal Trade Commission are completed and the required 20day waiting period has elapsed.

title: Economic Scene.
description: THE most important economic event of the last year was the decisive change in American policy on the dollar, which the United States made on Nov. 1 in the midst of a developing panic in the foreign exchange and stock markets.

title: 10 Die as Jet From New York CrashLands in Oregon
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 28  A crippled United Airlines jet from New York crashed in a residential section just short of the airport here this evening, killing at least 10 of the 185 persons aboard and injuring more than 50 others.

title: Obituary 5 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Sharper Tide Forecasts
description: HINGHAM, Mass.Everyone who lives on the shore, either Atlantic or Pacific, will be wise to mark Watch for storm! over the dates Jan. 38 and Feb. 26 on the 1979 calendar.

title: The Ideal and the Real in Iran
description: As the situation in Iran has grown worse, the policies of the embattled Shah and of the United States may appear to have grown somewhat better.

title: U.S. Steel Cutback
description: The United States Steel Corporation said that it would close a foundry at Its Chicago South Works, which will mean a foss of jobs by 250 workers. The company said it would buy cast iron molds from outside sources. The South Works is one of the steelmaker's largest.lallities and has undergone extensive modernization.

title: Kissinger Ponders What Challenge to Take On
description: Henry Kissinger's friend Mollie Parnis tells about the time she clucked in dismay over that terrible law that says you can't run for President.

title: This Season, Jackets Shape Up Shorter
description: Good news for the small woman: short jackets are a big fashion for spring.

title: Steel Imports Rise By 14.8%
description: Despite a drive by the Government to stem the influx of foreign steel, United States imports of steel through the first 11 months of this year totaled 19.8 million tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute announced yesterday, surpassing the yearly record of 19.3 million tons set in 1977.

title: Recall of Domestic Vehicles in 78 Dropped by 2.6 Million From 77
description: DETROIT, Dec. 28  The number of cars and trucks recalled by the country's four major automobile manufacturers for safety defects dropped sharply in 1978 from last year's record total, but remained well above the levels of 1976 and 1975.

title: Tension in Cleveland Cteneland Eases As Mayor Cancels Layoffs
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 28  Mayor Dennis J. Kucinich today canceled the layoffs of 1,600 city workers scheduled for Jan. 2 and postponed the layoffs of an additional 400 workers until Jan. 5. The unexpected move eased mounting tensions over the loss of police and fire protection as the city battled toward oft bankruptcy.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Conrail Locomotives
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 28 (Reuters)  The Consolidated Rail Corporation said today it planned to acquire 285 new diesel locomotives worth nearly $148 million. It said that the locomotives, to be delivered in 1979, would be acquired through external, lease financing.

title: Wide Theft Ring Reported Broken With Arrest of 4
description: Four members of a reputed organized crime ring were taken into custody in New York City yesterday in connection with a sophisticated stolenproperty operation that was said to have involved the theft both of hundreds of thousands of dollars in investment securities and of heavyduty construction equipment destined for South America.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Tchaikovsky's ballet The Nutcracker has become a television holiday staple. nit should not obscure the fact that the mice army, the soldiers, the candy canes and the whole collection of dancing: fantasies are best seen liVe. Today at 2:30 P.M.14 and again at 7:30 P.M.and tomorrow at 11 A.M. and 2:30 P.M., the Eglevsky Ballet Company and the Long Island Symphony Ballet Orchestra will present the classic, with Ingrid Fraley as the sugarplum fairy, at the Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, L.I. Tickets are $3.50, $4.50 and $5.50 and are available through Ticketron outlets, by credit card through (516) 794.9400 (with a $1.50 handling charge), and at the Coliseum box office. Information on tickets may be obtained at (516) 7949100 or (212) 9779020.

title: 58 Women Make Formal Bows to Society
description: Fiftyeight young women representing 19 countries, 12 states and the District of Columbia made their formal bows to society at the 24th annual International Debutante Ball in the Grand Ballroom of the WaldorfAstoria last night.

title: Chinese Economy Had Series of Gains in 1978
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 28 (AP)  Yearend statistics from China indicate that the country's economic performance in 1978 has been its best in well over a decade.

title: F.A.A. Revises Rules on Guards At Airport AntiHijacking Points
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (AP)  The Federal Aviation Administration revised its rules today to permit many airports to discontinue the practice of stationing an armed guard at each antihijacking screening point.

title: POLICEMAN IS KILLED IN BROOKLYN HOLDUP
description: A New York City policeman who walked into a Brooklyn automobile supply store during his lunch hour Yesterday to inquire about a car that was doubleparked outside was shot three times in the chest and heart by a holdup man who was robbing the store.

title: TV Weekend
description: THIS Sunday's electronic New Year's Eve. celebrations feature familiar formats with a couple of significant alterations. At 11:30 P.M., on CBSTV, Guy Itimbardo's Royal Canadians will once again be broadcast live from New York's WaldorfAstoria.

title: USAC Sets New Rules For Racing
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 28 (AP) The United States Auto Club has decided to conduct its top level of auto racing with less speed, lower costs and hopes that the combination will produce more competitive racing, according to Dick King. the organization's president.

title: Changes in Civil Service. Called Highest Priority in Albany Legislation
description: New York City officials say fundamental changes in the state's Civil Service laws to give the city's managers more leeway in hiring, promoting and transferring workers will be one of the city's top goals during the coming session of the State Legislature.

title: Ashe, Roche Victorious; Clem Reinjured, Forfeits
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 28 (AP)  JoseLuis Clerc of Argentina, seeded second in the $300,000 Australianypen tennis touinament, reinjured a knee today and forfeited his firstround match to John Marks of Australia.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Tracey A. Bazie has been named vice presidentAfrica for Avon Products Inc., with responsibility for the company's cosmetics business in Nigeria and the Ivory Coast. Avon now sells its products in 25 countries and is preparing a major marketing effort in the black countries of Africa. Mr. Bazie will be in charge.

title: Advertising
description: MARSTELLER Inc. is on the verge of becoming the major United States public relations presence in the top Arab markets, Robert S. Leaf, president of Marsteller International, said yesterday.

title: WEEKEND MOVIE CLOCK
description: ART (GR 37014)

title: Airlines Delay Vote on Merger
description: Continental Air Lines and Western Airlines said they had postponed their Jan. 15 special shareholders meetings at which stockholders were to vote on the previously proposed merger of the two carriers. A Continental spokesman said that the meetings probably would be held around the end of March.

title: For Children
description: GULLIVER, special holiday performance sponsored by city's Department of Recreation, by the Cottage Marionette Theater, Friday and Saturday at noon and 2:30 P.M. Cottage Theater in Central Park, near Central Park West and 81st Street. Free; contributions accepted. Reservations: 9889093.

title: Treasury Futures Arouse Fears
description: The market in Treasury securities is the largest trading market for securities in the world, and the most stable, Robert Carswell, Deputy Secretary of the Treasury, said recently. If it's screwed up, he warned, it's the nation's loss.

title: Agencies for the Unwanted Pet Await the AfterChristmas Rush
description: On the nights after Christmas, all through a lot of houses in New York and elsewhere, there is the yipping sound of a puppy trying out his voice, his legs and the rest of his functions. And there are the gleeful sounds of small children who have received a puppy for Christmas, or the purring of an older child who has always wanted a dog and has finally gotten one.

title: 79 Times Square Ball Will Lag by a Second
description: When the ball atop the tower at 1 Times Square falls to announce the arrival of 1979, it will do so one second later than it did last New Year, because this old earth is slowing down.

title: IN THE NATION The Nightmare Ahead
description: Not long ago, one of South Africa's numerous banned persons  those barred by Government decree from any political and almost allsocial activity  was discussing his remarkably liberal views on race relations. How rare a bird are you? he was asked.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Thursday, Dec.28,1978

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Dividends
description: THURSDAY, DEC. 28, 1978

title: C. G. Mortimer, General Foods ExChief, Dies at 78
description: Charles Greenough Mortimer, retired chairman and chief executive officer of the General Foods Corporation, died Christmas Day in Orleans, Mass. He was 78 years old and lived in White Plains.

title: World News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (UPI)  The Council of the Organization of American States postponed, for 24 hours today a decision on a Costa Rican request for a ministeriallevel meeting to act'on Nicaragua's threats to invade.

title: $2.4 Billion in Drugs Seized by U.S. in Year
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (AP)  The Customs Service says it seized $2.46 billion worth of narcotics and controlled drugs in the past year.

title: Idi Amin Demotes Vice President And Elevates SecretPolice Chief
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 28 (UPI)President Idi Amin of Uganda consolidated his power today by demoting the only potential challenger to his rule and promoting the head of his secret police.

title: Thomas M. Mackinnon, ExChief Of G.O.P. in Erie County, Was 49
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 28 (AP) Thomas M. Mackinnon, who recently resigned as the Republican chairman of Erie County because of HI health, died today at his home here. He was 49 years old.

title: In Sinai, American Vigil Is Lonely, and TaxFree
description: GIDI PASS, IsraeliOccupied Sinai A crisp winter wind rearranges the fine yellow sand of Sinai, packing it in firm drifts against charred ruins of tanks, trucks and personnel carriers hit during combat between Egyptians and Israelis.

title: Badillo Declares Law Bars Simon From Bronx Post
description: Stanley Simon  whose fellow City Council members from the Bronx have promised to elect him Borough President  is not legally qualified to take the job. Deputy Mayor Herman Badillo and two labor leaders charged yesterday.

title: Play: Four Wallachs Revive Diary of Anne Frank
description: ALL the novels, movies andtelevision versions of the holocaust cannot overshadow Anne Frank. Her diary is the most personal story of the horrors of Nazi genocide. Reading it and seeing it on stage in the Frances Goodrich and Albert Hackett adaptation, The Diary of Anne Frank, we witness a young woman simultaneously awakening to life  and to death. Her tragedy is implicit in every move that she makes and in every line that she writes. It would be impossible to be untouched by such a statement as I want to go on living even after my death, particularly as we realize the durability of her diary.

title: Dr. Ernestine Schlant: Breaking the Stereotype of a Senator's Wife
description: The wife of a United States Senator has, traditionally, been a helpmate to her husband, his social chairman and confidante, the uncomplaining mother of his children and, it she had any spare time, a volunteer bandage roller with the other Senate wives.

title: Obituary 2 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Books: Comic Thriller Set in Italy
description: SILENCE AT SALERNO is a maliciously comic novel that spares neither the practices of American museums, nor nostalgic war veterans returning to Europe to relive their moment of glory, nor the pretensions of the fallen Italian aristocracy, nor the hothouse, world of academe. Francis Steegmuller has also thrown in an internationally famous couple who should be known to every reader of current history and whose comings and goings on their yacht in the Mediterranean are an important strand in the unfolding of this comic plot.

title: Says That Cuts in Jobs Are Needed to Keep City Budget Balanced
description: New York City will bave to lay off a modest number of workers before June 30 and a substantial number after that to keep its budget in balance, Mayor Koch says.

title: Automated Offices: Race Is On
description: A multibilliondollar race is under way to be first through the door of the automated office of the future.

title: A Word About Losers
description: The incentive system of the marketplace uses both a carrot and a stick, offering large rewards to the outstanding winners of the competitive race and imposing heavy penalties on some of the losers. The operation of the stick is often ugly  indeed innumane. unmitigated verdict of the marketplace wouldcondemn millions to deprivation.

title: HEAD OF H.E.W. SETS GOAL TO LIMIT RISE IN HOSPITALS' COSTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  The Carter Administration announced today that had established 9.7 percent as its 1979 goal for limiting the average rate of increase in hospital expenses nationwide.

title: Poets Read the New Year In at Entermedia Benefit
description: The annual New Year's Day Poetry Project benefit, traditionally held in the sanctuary of St. Mark'sintheBowery Episcopal Church will be resumed Monday after a break last year while the building  the oldest site of continuous worship in New York City  was being refurbished. Big Monday's benefit will take place at the Entermedia Theater on Second Avenue at 12th Street, two blocks north of the church. For St. Mark's is now a shell, open to the wind and snow, with a charred organ and splintered, stainedglass windows the only witnesses to the homely splendor destroyed by fire last July.

title: Hotel Workers on Canary Islands Continue Stoppage for Sixth Day
description: LAS PALMAS, Canary Islands, Dec. 28 (Reuters)  Hotel workers on two of Spain's Canary Islands continued their strike for a sixth day today, depriving vacationers of hot meals and room service.

title: Events and Openings
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, Poulenc's Dialogues of the Carmelites, 8.

title: 2 Big Hospitals In Bronx Ending A Partnership
description: Deeply divided over questions of management and healthcare politics, two of the biggest private hospitals in the Bronx are ending a 10year relationship under which they essentially functioned as one institution and provided what New York State officials lauded as efficient services at low cost.

title: Six for Stuffing and Mounting
description: My annual ballot for the Baseball Hall of Fame is on its way to Jack Lang, secretary of the Baseball Writers Association of America, bearing six names. There are spaces on the ballot for 10 names and sometimes, in the past, all of them were used. But the feeling now is that voting for such a crowd tends to dilute the distinction for the toes who are chosen. Getting a place in the little shrine on the shore of Lake Otsego Is even more desirable than getting into Studio 54 and ought to be at least as difficult. Enos Slaughter, for example, has been eligible for election since 1964 and has not been named on 75 percent of the ballots in any year. He was only 14 votes short last winter, though, so perhaps he'll get the necessary majority this time. Being passed over for lesser players has not always brought out the funnier side of his disposition. Still, his repeated disappointments may make it all the sweeter when last he is stuffed and mounted.

title: Obituary 3 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Marriage, Rape and the Law
description: For the first time in American history, a man has been tried for the alleged rape of his wife. In the case that has just ended in Oregon, a jury believed the man's story. But the verdict is not as important as the fact that the trial took place at all.

title: CanadianOwned Utility Nationalized by Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 28  The Brazilian Government, in one of the biggest nationalizations of a foreignowned company here in many years, today announced the purchase of an electric utility that is the largest single asset here of Brascan Ltd., a Canadian multinational company.

title: Stocks Fall As Iran Oil Flow Stops
description: The stock market, keeping a wary eye on the escalating civil unrest in Iran, declined yesterday as more than 1,000 issues fell in price on the New York Stock Exchange for the second session in a row.

title: Photography: 1940's New York
description: ONCE upon a time, New York worked, and all that was wrong with the rest of the world had not yet really touched it. The budget was balanced, the trains ran on time, the citizens strolled unarmed, the garbage stayed out of sight, and the ethnic populace (mainly white) remained in its cozy neighborhoods. It was a time of charm and innocence, when drugs were what a pharmacy dispensed, and porn was well, a burlesque show.

title: Revamped Knicks Beat Bullets, 10999
description: Coach Red Holzman's new starting lineup, which has replaced the oneonone players in favor of the teamoriented hustlers, appears to have done wonders for the Knicks.

title: Art People
description: THEATERS bring out the best in painters. Chagall was never better than in his murals for the Jewish Theater in Moscow, Vuillard never better than in his decorations for the Comedie des Champs Elysees in Paris, Edvard Munch never better than in his decorations for Max Reinhardt's Little Theater in Berlin.

title: Deja Vu for Tomjanovich With a New Broken Nose
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Dec. 78 (UPI)For a brief moment, it was almost last season all over again for Houston's Rudy Tomjanovich.

title: Woman Picks Soccer Ties;. Wins $125 Million in Pool
description: LONDON, Dec. 28 (AP)  Janet Smith, a 38yearold English housewife, won $1.25 million today, the biggest soccer pool prize ever by one person, by forecasting all eight ties in English soccer names last Saturday.

title: Turkish Armed Forces Control 13 Provinces In Wake of Civil Strife
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 28  The Turkish Army was watching the most sensitive areas of the country today amid indications of a respite in the sectarian and political turmoil.

title: Former Officers of Time Inc. TV Unit Admit Fraud
description: Two businessmen who headed a television subsidiary of Time Inc. pleaded guilty in Manhattan yesterday to Federal fraud charges involving the use of kickbacks, bribes, a sham corporation and a bank account on Grand Cayman Island.

title: A White New Year on the Slopes
description: With almost all ski areas in upper New England and upper New York State operating with substantial covers of natural snow, conditions in that part of the ski country yesterday were in fine shape for the New Year's weekend.

title: Green Book Reissued For Changes by Koch
description: The City of New York's new Official Directory  frequently called The Green Book  listing all city agencies, departments, commissioners, assistant commissioners and senior staff members, went on sale yesterday. It has been completely revised for the Koch administration, and includes the latest shuffle of deputy mayors, made earlier this month.

title: Gladiolus First to Finish In $52,750 Miss Prosperity
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Dec. 28  Sea Spray Farms Gladiolus, pressing the pace most of the way, closed powerfully in the stretch tonight and won the $52,750 Miss Prosperity Handicap for fillies and mares before 17,000 at the Meadowlands.

title: U.STaiwan Talks Are Started After Pledge on Safety
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 28  Talks between American and Chinese Nationalist officiali on the shape of future relations between their Governments finally got under way this afternoon after President Chiang Chingkuo said his regime would take all measures to insure personal safety of the American delegation.

title: Phone Booth Returned In Superman Fashion
description: A group of residents of the Upper West Side have their corner telephone booth back but it took some doing.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Extensive cloud cover is associated with frontal zone near Florida. Shower activity with these clouds is moving slowly out to sea. Widespread heavy cloud cover is pert of large storm system centered in Nebratke. A sharp northern edge of clouds Is being produced by a jet stream from Colorado to northern Minnesota. Pacific Ocean moisture is moving into the Southwest.

title: Violins Will Cry and Vie At Gypsy Jam Session
description: What you might call a gypsy jam session is planned New Year's Eve at the Hungaria Restaurant in the Citicorp building. Third Avenue at 53rd Street. The participants  two gypsy orchestras from Budapest  never had heard of such an event. But, their leaders said in an interview it seemed tike a reasonable idea.

title: Restaurants
description: WEN DAH TAI, a native of Peking, is the Uncle Tai whose Hunan Yuan Restaurant on Third Avenue near 63d Street introduced and still serves some of the most original and interesting Hunan and Szechwan dishes in the city. If he does so with less distinction than in former years, his menu still otters a number of savory and unusual specialties that make this place worth visiting. The big sprawling dining room, divided into two eating areas, is brightly done up in a cheerful if undistinguished Chinesemodern theme and most tables, especially along the &.de walls, are placed comfortably apart.

title: Jazz: New Gary Burton
description: THE jazz vibraphonist Gary Burton has been winning polis and making inventively melodic music for so long that one tended to assume be would never change. But he has changed his group format fairly radically in the last year by employing a trumpeter, Tiger Okoshi, in the place he has customarily reserved for a guitarist.

title: Cabaret: Ellen Greene
description: WHEN Ellen Greene first turned up at Reno Sweeney more than five years ago, singing torch songs of the 1920's and 30's with a slightly quizzical air, she created a characterization that was promisingly provocative. Camp was just creeping into the cabaret world then, and had not yet overwhelmed it.

title: Jockey Is Killed by Lightning
description: MIAMI, Dec. 28 (UPI)  Nick Navarro, the third leading jockey at. this fall's meeting at Calder Race Course, was killed by lightning today soon after the finish of the second race.

title: Obituary 6 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Jersey Mortgage Rate Rise Asked
description: TRENTON, Dec. 28  The New Jersey Economic Policy Council has asked the Byrne administration to raise the state's 9.5 percent ceiling on mortgage interest rates to avoid a possible collapse of the state's housing industry in the year ahead.

title: Many Contingency Plans
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  The deepening crisis in Iran has prompted the Carter Administration to draw up a wide range of contingency plans which, Government officials said today, included the possible dispatch of a carrier task force to the Persian Gulf.

title: In Jersey, Five Women of Bluegrass
description: There aren't any mountains in Englishtown, N.J., which means there are no coal camps nestled in any hollers, either. But if you close your eyes and open your ears this weekend, you'll think you were nestled in an Appalachian hillside, as the AllGirl Reel World String Band visits the metropolitan area.

title: F15 Crashes in West Germany
description: KOBLENZ, West Germany, Dec. 28 (Reuters)  An F15 jet fighter crashed on a training flight at the town of Daun near here today, the United States Air Force announced. The pilot ejected safely and no damage was reported to property.

title: Jones Commune Found Stocked With Drugs to Control the Mind
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Dec. 28 (AP)  The People's Temple commune at Jonestown was stocked with thousands of doses of dangerous drugs, smuggled into Guyana. Two survivors of the sect said at least some of the drugs were used to control those who might defect.

title: Cuba's Orchesta Aragon Presents Dance Tradition
description: Music is Cuba's most personable export. Since the beginning of this century, Cuban music has exerted an influence in North America that is altogether out of proportion to the island's relatively small size and population. Perhaps the rhumba, the mambo and Desi Arnaz and his conga drum come most readily to mind, but it should also be remembered that New York Latin music, or salsa, is decisively Cuban in character, even though many of the musicians who play it have roots in Puerto Rico.

title: U.S. Ends Negotiations in Taiwan With Basic Differences Unresolved
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Dec. 29  Deputy Secretary of State Warren M. Christopher left for the United States today after two days of talks with Taiwan Government leaders that left the differences between the two countries as glaring as they were before his arrival set off a riot Wednesday night.

title: Jones Aide and 7 Others In Cult Fly to New York
description: Calling the mass deaths in Guyana a waste of beautiful life, a top aide to the Rev. Jim Jones, along with seven other survivors of the People's Temple, flew to New York last night. The eight arrived early in the evening and were immediately questioned by Federal agents.

title: Oil Prices Soaring in Open Market As Iranian Export Supply Dwindles
description: With no oil coming out of Iran, prices on the open market have started to soar.

title: U.S. Petroleum Data
description: Millions of barrels

title: Why Moscow Is Letting Jewish Emigration Surge
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 29  The authorities have allowed more than 30,000 Jews to leave the Soviet Union this year, the highest number since 1973, according to wellinformed Western diplomats.

title: Albany Arrests 13 in an Effort to Break Illegal Lottery
description: ALBANY, Dec. 29 (AP)  State tax officials said today that they hoped that the arrests of 13 persons across the state had smashed an operation that was wholesaling tickets to be used by smallscale, illegal competitors to the state lottery.

title: Washington Star Talks Called to Avert Closing
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP)  Negotiators for The Washington Star and its unions will meet tomorrow in an attempt to resolve contract disputes that could lead to a permanent shutdown of the newspaper next week.

title: A Bankrupt Fights Soviet Bank
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 29  The Soviet Union's Moscow Narodny.Bank Is running into opposition here as seeks to recover on more than $50 million in bad loans to a Singapore financier.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Oil prices are beginning to soar on the open market, international traders reported, following the halt in exports from Iran. Although the increases, up to $2 a barrel on the spot market, are not expected to have an immediate impact on consumers, over the long term they will probably influcence the price of all petroleum products. [Page 1.] Gasoline pump prices could rise as much as 0.83 cents a gallon following a rule change by the Department of Energy allowing retailers to pass on more of their costs. [33.]

title: World News Briefs
description: MADRID, Dec. 29 (AP)  Prime Minister Adolfo Suarez. dissolved the Spanish Parliament today and called general elections for March 1 in a step to fortify his center Government's rule.

title: Polish Church and State Embarked on a Test of Strength
description: WARSAW, Dec. 29  The protracted test of strength between church and state in Poland has entered what may be a new and more intensive phase in the wake of the election of Karol Cardinal Wojtyla of Cracow as Pope John Paul II.

title: Cheyney State Tops Kansas in Final
description: Playing with contidence and consistency throughout, Cheyney State captured the third annual Queens College Women's Basketball Holiday Tournament last night by defeating Kansas, 7058.

title: U.S. to Let Gas Stations Lift Price to Cover Costs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP)  The Energy Department announced a regulatory change today that will allow gasoline retailers to pass rent and the cost of some environmental equipment through to their customers.

title: Connecticut Enforcing Blue Law
description: Connecticut's onagain, offagain Sundayclosing law is on again  at least for a while, starting tomorrow, sort of.

title: Experts Say That Second Gunman Almost Certainly Shot at Kennedy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  Acoustics experts said today that tests showed a probability of 95 percent or better that a shot was fired from a grassy knoll in Dallas when President Kennedy was assassinated.

title: Takeover Bids Halted By Domtar, MacMillan
description: TORONTO, Dec. 29  In a surprise statement this evening, MacMillan Bloedel Ltd. and Domtar Inc., the Canadian forest product giants that had been battling to take over each other, announced they would both drop these efforts immediately.

title: Niagara 82, Seton Hall 73 U.N.C. 86, Dartmouth 67
description: ROCHESTER, N.Y., Dec. 29 Niagara. University scored the last 11 points in the second overtime period tonight to upset Seton Hall University, 8273, in the second game of openinground play in the Rochester University invitation tournament.

title: Food and Drug Administration Revises Liquid Protein Warning
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP)  A year after sounding alarms about lowcalorie liquid protein diets, the Food and Drug Administration today revised its order for warning labels on the products.

title: Chrysler Is Raising Prices 1.2%
description: DETROIT, Dec. 29  The Chrysler Corporation, the country's No. 3 automobile manufacturer, has announced price increases averaging 1.2 percent, or $85, on its 1979 cars. Only the subcompact twin cars, Omni and Horizon, are excluded from the price rise, the company said in a statement released here today.

title: Brascan Climbs On Brazil Sale
description: Toronto, Dec 29 (Reuters)  Stock markets reacted favorably today to yesterday's news that Brascan Ltd. of Toronto had sold its interest in Light Servios de Eletricidade S.A., a Brazilian utility.

title: Dances by Meg Harper
description: Meg Harper called the fascinating dance that she presented Thursday evening at the Merce Cunningham Studio Long Distance. Judging from that dance, Miss Harper is in love with space.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Difficult Military Decisions Faced by U.S. in Iran Crisis
description: A show of force such as that considered by the Administration for the troubled Persian Gulf area presents, like war itself, an option of difficulty. It may deter the Soviet Union from exploiting the opportunities offered by the turmoil in Iran.

title: Gen. Sergei Danilin, 78; On Soviet Flight to U.S.
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 28 (UPI)  The Soviet press today reported the death of Lieut. Gen. Sergei Danilin, the navigator of a historic, recordbreaking nonstop flight from Moscow to the United States in 1937.

title: Shah's Foe and Now His Choice
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 29  Shahpur Bakhtiar, whom the Shah has asked to form a new civilian government, is a slim, graying, softspoken man with courtly manners who would seem more at home chatting in a drawing room than trying to calm the whirlwind currently sweeping over Iran.

title: U.S. Attorney Names Mrs. Buchwald to Post
description: Naomi Reice Buchwald was named yesterday to head the civil division of the United States Attorney's Office in Manhattan.

title: Risks Cited, a Hearing Is Put Off For Suspect in Slaying of Youths
description: DES PLAINES, Ill., Dec. 29  A scheduled court appearance by John Wayne Gacy Jr., who, the police say, may have killed as many as 32 young men, was postponed for two weeks today after Cook County Criminal Court judges concluded that his presence in a small suburban courtroom here would pose too great a security risk.

title: BOUMEDIENE BURIED AS ALGERIANS GRIEVE
description: ALGIERS, Dec. 29  Houari Boumediene, who governed Algeria with firmness but without flamboyance for 13 years, was buried today after an explosion of mourning in the streets and a moving graveside oration that brought tears to his onetime comradesinarms.

title: Answers to Quiz
description: Questions appear on page 17.

title: The City
description: A 35yearold Puerto Rican nationalist was sentenced to life in prison yesterday for hijacking a Pan American World Airways 747 jetliner with 376 persons aboard on Aug. 2, 1970.

title: Prices Raised On Cigarettes
description: American Brands Inc. announced yesterday that its American Tobacco Company unit would raise the list price of its cigarette brands by 55 cents a thousand, effective immediately. The increase is expected to result in a retail price rise of at least 2 cents a package.

title: Sunglasses Designed for the Glare of the Spotlight
description: The literature says that this new eyewear was designed to entice a special group of financially secure, demanding individuals. These individuals feel for the unusual and surround themselves with only the best.

title: McNamara Triumphs In Australian Tennis
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 29 (AP)  Peter McNamara of Australia, avenging a loss 12 months ago, upset Tim Gullikson of the United States, seeded No. 4, by 62, 63, 76, today in the second round of the $300,000 Australian open tennis championships.

title: Princeton and St. Lawrence Tie
description: RENSSELAEI2, N.Y., Dec. 29 (AP)  Rick Wilson, the St. Lawrence goalie, turned away 49 shots and survived nine power plays, including one with his team two men down, as the Saints held on tonight for a 22 hockey tie with Princeton in the Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute tournament.

title: Boonton Agrees To British G.E. Bid
description: The Boonton Electronics Corporation said it had agreed in principle to be acquired by General Electric Company of Britain. The British company has no connection with the General Electric Company of the United States.

title: Nations Agree on Trade Code
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  The United States and its major trading partners have agreed on a fair trade charter limiting the effects of government subsidies on trade flows, a longsought objective of American economic diplomacy.

title: Libya Is Said to Aid Foes of Shah
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  United States and West European intelligence officials said today that Libya and the Palestine Liberation Organization had combined efforts since November to provide financial and other assistance to the Iranian Moslem opponents of Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi.

title: SHAH NAMES AN OPPOSITION LEADER TO HEAD CIVILIAN CABINET IN IRAN; OIL CUTOFF PUSHES UP WORLD PRICE
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Saturday, Dec. 30An opposition leader was chosen yesterday by Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi to form a civilian government. Later yesterday, he said the Shah had agreed to leave Iran temporarily and turn over power to a regency council, but this was denied by the imperial palace.

title: Town Doomed By a Utah Mine Awaits Its End
description: LARK, Utah, Dec. 29 (AP)  New Year's Day will be a quiet, sad holiday for 25 families here. It will also be their last in Lark.

title: U.S. Action Agency Is Assailed; Its Chief Senses Political Attack
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  When Samuel W. Brown Jr. became director of Action, the umbrella agency that includes the Peace Corps, VISTA and several other volunteer organizations, he said that the wealthy, the Republicans and big business should probably feel uncomtortable about his work.

title: Article 2 -- No Title
description: DATSUN'S CAMPUS BEAT

title: Books of The Times;  Running in Good Health
description: For 16.5 million Americans, the pursuit of happiness is being carried out in track shoes. People who despair of the head are turning to the body. They are flushing out their anxieties with the circulation of the blood, having a hot and heavybreathing romance with theirpreviously neglected hearts.

title: Broncos Irritated by Tone of Steelers' Comments
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 29 Coach Red Miller of Denver, the defending American Football Conference champion, passed out some reading material this week as part of the Broncos' preparation for their playoff game with Pittsburgh tomorrow. It became obvious today that the Broncos had read the as signed periodicals, which contained Steeler comments offensive to Denver.

title: Upstate New York City Cuts Electricity Rates 10%
description: At a time of rising energy costs everywhere else, the municipal power system of Sherrill, the smallest city in New York State, about 25 miles east of Syracuse, is preparing two New Year's presents for its 1,325 subscribers  a 10 percent reduction in rates and a rebate in cash of about a month's bill.

title: COMMODITIES
description: In quiet preholiday trading, gold and silver futures moved up slightly yesterday, but the commodities markets in general showed few decisive trends in advance of the New Year's weekend.

title: Ruland Excels as Iona Rips Northeastern, 10388
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., Dec. 29 Jeff Ruland, a 6foot10inch sophomore, scored a career high of 37 points tonight to lead Iona to a 10388 victory over Northeastern in a holiday basketball tournament.

title: Hayes Goes After Player In Bowl Los to Clemson
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 29 (AP)  Coach Woody Hayes, irate after Charlie Bauman, Clemson's middle guard, intercepted an Ohio State pass tonight in the final two minutes of Clemson's 1715 Gator Bowl victory, went after Bauman after he was run out of bounds on the Ohio State sideline. Hayes grabbed Bauman and touched off a brief benchemptying melee.

title: Tim Mazzetti Returns to Dallas
description: The last time Tim Mazzetti saw Tom Landry, the coach of the Dallas Cowboys told him, Thank you for coming down. That was during the week before the National Football League season opened and the Cowboys needed a fieldgoal kicker. After a tryout in Texas Stadium. the Cowboys signed Rafael Septien, who had been the Los Angeles Rams' kicker in 1977, instead of Tim Mazzetti, who took the next plane back to Philadelphia, where he was a bartender Smokey Joe's, a student hangout on the University of Penn sylvania campus. When the Cowboys didn't sign me. he says now, I figured this year was gone. But today, Tim Mazzetti, who, grew up playing soccer in Brazil, will be back in Texas Stadium, kicking for the Atlanta Falcons against the Cowboys in their National Conference playoff game.

title: Cause Sought in Portland Plane Crash
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 29  Investigators from the National Transportation Safety Board began trying today to determine why a United Airlines DC8 with a landing gear problem crashed into an East Portland residential area last night.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS
description: The dollar ended trading for 1978 by falling against most major currcricies in European and New York trading yesterday while gold closed with big gains of up to $5 for the day more than 31 nercent for the year.

title: Sudden Death in Bowl Rejected
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 29  Because of opposition by the coaches, the Sugar Bowl and the American Broadcasting Company have dropped a plan for a sudden. death extra period in the event of a tie in Monday's game between Penn State and Alabama.

title: New Manticore Chamber Group Plays Webern's Das Augenlicht
description: Because new, enterprises almost invariably experience some ups and downs before they run smoothly, a bit of uncertainty can be considered normal in the early stages of a venture. Thus, it was probably to be expected that Manticore, the new chamber orchestra in residence at the Roundabout Theater, would exhibit some signs of tentativeness in its first season. The ensemble gave its initial pair of concerts little more than three months ago, But the Manticore concert given on Thursday night demanded almost more sympathetic understanding than concertgoers should be expected to deliver.

title: Buckeyes Stun Duke
description: Ohio State pulled the biggest surprise of the college basketball season last night by upsetting Duke, 9084, in overtime of the opening game of the Holiday Festival doubleheader at Madison Square Garden. Duke's 16game winning streak ended when it blew a 17point secondhalf lead.

title: The Region
description: TRENTON  Insurance Commissioner James J. Sheeran of New Jersey announced he had approved auto insurance increases affecting three million motorists in the state.

title: Who Gains From School Integration?
description: Integration did not die with John Kennedy, or with Robert Kennedy, or with Martin Luther King. It lives, it will grow, and it will enrich this world... But we must da it now. So wrote Neil Sullivan, then Superintendent of Schools in Berkeley, Cal., in 1968. He made Berkeley the first city in the country to integrate au its schools voluntarily. Now, ten years later, after overcoming all manner of opposition and doubt, that policy appears vindicated.

title: Manville Seeks Unit Of Ashland
description: The JohnsManville Corporation disclosed yesterday that it had held preliminary discussions with the Ashland Oil Company with an eye toward acquiring the oil and gas properties of Ashland's subsidiary, Ashland Exploration Inc.

title: Knoetze Arrives Quietlyfor Now
description: Kallie Knoetze quietly entered the country yesterday, but Bill Cayton, the American representative of the controversial South. African heavyweight boxer, knows now it is only a matter of time before the noise begins.

title: F.C.C.WARNS POLICE ON RADAR DEVICES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (UPI)  The nation's police departments have been warned to stop jamming dashboard and windshieldmounted radar detectors used by many motorists, an official of the Federal Communications Commission said today.

title: Ousting of Chief Of Battery Unit Sought by Carey
description: Governor Carey is seeking to use the brief interregnum between the 201st and 202d Legislatures to oust the chief of the Battery Park City Authority,a Republican, and to dismantle the operating structure of the financially troubled agency, aides close to Mr. Carey said yesterday.

title: Shah's Foe Said to Have Denounced NonMoslems
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, the exiled Iranian religious leader and symbol of resistance to the Shah, is quoted as expressing antiJewish and antiChristian sentiments and contempt for all forms of government except theocracy in a littleknown book based on a series of lectures delivered in 1970 in Iraq.

title: Peru, Banks Sign Pact On Loans
description: An agreement for the refinancing of $800 million of external commercial bank loans to Peru was signed here yesterday by Peruvian financial officials and representatives of a syndicate of more than 250 international banks.

title: DR. FRANK D. CURTIN
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 29  Dr. Frank D. Curtin, professor emeritus of St. Lawrence University, Canton, N.Y., died yesterday in PresbyterianUniversity Hospital here. He was 73 years old and lived in Glenshaw, a Pittsburgh suburb.

title: 42 Arrested at Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON (AP) Fortytwo persons were arrested today in the second day of pacifist demonstrations at the Pentagon, the police reported. Chief James Maddock of the Federal Protective Service ,said that 12 members of the Atlantic Life Community were arrested in the morning. Thirty more persons were arrested at an after demonstration.

title: Tammy Grimes to Star In Larry Cohen's Trick
description: Tammy Grimes will return to Broadway on Feb. 1 to star in Trick, a new comedy thriller by Larry Cohen, at the Playhouse Theater, 359 West 48th Street. Miss Grimes, who was last seen in New York in Neil Simon's California Suite, will portray a mysterious woman in the threecharacter play.

title: Striking Actors Say 68 Ad Employers Sign Pacts
description: Officials of striking unions of actors and announcers who make radio and television commercials reported yesterday that 68 advertising agencies and producers of commercials had broken away from the majority of advertisingindustry holdouts and had signed interim agreements.

title: U.S. MOVING CARRIER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  The United States ordered a carrier task force to depart from the Philippines today for possible movement to the Persian Gulf area if the situation in Iran warranted it, Administration officials said.

title: English Writer Charts Rise and Fall of Fashion
description: Next year, I'll probably be writing about football  fashion is finished.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Nets Lose 4 in Row, 137 to 126
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Dec. 29  The arrowshaped directional stickers distributed by the New Jersey Nets in this area say: Thataway to Piscataway. But after what happened to the Nets tonight at Rutgers Athletic Center, maybe the message should be changed to read: Getaway From Piscataway.

title: OBSERVER
description: The Nobel Peace Prize Committee has sent the following letter to Prime Winister Menachem Begin of Israel:

title: Student, 19, Visiting From Denver, Is Shot to Death Near City College
description: A 19yearold college student from Denver was shot to death in an apparent robbery Thursday night near City College, where he had gone to attend a high school basketball tournament.

title: PostMao Shanghai Blossoming In Perfume, Lipstick and Verve
description: SHANGHAI, Dec. 29  The sniffing bride was dressed in a fulllength lacy white gown, with a bouquet of roses. The proud bridegroom standing next to her wore a dark Westernstyle suit with a nosegay.

title: Whaling Commission Lauded
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP)  Richard A. Frank, the United States representative to the International Whaling Commission, has praised the commission's decision to reduce sperm whale quotas in the North Pacific by more than 40 percent. The commission cut the North Pacific quota from 6,444 in 1978 to 3,800 in 1979. The commission also called on the countries of the world to prohibit trade in whale products.

title: Koch Unable to Persuade Rangel To Back Plan on Welfare Checks
description: Mayor Koch and his aides met yesterday at City Hall with Representative Charles B. Rangel of Manhattan in an effort to win his support for a plan to get New York City landlords to schedule housing improvements by assuring them that they will receive rent payments from welfare clients.

title: Weekly News Quiz
description: Questions are based on news reports in The Times in the last week. Answers appear on page 24.

title: Farm Prices Increase 3%, Equaling 1973 Record
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP) Prices that farmers get for raw products rose 3 percent in December and matched the alltime record set more than five years ago, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: Obituary 3 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Sports Today
description: Krdcks vs. Kansas City Kings, at Madison Square Garden, Eighth Avenue and 33d Street, 1:30 P.M. (TelevisionChannel E. cable, 1:30 P.M.)

title: Upsets Mark L.I. Juniors Play
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I.  John Mangan of Rye, N.Y. and Hugh Scott of Brazil scored upsets as they posted two victories each to reach the boys 18yearsandunderdivision quarterfinals of an international junior indoor tennis tournament today at the Port Washington Tennis Academy.

title: Bridge:
description: Readers who like to study the diagram and the bidding before reading the column will find several things to puzzle them in the diagramed deal, played in the lifemaster men's pair championship in Denver a month ago. A single factor, a most unusual one, explains the answer to all of the following questions:

title: European Money Plan Delayed
description: PARIS, Dec. 29  France today formally blocked the planned inauguration of Europe's new monetary system because of an unresolved dispute with West Germany over agricultural subsidies, which the French argue distort the balance of national economic advantage within the Common Market.

title: Greece Joins Europe
description: It is good news indeed that Greece and the European Economic Community have reached agreement on terms for Athens to become a full member of the Common Market. Earlier negotiations had broken up in bitterness, with the Greeks complaining about the harshness of the terms being offered them. Now a renewed effort has succeeded.

title: Obituary 2 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Crane in Tender For Medusa Shares
description: The Crane Company announced it had begun its tender offer for the outstanding shares of the Medusa Corporation, a cement manufacturer.

title: East Carolina 74, Manhattan 71
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 29 (AP)  Oliver Mack scored 31 points and East Carolina withstood a secondhalf effort to defeat Manhattan, 7471, tonight in the opening round of a tournament.

title: Business Records
description: Friday, Dec, 29, 1978

title: Tomjanovich Set To Return Friday
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 29 (UPI) Rudy Tomjanovich, the Houston forward who suffered a broken nose in Wednesday's game against the Detroit Pistons, will probably rejoin the Rockets against the New Jersey Nets next Friday, a club spokesman said today.

title: U.S. Oil Stockpile Low, Inaccessible
description: In 1975, Congress authorized the Department of Energy to set up a strategic petroleum reserve, a stockpile of oil that the United States could use to weather temporary supply disruptions such as the one in Iran. But that reserve will do little to help the nation this time.

title: Cry, Please Cry
description: OCEANSIDE, N.Y.Everyone was so proud of the way she acted at the funeral. All her friends.praised her for being so good and not giving in to her emotions. Admirably, she held back her tears and didn't create a scene.

title: Major Changes Not Anticipated
description: Alan Parter, deputy commissioner of the New York Commission for the United Nations and Consular Corps, said yesterday that he did not expect major changes to occur in the city as a result of the new law.

title: Commodore to Bid For Lafayette Radio
description: Commodore International Ltd., a Californiabased manufacturer of electronic consumer products and metal of fice furniture, announced yesterday a proposal to acquire the Lafayette Radio Electronics Corporation.

title: Richard Browde Marries Holly Tobias, a Student
description: Holly Tobias, daughter of Mrs. Tetsuro Iwabe and Frederick Kenneth Tobias, both of New York, was married yesterday afternoon to Richard Browde, son of Frances Buchman Browde and Anatole Browde, both of St. Louis. Rabbi Martin Zion performed the ceremony at the Vassar Club in New York.

title: One Newark JobLoser Becomes a Big Winner
description: NEWARK, Dec. 29 (UPI)  A woman who was told she would be losing her job in the Newark school system in February, has become the first person to claim the $100,000 top prize in the new Holiday Sweepstakes lottery, state officials said.

title: Recital: Susan Gregory, Soprano
description: Susan Gregory gave a recital a year ago that established her as a soprano worth hearing. She has a bright voice with a clear instrumental timbre, which she generally handles with ease. Miss Gregory has an intelligent. dramatic style, and she makes her choice of program in those terms. Everything about her return appearance in Carnegie Recital Flail on Thursday night confirmed this.

title: Davis Denies He Saw Photos of Dead Judge
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 29 (AP)  T. Cullen Davis, the industrialist, denied today that a Federal Bureau of Investigation informer showed him pictures of what appeared to be the bloodstained body of a Fort Worth judge in an effort to prove that the judge was dead.

title: Damages Denied in Xerox Case
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 29  Although a jury had decided that the Xerox Corporation had engaged in an illegal monopoly of paper copying machines and had said Xerox was liable for $112 million in damages, a Federal judge ruled today that the SCM Corporation was not entitled to any damages from Xerox.

title: A Breach Develops Between Mayor And 2 Unions in City Over Layoffs
description: A breach has developed in the relationship between Mayor Koch and the municipal unions following the Mayor's an nouncement that a modest number of city employees would be laid off in the next six months and a substantial number after that.

title: Koch, at Officer's Rites, Warns Judges
description: Mayor Koch said yesterday at funeral services in Brooklyn for a 49yearold policeman who was shot to death on Thursday that he would not reappoint New York City judges who are not carrying out the law.

title: Turkey Orders Shift of Army Units To Avert a Spread of Terrorist Acts
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Dec. 29  The Turkish military command today ordered a redeployment of its forces to prevent terrorists from shifting their activities to areas exempt from martial law.

title: Diva, Pop Singer and Comedian On the Queen's '79 Honors List
description: LONDON, Dec. 29  Joan Sutherland, Gracie Fields, James Herriot and Olivia NewtonJohn are among prominent figures in Queen Elizabeth's New Year's Honors announced today. Also on the list is Hugh Scanlon, a sharptongued, militant former labor leader, who was named a life peer.

title: CREDIT MARKETS 90Day Bills Near High In Yields
description: Yields advanced yesterday in the Treasury's latest sale of threemonth bills to their highest point since Aug. 26, 1979, when they hit their highest levels ever. Yields for sixmonth bills, however, slipped below the previous week's rate.

title: Atlanta Bank, U.S. In Accord on Rules
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 29 (AP)  The Citizens and Southern National Bank and the Comptroller of the Currency have signed an agreement clearing up a number of questions raised in an examination of the bank in October 1977, bank officers announced today.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TROUBLED TIMES A retrospective of 24 short movies marking the 10th anniversary of Newsreel, a producer and distributor of documentaries on social and political issues dating from 1967, starts today at the Whitney Museum, Madison Avenue at 75th Street, and will continue until Jan. 7 as part of the New American Filmmakers Series.

title: Army Will Test Plan To Let G.I's Amass Educational Benefits
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (UPI)  The Army, concerned with the high dropout rate among volunteers, plans to test a new twoyear enlistment program that will allow high school graduates to accumulate up to $7,400 for their future education.

title: Tenants Rescued from East Side Apartment Blaze
description: Firefighters helping a tenant of 201 East 82d Street down a ladder early yesterday after twoalarm blaze spread quickly through the building. One firefighter and an elderly woman were taken to Lenox Hill Hospital.

title: While Parents Shop, the Children Learn
description: LOS ANGELES  Like many mothera of preschool children, Justine Smith, a San Diego housewife, dreaded shopping. Every time she took her 3yearold son Jason along, he fussed so much that she had no choice but to return home with many, of her errands undone.

title: Getting the Transit System Moving
description: It has been a rough two weeks for the Transit Authority and its subway riders. One man died of a heart attack while fellow passengers tried in vain to get a motorman to stop the train for help. A man and woman were mugged while a conductor apparently ignored. their pleas for aid. A 17yearold girl was Kidnapped from a South Bronx subway station and raped. And two youths were beaten and robbed at gunpoint in a Queens station while one tokenbooth clerk watched and another subsequently refused to get off the phone to let transit police call for assistance.

title: Puerto Rico's Future
description: SAN JUAN, Puerto RicoThe political status of Puerto Rico is currently, as always it seems, under reexamination and intense debate.

title: Entertainment Events
description: METROFOUTAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, Strauss's Elektra, 2:30; Donizetti's Don Pasquale. 8.

title: Blizzard Cuts Scotland's Roads
description: EDINBURGH, Scotland, Dec. 29 (Reuters)  A blizzard struck Scotland today and blocked all but one road to England. Dozens of motorists were stranded in snow near Edinburgh. In northern England, scores of minor roads were flooded after several days of heavy rain.

title: Defense Secretary Visits Base
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (Reuters) Defense Secretary Harold Brown flew to California today for an 11day trip that will combine an inspection of military bases with a vacation.

title: Protests of Shah's Rule Take Gentler Form in Village Near Teheran
description: JAMARAN, Iran, Dec. 29  A burly brickseller named Taripur said bluntly: We are worried now. The gasoline is very scarce.

title: Obituary 4 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: San Jose Moves to Manage Its Growth
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Dec. 27  This city, one of California's oldest, which became a national symbol of unbridled urban growth in the 1960's, still growing in the 1970's. But San Jose is trying to manage its growth now, and there are signs that it is beginning to succeed.

title: News Summary
description: SATURDAY, DECEMBER 30, 1978

title: Letter: On the Right Price for Oil
description: To the Editor:

title: Neediest Cases Fund Helps to Ease Burdens for an Ailing Widow, 70, on Staten Island
description: The New Year is likely to bring few new hopes to Mrs. R., a 70yearold widow who lives alone except for her two cats in a shabby, poorly heated apartment on Staten Island and who must cope with arthritis, a heart condition and painful bunions that require monthly treatments.

title: Mills, Back in the Capital, Gives Tax Advice Again
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28  The phone rang and New York's junior Senator, Daniel Patrick Moynihan, grabbed it. The effervescent Democrat ended the brief conversation with these words: I'll see anybody you tell me to, Wilbur.

title: Nissan Announces '79 Production Plan
description: TOKYO, Dec. 29 (AP)  The Nissan Motor Company has announced its production plan for 1979, showing increased output but fewer exports.

title: Dow Ends Year With Small Loss
description: Putting the finishing touches on a rollercoaster year, the stock market held td an even course yesterday. The New York Stock Exchange showed advancing issues with a slight edge over the losers.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29 (AP)  Gov. eminent food stamp benefits, which now help to feed one out of every 14 Americans, will be increased Monday to help needy families to cope with rising grocery costs.

title: Egypt Raises Some Prices but Holds the Line on Food
description: CAIRO. Dec. 29  The Egyptian Government raised prices for cigarettes and gasoline today, but it promised to continue a subsidy program that keeps the prices of food and other essentials within reach of the millions of poor in this country, sometimes just barely within reach.

title: 9 Die in Seoul Restaurant Fire
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 29 (AP) A kerosene stove overturned in a restaurant here today, causing a fire that spread swiftly and took the lives of pine persons attending a wedding luncheon, the police reported.

title: Morris A. Bonoff, 76, Began Diaper Service That Grew Into Chain
description: Morris A. Bonoff, a pioneer in the diaperservice industry who had retired last year as chairman of the board of the Blessings Corporation, died after a long illness Wednesday at Columbia Memorial Hospital in Hudson, N.Y. Mr. Bonoff, who was 76 years old, maintained homes in New York City and in Hillsdale, N.Y.

title: Schmidt to Invite Communists To Join EmergingNation Fund
description: RUNAWAY BAY, Jamaica, Dec 29, (Reuters)  Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany said today he would propose that the Communist world be invited to join the NorthSouth dialogue, talks aimed at narrowing the economic gap between industrialized and developing nations.

title: Citibank Raises Prime to 11%
description: Citibank fell in line with the rest of the banking industry yesterday and raised its prime rate onequarter percentage point to 11 percent. The prime is the base lending rate that Danics charge their most creditworthy corporate customers.

title: Attacking Youth Crime
description: LOS ANGELESSeveral months ago, Governor Carey signed a bill allowing many juveniles accused of serious crimes to be treated like adult criminals. New York thus followed national trend of passing tough juvenilecrime laws, a trend fueled by the seemingly enormous amount of serious youth crime. In response to the seriousness of the matter, politicians in New York and elsewhere, including such traditional liberals as Senator Edward M. Kennedy, have adopted a tough new approach to juvenile offenders.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in Business Day on Wednesday gave an incorrect figure for a tariff increase on screws. nuts and bolts. The tariff will rise roughly 15 percant over the next three years.

title: About New York
description: They talk of changing neighborhoods, of society in flux, and there is much to that. But on the Lower East Side the face of the place is still largely the same as it was when it reflected the world of our fathers, worn with bottomrung worry lines that are tinged, if you look deeply, with the hope that has made the area an American cliche, like Valley Forge.

title: Taiwan Envoy Leaves U.S. And Assails Administration
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  Taiwan's Ambassador ended a long and frustrating assignment in Washington today with an attack on the Carter Administration, which will sever official relations with his Government on Monday.

title: Fire in Bangkok Home Kills 7
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 29 (AP) A fire swept through a private home here early today, killing a mother, two daughters and four relatives.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Gibson Bars as Illegal a Fiscal Plan To Rehire LaidOff Police Officers
description: NEWARK, Dec. 29 (AP)  Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson yesterday crushed the hopes of Newark police officers for an 11thhour postponement of 200 layoffs in the department, scheduled for this weekend.

title: City Is Being Swept From the Battery to the Bronx
description: There was a muffled roar and a slight cheer in front of Borough Hall on Staten Island yesterday morning as 40 Bronx students began the city's first grand prix of street sweeping.

title: Law for Size Limits On Mergers Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  The Government's chief antitrust officer, John H. Shenefield, said today that he hoped to win Administration support for proposed legislation that would write into antitrust law for the first time an outright size limitation on industrial mergers.

title: Era of Diplomatic Immunity Is Ended for Many Employees of Embassies in the U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  A diplomat's limousine can no longer hit your car and leave you with nothing more than an apology. Nor can the members of the diplomat's staff thumb their noses at unpaid department store or utility bills.

title: The Stage: Melfi's Taxi Tales Opens on Broadway.
description: In Leonard Melfi's earliest Off Off Broadway oneact plays, complete strangers  waifs, waitresses and poets  wearing daffy cartoon names, met and, often without provocation, began revealing deeply personal histories to one another. In Taxi Tales, which opened Thursday at the Century Theater on Broadway, Mr. Melfi's characters are still up to their old tricks. Once, they seemed to have a wayward charm. By now, they seem to be suffering from a case of arrested development.

title: U.S. Plan Due on Use Of Wilderness Lands;  Disputes Are Expected
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 29  Next Thursday morning Bob Bergland, the Secretary of Agriculture, will announce what the United States Forest Service wants to do with 62 million acres of potential wilderness in national forests.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: ISAAC ALCALAY DIES; FORMER CHIEF RABBI
description: Isaac A. Alcalay, retired Chief Rabbi of the Central Sephardic Jewish Community of America, died yesterday at the Sephardic Home in Brooklyn. He was 97 years old.

title: Falcons' Swarm Defense Challenge to Cowboys
description: IRVING, Tex., Dec. 29  Dan Reeves, the offensive coordinator, likened them to a swarm of bees. Roger Staubach, the quarterback, said it posed an unusual challenge. And Charlie Waters, a defensive back, couldn't wait to see what plays Coach Tom Landry would call during the game.

title: Hiker Safe after 150Foot Fall
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., Dec: 29 (UPI)  Mary Hoeft, 46 years old, who survived a 150foot fall down a cliff in the Sandia mountains Wednesday, was in satisfactory, condition today. She slipped and fell down a steep cliff while hiking on a trail. Rescue units worked several hours to remove her from the mountain.

title: 27 Americans to Arrive in Peking To Report on Opening of Relations
description: The rush is on. Twentyseven American correspondents, photographers, television producers and technicians are arriving in China on twoweek visas to report on the normalization of relations between China and the United States that begins officially on Monday.

title: Australia Leads England During Third Cricket Test
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 29 (Reuters)  Graeme Wood, the Australian opening batsman, hit an unbeaten century here today to take his side to a safe 243 for four at close of play on the first day of the third test against England.

title: Dr. Thomas I. Hoen, 75; Leader in Neurosurgery
description: Dr. Thomas I. Hoen, professor emeritus of neurosurgery and former chairman of the department at the New York University School of Medicine, died Dec. 20 at the age of 75 at his home in Lawrence, L.I.

title: Cider Pressed From the Big Apple
description: DES MOINES, IowaA cowboy's notes after a first trip to New York:

title: Explosion at Center Cancels Cubans Performances
description: The second and third performances of popular orchestra from Cuba were cancelled at Avery Fisher Hall in Lincoln Center last night because of a bomb explosion at the hall that followed its first performance the previous evening.

title: 57th and Fifth: A Holiday Magnet for the World
description: There is always a parade on Fifth Avenue, and the spot for any intrepid photographer to view it, especiall during the frenzied last week of the year, is the corner of 57th Street. It is a parade of style, of life and of fashion, within a stone's throw of Tiffany's, Bonwit Teller's and Bergdorf Goodman's.

title: Blaze Kills 9 in an English Home For Discharged Mental Patients
description: CLACTONONSEA, England,. Dec. 29 (UPI)  Fire swept through a 15room lodging house for discharged psychiatric patients today, causing the'death of nine, officials reported.

title: Maryland 62, St Joseph's 56 Southern Cal. 78, Holy Cross 60
